{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"How The Other History of the DC Universe Uses Minority Lens | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-other-history-dc-universe-minority-lens/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/other-history-dc-universe-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/john-ridley/\">John Ridley</a>'s <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-other-history-of-the-dc-universe/\">The Other History of the DC Universe</a> </em>was announced two years ago. Now, the author is revealing more details about his upcoming book --particularly why he chose to tell the story from a minority lens.</p><p>Ridley told <a href=\"https://www.polygon.com/comics/2020/9/3/21408118/dc-comics-alternate-history-other-black-lightning-john-ridley-interview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Polygon</a>, \"for me going into it, it was less about just rehashing, say, <i>Crisis on Infinite Earths</i>, but really getting into, say, a character’s difficult relationship with Superman. If you’re a character of color, and you’re faced with bias, and you’re faced with intolerance, and you see an individual who is literally an alien but because of his forward-facing facade, his visage — his passport is stamped. And at the same time, when people have a difficult relationship with anyone, but something like <i>Crisis on Infinite Earths</i> happens and Supergirl is killed? How do characters react? How do they react to Superman, and how do they reconcile how they felt about this individual? But at the same time, he was out there trying to do right, he was out there trying to do certain things.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-worlds-finest-influenced-work/\"> John Ridley Reveals the DC Series That Was Most Influential to His Work</a></span></p><p>He elaborated, \"Even little things. When Batman labels his group 'The Outsiders'— on one hand it just sounds like 'Hey, we’re kind of these rogue fighters who don’t quite fit in with the Justice League.' But on the other hand, what does it say [to] the Black hero and the Japanese hero, or Geo-Force, who is [also] a foreigner? And they’re all labeled the Outsiders? And how do they feel about things like that?\"</p><p>Ridley added, \"So to me, it’s less about just going back and saying, <i>Hey, in the ’80s, it was this big event. Hey, in the ’90s, it was this big event</i>, but really saying within these big events on a human level — Think about any crisis that’s going on right now. We have maybe some shared collective opinions about things. Obviously, we’re a very broad country, we don’t all think alike, but individually, how we look at these events, how we feel, how we react to them as people, how we then go back and interact with other people based on these changes, and the nomenclature and how our politicians treat them.\"</p><p>He concluded, \"That, to me is what I wanted to get into <i>The Other History</i>, that it wasn’t just recounting history, but looking at it from perspectives of people of color, of women, of people from the LGBTQ community, of people of different ages. For us it was really [about] trying to create as much of a plurality of perspectives as possible. And that is the great thing, over time DC has built it up. For me it was about trying to take all of these narratives and then weave them together, but allow that weaving to travel through events that comic book readers should know and remember. And in cases where they don’t, I hope they want to go back to those stories and <i>Oh, I forgot about a moment when John Stewart destroyed a planet. What was that like for him</i>?\"</p><p>Written by John Ridley and drawn by Giuseppe Camuncoli and Andrea Cucchi. <em>The Other History of the DC Universe </em>is set to hit shelves Nov. 24.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-dc-project-batman-person-of-color/\">John Ridley Reveals New DC Project --'47% Chance This Batman is a Person of Color'</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 23:10:48 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/other-history-dc-universe-header.jpg","linkMd5":"f79812bd54833bc8960a281507977f22","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn14@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-29-618_89e1314c3ad9524e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":288235,"destBytes":254804,"author":"Evangelia Galanis","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/other-history-dc-universe-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn14@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-29-618_89e1314c3ad9524e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989067},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Wolverine Vs Wonder Woman: Who Would Win? | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-vs-wonder-woman-who-would-win/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Upward-Slant-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>The overtly violent <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wolverine/\">Wolverine</a> is known for his extreme methods and total (mostly) lack of empathy in any course of action he takes, making him one of the hardest opponents to actually hold down in battle. If it's not his Adamantium body, it's his drive to win, or his mental fortitude, or one of many other character features that maintain his highly dangerous status in mutant society.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-old-man-logan-best-wolverine/\">5 Reasons Old Man Logan Is The Best Wolverine (&#38; 5 He Isn't)</a></span></p><p>On the contrary, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-woman/\">Wonder Woman</a> is generally peaceful, preferring to solve problems with her words rather than with her fists — but, simultaneously, it is obvious that she would give everything in her possession in order to snatch victory straight from the jaws of defeat. Pitting these two contradictory characters against each other would be quite fun, indeed.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Wonder Woman: Magic</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wonder-Woman-Magic.jpg' /></figure><p>Princess <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-scarlet-witch/\">Diana might not be able to claim Scarlet Witch</a>'s magical mastery, but she has had access to incredible sorcerial skills during her life (when her witch-mark of power is triggered by her conflict with the Upside-Down Man.)</p><p>It is said that her magical talents are completely different from the usual DC brand, which serves to add a layer of mystery to Wonder Woman's already ridiculous power levels. Interestingly, at that point, even she had no idea what, how or where she had obtained these new abilities from.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Wolverine: Adamantium</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/05.-HATE-Wolverine-Claws-Popped-Explosion-Fire.jpg' /></figure><p>This is easily <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-10-ways-wolverine-has-changed-over-the-years/\">the most iconic feature of Wolverine</a>, coupled with the *snikt* produced every time he unsheathes his claws. Although originally made of bone, they were later imbued with Adamantium under Weapon X's gentle guidance, giving him weapons both razor-sharp and practically unbreakable.</p><p>This can be quite dangerous for Wonder Woman, as she usually tends to rely on a single weapon rather than a flurry of flying blades. Would the Shield of Themyscira survive his claws, though?</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Wonder Woman: Paraphernalia</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/wonder-woman-explaining-lasso.jpg' /></figure><p>This is a category in which Wonder Woman is almost consistently well-prepared — who else can lay claim to bracelets that possess limitless durability as well as the capacity to deflect hard projectiles, energy rays, and so on.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-mystique-who-would-win/\">Wonder Woman Vs. Mystique: Who Would Win?</a></span></p><p>If this doesn't work, the Lasso of Truth can be brought out against Wolverine, trapping him within its fiery grasp for as long as her willpower holds out (and that can go on forever). On the opposite end, Logan doesn't really have that much going for him in the equipment department, and certainly nothing that can fare well against Diana's.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Wolverine: Rage Mode</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wolverine-1.jpg' /></figure><p>For <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-confusing-things-explained/\">a man who can be extremely zen when he needs to be</a> (offering eulogies for dead deer and cursed katanas), Wolverine is known for his so-called \"berserker\" style of combat, in which his higher brain functions are pretty much reduced into their basest, most animalistic instincts.</p><p>In this mode, he is nearly impossible to defend against, as he manifests the hyper-aggressive tendencies of the animal from whom he gets his name. In other words: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/things-wolverine-should-use-powers-missed-opportunities/\">a cornered Wolverine is far too risky</a> to attack.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Wonder Woman: Combat</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Wonder-Woman-Dead-Earth-Fight-1.jpg' /></figure><p>Wolverine is supremely proficient in various martial arts, from hand-to-hand to pugilism to multiple tiers of weaponry (and his age has allowed him more experience than the opponents he usually faces).</p><p>He will still lose to Wonder Woman in this department though, because her skills alone outshine his by a mile, not to forget that she has been practicing for thousands of years, compared to his hundred or so. Add this to her agility, velocity, response-time, and flexibility, and it's nearly impossible to see Wolverine coming out of this unscathed.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Wolverine: Assassination</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wolverine-Assassin.jpg' /></figure><p>For someone with his general aura of hostility, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-wolverine-common-misconceptions/\">it comes as no surprise that Wolverine</a> also happens to be a rather stealthy assassin (the act of aloofness helps him avoid being discovered or caught in several situations).</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-wolverine-ranking-every-love-interest/\">Every Love Interest Of Wolverine, Ranked</a></span></p><p>He is also competent at tracking his quarry, sniffing them out with a combination of physical clues, odors, energy patterns; it's not always clear, to be honest. Therefore, while Diana waits to have her battle with him, in a fair and unbiased environment, Wolverine could, technically, sneak into her home and massacre in her sleep. Or at least try.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Wonder Woman: Divine Powers</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Screenshot-2020-06-11-at-5.13.39-PM.jpg' /></figure><p>This feature of Princess Diana all but cinches the round for her: with all the blessings and gifts offered to her by the Olympian Gods, she is durable against nearly all types of attacks, her physical strength around the same level as that of Superman, and she can also fly around the battlefield, perhaps including this as part of her dodging patterns.</p><p>Her immunity to pain is probably similar to Wolverine's, and though each of them have augmented recuperative powers, Wonder Woman's tactical skills tilt the scales in her favor.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Wolverine: The Best There Is</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/wolverine-by-frank-miller.jpg' /></figure><p>Wolverine believes himself to be \"The Best There is\", suggesting that he is superior at what he does than anyone else, regardless of their backstory. The Office of National Emergency, better known as O*N*E*, has categorized Logan under \"Severe Threat,\" a tier occupied by the likes of Cable, Mystique and Storm.</p><p>Similarly, S.H.I.E.L.D. data pegs him at around \"Power Level 9\", much like it does Iron Man. Wolverine is definitely a serious deal, but the ancient question remains: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xmen-wolverine-cyclops-important-mutant/\">Will Jean ever choose him over Scott</a>?</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Tie: Bond With Animals</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wolverine-Wonder-Woman-Animal-Bond.jpg' /></figure><p>If this isn't a strange thing to find in common between these two characters, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-harley-quinn-who-would-win/\">consider that Harley Quinn</a> is also one of the biggest animal-lovers in the DC universe.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-emma-frost-who-would-win/\">Wonder Woman Vs Emma Frost: Who Would Win?</a></span></p><p>Wonder Woman is able to reach out to any variety of creature, even \"manipulating\" them on her behest whenever necessary. Wolverine, being borderline feral in the first place, is likewise capable of exchanging information with animals, but at a slightly more limited pace than Diana.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Winner: Wonder Woman</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/wonder-woman-mikel-janin-header.jpg' /></figure><p>Wolverine is strong, stronger than most, but he's not Wonder Woman, and not by a long shot. She, the Princess Diana, is the heir to the Amazon race, which by itself bestows her with enough strength to best Weapon X.</p><p>However, taking into account that her genetic father is Zeus, the literal king of the Greek Gods, puts her far beyond the (relatively) mediocre mutant abilities possessed by her opponent. Wonder Woman will take this match, and in her benevolence, will not kill Wolverine (not that he would die so easily, anyway).</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-wolverine-best-worst-moments/\">X-Men: 5 Times Wolverine Was The Best Mutant (&#38; 5 He Was The Worst)</a></span></p>\n                        \n 5/06-56-35-157_be90acbda1cde536.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/wonder-woman-mikel-janin-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn33@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-43-601_1d8836c770b2d360.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989066},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The Misfit of Demon King Academy: Anos Faces a Supposedly Reborn Hero","link":"https://www.cbr.com/misfit-of-demon-king-academy-anos-faces-revisionist-history-supposedly-reborn-hero/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/eleanor-bianca-happy.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: the following contains spoilers for Episode 9 of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-misfit-of-demon-king-academy/\">The Misfit of Demon King Academy</a>, now streaming on Crunchyroll.</strong></em></p><p>2,000 years in the past, Anos <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-misfit-of-demon-king-academy-episode-7-emilia-anos-clash-pride/\">the demon king </a>faced the great Hero Kanon and his ally Jerga, and while Kanon was interested in diplomacy, Jerga was not. And the battle may still not be over.</p><p>Now, in the present, Anos and his classmates visit the Hero academy, Arclanskia, in a student exchange program. But the academy for Heroes might be hiding a few lies and secrets.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-misfit-of-demon-king-academy-episode-5-anos-shin-ray/\">The Misfit of Demon King Academy: Anos' Old Friend is a Welcome Sight</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jerga-attacking-anos.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-misfit-of-demon-king-academy-episode-7-ray-pressure-defeat-anos/\">Anos and his friends Ray</a>, Sasha, Misha and Misa arrive via teleport near Arclanskia in the human realm, and they do a little sightseeing before Anos leads the gang to the one and only Hero academy. It's situated on a lake, with bridges leading to campus, and Anos throws open the front gates. It's not long before a student there, Eleanor Bianca, welcomes Anos' squad after learning who they are, as people can't visit campus without permission. Eleanor is friendly enough, and shows Anos' gang the extensive library of Arclanskia, but that is where things get awkward.</p><p>They teach history here at Arclanskia, but not the history that Anos remembers. Eleanor tells them the tale of the great Hero Kanon conjuring four great magic walls that divided the world into quarters, in order to protect the human realm from the demon realm. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/misfit-of-demon-king-academy-anos-name-mission/\">Obviously that's a piece of revisionist history</a>, but Anos can't bring himself to contradict Eleanor while she's telling the tale. She also says that the great demon king from the Age of Chaos was a certain Avos Dilhevia, proving that this conspiracy extends to the human realm. Anos certainly has his work cut out for him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-episode-162-mugino-worst-sensei-ever/\">The Boruto Anime Just Gave Naruto's Son His WORST Sensei Ever</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/two-hero-students-in-library.jpg\"/></figure><p>But Eleanor has another interesting tale to tell: the reincarnation of the Hero Kanon. According to her, Kanon and Jerga formed the Kanon Jerga reincarnation family, where Kanon had seven sources that have each been reborn into seven different people. All the humans here are certain that their legendary defender is now a whole squad, but Anos is skeptical. He is sure that Kanon had just one real source and six duds, so he wants to find the \"real\" reincarnation and and deal with just them. Anos was there when he faced Kanon and his overly eager agent Jerga, and knows that Jerga was a reckless man who attacked unprovoked, while Kanon was interested in diplomacy. Anos has every reason to find Kanon's true reincarnation and get some help setting the record straight.</p><p>Speaking of which, two so-called reincarnations of Kanon arrive. The first is a bookish student named Ledriano Kanon Azeschen, who is not entirely pleased to see Demon King students here. Right after him comes the hulking Laos Kanon Jilfor, who is ready to prove himself in combat. He charges at Anos, who uses a mere blink of his eyes to knock Laos back. Already, Anos is making enemies here at Arclanskia, and he's making slow headway toward finding the true Kanon (and dispelling the revisionist myth of Avos Dihelvia). Worse yet, Eleanor explains something strange to Anos: 2,000 years ago, Kanon was killed not by a demon, but by a fellow human. The mystery deepens.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/yu-gi-oh-kaibas-ultimate-revenge-plan-was-a-theme-park/\">Yu-Gi-Oh!: Kaiba's Ultimate Revenge Plan Was... a Theme Park?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 02:00:21 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/eleanor-bianca-happy.jpg","linkMd5":"75a6129a75ae49d91eeb91e656c3b7e6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn86@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-29-186_bb3c748afedebf04.webp","destWidth":1800,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":74110,"destBytes":74110,"author":"Louis Kemner","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/eleanor-bianca-happy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn86@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-29-186_bb3c748afedebf04.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jerga-attacking-anos.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-43-297_adeecec69fd25346.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/two-hero-students-in-library.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn54@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-39-066_63eb5dcdf20f8a57.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989063},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Naruto: 5 Reasons Why Isshiki Is The Strongest Otsutsuki (& 5 It Is Kaguya)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-reasons-why-isshiki-kaguya-strongest-otsutsuki/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-Kaguya.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Otsutsuki clan is central to the story of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/boruto/\">Boruto: Naruto Next Generations</a></em> and has introduced quite a lot of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-otsutsuki-clan-little-known-trivia/\">parasitic aliens belonging to this clan</a>, such as Momoshiki Otsutsuki, who appeared as the main antagonist of the Chunin Exams arc, and of course, Isshiki Otsutsuki, who was the leader of the Kara organization.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-reasons-jiraiya-return-good-why-bad/\">Boruto: 5 Reasons Why Jiraiya's Return Is Good (&#38; 5 Why It Is Bad)</a></span></p><p>Isshiki Otsutsuki is thought to be one of the strongest known characters in the story right now and often draws comparison to <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/naruto/\">Naruto's</a></em> final villain, Kaguya Otsutsuki. Here are 5 reasons why Isshiki Otsutsuki is the strongest known Otsutsuki in history and 5 it is Kaguya.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Isshiki: Defeated Both Naruto And Sasuke</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-rods-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Isshiki Otsutsuki is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-characters-who-can-challenge-isshiki-otsutsuki-ranked-strength/\">one of the very few characters in Narutoverse capable of taking on both Naruto Uzumaki and Sasuke Uchiha</a> in battle.</p><p>Even though he was severely nerfed due to being in Jigen's body, Isshiki was able to hold his own against the two and when he unleashed a bit more of his power, he completely overwhelmed them without much trouble, sealing one and almost killing the other.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Kaguya: Defeated By Team 7</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kaguya-Otsutsuki-Rabbit-Goddess.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-characters-kaguya-otsutsuki-fight-ranked/\">Kaguya Otsutsuki was quite powerful herself</a>, as was expected of the last villain of the <em>Naruto</em> series. She was quite a menace for anyone to deal with, and was able to largely outclass Naruto and Sasuke in battle.</p><p>To defeat her, entire Team 7 had to combine their efforts, and even then, they only had a small opportunity to seal her away. It goes without saying that Naruto and Sasuke alone wouldn't have been able to defeat her.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Isshiki: Overpowered Ocular Jutsu</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-eye-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Isshiki, being an Otsutsuki clan member, has access to some of the most incredible powers, such as the Ocular Jutsu known as Sukunohikona.</p><p>Using this power, Isshiki Otsutsuki is able to shrink anything down to microscopic sizes instantly. This power prevents him from any harm coming to him as anything dangerous coming near him is instantly reduced in size.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Kaguya: Rinne-Sharingan</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kaguya-Otsutsuki-Naruto-Shippuden.jpg' /></figure><p>Kaguya Otsutsuki had quite an impressive power up her sleeve as well. After eating the chakra fruit that was born of the God Tree of Earth, she got access to the Rinne-Sharingan.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-mitsuki-should-be-anime-protagonist/\">Boruto: 5 Reasons Why Mitsuki Should Have Been The Protagonist (5 Reasons Why Boruto Is Perfect)</a></span></p><p>This Dojutsu gave her access to incredible power and allowed her to cast Infinite Tsukuyomi on mankind. Furthermore, it also gave her access to multiple dimensions which, thanks to her massive chakra reserves, she could keep track of quite well.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Isshiki: Sealing Jutsu</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jigen-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>If having monstrous physical strength wasn't enough, Isshiki also has access to one of the most overpowered Sealing Jutsu in the world of <em>Naruto</em>.</p><p>Using this technique, he was able to trap Naruto Uzumaki in a giant vessel and shrink it down to an extremely small size. Breaking this seal is impossible without Isshiki's help and the only other way around this Jutsu is a Space-Time Ninjutsu ability.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Kaguya: Almost Killed Isshiki</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Kaguya-Otsutsuki-1.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-all-otsutsuki-clan-members-ranked-strength/\">Kaguya Otsutsuki was partnered with Isshiki Otsutsuki</a> when she first came to Earth. The two were to harvest the chakra fruit of the planet as they did on many other planets, however, Kaguya ultimately betrayed Isshiki.</p><p>After attacking him, she left him in a near-death state which would've seen him die had Jigen, a monk, not crossed his path. By using Sukunohikona, he was able to shrink himself and enter his body to steal his nutrients. Nonetheless, Kaguya nearly eliminated him with minimal effort, showing she was, indeed, a threat to him.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Isshiki: Daikokuten</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Along with having the power to shrink objects, Isshiki has another overpowered ability that allows him to store anything that he's shrunk into a pocket dimension where time doesn't seem to affect them.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-uzumakis-strongest-jutsu/\">Naruto Uzumaki's 15 Strongest Jutsu, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Anything stored there can be instantly summoned by him, as seen during his fight against Koji, where he was able to crush him with giant structures within an instant by summoning them from a pocket dimension. With power as great as that, Isshiki is certainly one to be feared.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Kaguya: Expansive Truth-Seeking Ball</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Expansive-Truth-Seeking-Ball.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-villains-most-powerful-weakest/\">Kaguya Otsutsuki had enough power to blow up an entire space-time</a> and recreate the world from scratch had she wished it. Although this technique cost her greatly in terms of chakra, it also offered a certain victory for her.</p><p>Kaguya's power was beyond anything that fans had seen at the time and her Truth-Seeking Ball remains to be the greatest power in the series even now.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Isshiki: Too Powerful Chakra</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jigen.jpg' /></figure><p>Isshiki Otsutsuki's chakra is described to be way too powerful and sinister. According to the Amado, if he's allowed to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-known-karma-powers-ranked-strength/\">resurrect in the body of Kawaki at his full power using Karma</a>, he would grow strong enough to effortlessly destroy the Earth,  which just goes to show how much power this monster wields.</p><p>Isshiki's chakra is comparable to that of Kaguya Otsutsuki, and at full-power, might be even greater than hers.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Kaguya: All-Killing Ash Bones</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/all-killing-ash-bones.jpg' /></figure><p>One of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-abilities-beyond-kekkei-genkai-more-powerful/\">Kaguya's multiple instant-kill powers</a> was All-Killing Ash Bones. This technique was quite similar to the Kaguya clan's Shikotsumyaku and allowed her to manipulate her skeletal structure at will.</p><p>Just one hit from this technique would disintegrate any person, as seen when it killed Obito Uchiha with very little effort. Undoubtedly, Kaguya's techniques were far more lethal than those of Isshiki Otsutsuki.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-5-ways-naruto-changed-throughout-the-show-5-times-he-regressed/\">Naruto: 5 Ways Naruto Changed Throughout The Show (&#38; 5 Times He Regressed)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 00:00:31 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-Kaguya.jpg","linkMd5":"f9693e2181db9532b85e2bfaeaa0af5c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn46@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-428_24b553d314168365.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":56436,"destBytes":56436,"author":"Rei Penber","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-Kaguya.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn46@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-428_24b553d314168365.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-rods-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn35@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-35-779_7c8e4eed6c203b46.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kaguya-Otsutsuki-Rabbit-Goddess.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn11@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-37-137_676e00a84aad75e2.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-eye-Cropped.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kaguya-Otsutsuki-Naruto-Shippuden.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn85@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-41-620_d93d6900d40b5e23.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jigen-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn65@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-34-123_3b3853ee5f8178e9.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Kaguya-Otsutsuki-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn94@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-38-634_32f059f5c162e0dc.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Isshiki-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn98@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-38-631_2e61acc096484100.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Expansive-Truth-Seeking-Ball.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn86@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-40-817_711a877258ae951f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jigen.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/all-killing-ash-bones.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-36-511_474dfc384decf6ac.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989066},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"5 Reasons To Be Hyped For Crunchyroll's High Guardian Spice (& 5 Reasons To Be Worried)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyroll-high-guardian-spice-hyped-worried/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/High-Guardian-Spice-Crunchyroll-Original.jpg\"/></figure><p>While the anime streaming service, Crunchyroll is best known for its large catalog of anime, viewers are beginning to see the beginning of \"Crunchyroll Originals\". From <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-webtoons-need-tower-of-god-treatment/\">adaptations of Webtoons</a> to completely original anime themselves, Crunchyroll's initiative has opened up a world of new possibilities and new series for fans to get into. One such original series is an animated series by the name of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/high-guardian-spice/\">High Guardian Spice</a>.</em></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/high-guardian-spice-facts/\">10 Things You Need To Know About High Guardian Spice</a></span></p><p>Set in a world of magic and fantasy, it stars four girls that go to a special academy where they'll train to become guardians of their city. While it seems pretty simple and straight forward, there's a lot about this title to be excited about, and a few things to be worried about too.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Excited: Animation With A Nice Blend Of Styles</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Rosemary-High-Guardian-Spice.jpg' /></figure><p>While it's hard to call <em>High Guardian Spice </em>an anime, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/american-cartoons-influenced-by-anime/\">it's clear that it has a lot of anime influences</a>. With a style the blends the eastern and western animation, what is fairly certain so far is that this upcoming series will stand out among the other Crunchyroll Originals in a visual sense.</p><p>It seemingly has taken notes from other fantasy-related media, with hints of inspiration from magical girl anime, mixed together with a bit of western style that makes it reminiscent of cartoons like <em>The Owl House </em>or <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/questions-about-steven-universe-answered/\">Steven Universe</a></em>. It'll definitely be an interesting cocktail of styles to be sure.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Worried: Style Over Substance?</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rosemary-High-Guardian-Spice-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>While style is definitely an important part of an animated series, there does need to be some substance behind it to really get the viewer's hooked on it. So far, <em>High Guardian Spice's </em>plot is rather vague, so it's not entirely clear what the series is actually about just yet.</p><p>What is known is that'll be about the four ensemble girls training to become guardians, but that's about it. Details about this show's story seem to be hidden for now until it's finally released, which might be intentional (saving the good stuff for the right time) but it does create the unease that the series might be style over substance.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Excited: It's Been Developed By A Diverse Creative Team</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Raye-Rodriguez-Creator-of-High-Guardian-Spice-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-men-and-women-racially-diverse-backgrounds/\">Diversity is very important</a>, and it's something that the animation industry as a whole could be more open to. In the case of <em>High Guardian Spice, </em>it seems like a diverse team is exactly what it brings to the table.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyroll-vs-funimation-which-better-catalog-anime/\">Crunchyroll VS Funimation: Which One Has The Better Catalog?</a></span></p><p>It would've been easy just to make a diverse cast of characters, but creator Raye Rodriguez (seen above) has employed a wide variety of different people to help develop the show too. <em>High Guardian Spice </em>could have the potential to open the door for more diverse animators and animation teams to have the spotlight like never before.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Worried: A Lot Of Newcomers</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/High-Guardian-Spice-Concept-Art-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>While diversity in a creative team is good, it's also good when the quality of their work speaks for itself. For <em>High Guardian Spice, </em>its creative team has a lot of unknowns and newcomers who haven't had a lot of prior work to speak for this show's quality.</p><p>This in no way implies that newcomers can't pull off something impressive, but there's not a lot of previous work from the known creative team behind this show that immediately translates to how it'll play out. For now, that seems to be unclear.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Excited: A Distinct Variety Of Characters</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Pitch-Concept-High-Guardian-Spice.jpg' /></figure><p>While not much of <em>High Guardian Spice </em>has been shown off, the one thing that has been was its character designs for both the core ensemble and quite a few supporting characters too. Not much is known about Rosemary and company, what can be said is that all of these character designs are so varied and distinct from one another.</p><p>Each character's look is not just diverse but also eye-catching, making each one feel unique when compared to another. From what little has been seen, they also have the potential to be incredibly expressive and maybe even become recognizable thanks to their distinct designs.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Worried: Vague Characterization So Far</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/High-Guardian-Spice-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>While the show does have characters that are all varied and uniquely designed, their personalities so far remain vague. Since there has been no proper trailer about the series itself, there's no way to gauge just what kind of characters Rosemary or the others actually are.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyroll-anime-awards-winners-loved-hated-controversy/\">The Crunchyroll Anime Awards: 5 Winners Fans Loved And 5 That Caused Controversy</a></span></p><p>From the promotional images, it seems like Rosemary is the happy-go-lucky adventurous type and Thyme seems to be more of the strong aloof one, but there's only so much that one can get from a few images alone. Without a trailer that introduces these characters to the audience first, it may be hard for viewers to get invested.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Excited: It Looks Like A Fun Fantasy Romp</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/High-Guardian-Spice.jpg' /></figure><p>With bright colors and a world that's seemingly full of magic and mythical beings, <em>High Guardian Spice </em>seems to be promising a fun little fantasy adventure, with a colorful cast of characters.</p><p>The core cast does give off a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dd-popular-subclass-why-pick-them/\"><em>D&#38;D</em> campaign party</a> vibe, though an adorable and fun looking one to be sure. While the world that the characters inhabit isn't fully apparent, the angle of a fantastical school has been done before with some great success, so it may be interesting to see how <em>High Guardian Spice </em>goes about it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Worried: It Feels A Little Familiar</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/The-World-of-RWBY-Header.png' /></figure><p>It's not always about who does something first, but who does it better. Though originality is very much welcomed nonetheless. For <em>High Guardian Spice, </em>not much of its story or premise has been made clear yet, other than the four girls going to a magical academy to be guardians. What is known about it, does feel rather familiar.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/god-high-school-manhwa-making-of-anime/\">10 Things We Just Learned About The Making Of The God Of High School</a></span></p><p>Shows like <em>Soul Eater, RWBY, </em>and <em>Little Witch Academia </em>have has a similar setup like <em>High Guardian Spice, </em>but each has managed to remain distinct from each other, but what <em>Spice </em>brings to the table is unknown. The hurdle it needs to clear is to take the familiar premise and setting and make them it's own.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Excited: Crunchyroll Originals Have A Good Track Record So Far</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/god-of-high-school-header.jpg' /></figure><p>From <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tower-of-god-vs-the-god-of-high-school-which-is-the-best-manhwa-anime-adaption/\"><em>Tower of God </em>to </a><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tower-of-god-vs-the-god-of-high-school-which-is-the-best-manhwa-anime-adaption/\">The God of High School</a>, </em>Crunchyroll Originals have made quite a splash in recent memory, with many more on the way. The movement so far has been a great success and aims to go further and higher, with a whole slate of varied and interesting titles, <em>High Guardian Spice </em>is one of them.</p><p>While not every Crunchyroll Original has been widely praised, their track record of quality has been impressive. <em>High Guardian Spice </em>has some big shoes to fill already, but if what came before it is any indication of how these shows are handled, it might just be a grand success.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Worried: It Was Supposed To Be Out In 2019</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Crunchyroll-Originals-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Believe it or not, <em>High Guardian Spice </em>was the first-ever original program that was announced for Crunchyroll and was going to lead the charge for Crunchyroll Originals. It was supposed to have come out in 2019, but <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/delayed-anime-2020-coronavirus/\">due to some delays, it was pushed back</a>.</p><p>Delays can sometimes make or break a project, and while it's good that it's not being rushed out the door, it isn't clear why it's been delayed and a little strange that <em>High Guardian Spice </em>is waiting behind so many other Crunchyroll Originals. It is now 2020 and there's still no word of when it will be released other than this year.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/awesome-anime-stream-crunchyroll-now/\">10 Awesome Anime You Didn't Know You Can Stream On Crunchyroll Right Now</a></span></p>\n                        \n
