+0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Power-Girl.jpg","linkMd5":"ea07cd09fe6931705ca7433d12f4bc3e","destWidth":1800,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":129588,"destBytes":129588,"author":"Sam Hutchinson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Power-Girl.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-Girl-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn66@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-42-171_08fb6174b1755121.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/pjimage-3-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn56@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-36-001_a1b5e1d3485aef6d.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kryptonite.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/stan-lee-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn12@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-36-591_9699e1fd9a7b9cab.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Power-Girl.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-41-270_b3842572a0fd8a20.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Power-Girl.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn86@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-39-362_941707c7cf80446d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Mr-Terrific.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn27@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-103_07f562850ac139c0.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Power-Girl-Harley-Quinn.jpeg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Power-Girl-Incapacitated-By-Wood-in-Supergirl.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn37@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-34-057_f4f0d35a75b01d66.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989071},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Lucifer: Michael Had the Wrong Plan in Season 5 | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-season-5-michael-wrong-plan/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-S5E2-Michael-Wings.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following article contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/lucifer-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Lucifer</a> Season 5, Part 1, available now on Netflix.</strong></em></p><p>At the end of Season 4 of Netflix's <em>Lucifer</em>, the title character left Chloe and the life he had built for himself to return to Hell. In his prolonged absence, certain demons had started to rebel against him, and he had to return to claim his throne and get everyone back in line. As Season 5 began, fans saw Lucifer continue to act as warden of Hell, but another person who looked just like him returned in Chloe's life. This doppelganger was actually the archangel Michael, Lucifer's twin brother. Michael resents Lucifer for many reasons, but especially because he always felt Lucifer acted as if he was better than him.</p><p>Throughout the eight-episode long first half of the season, Michael played an intricate game to get his revenge on his brother. Some of his plots worked, while others less so. However, the truth is, Michael could have easily won, he just had the completely wrong plan.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-why-the-show-goes-black-white-for-an-entire-episode/\">Lucifer: Why The Show Goes Black &#38; White For An Entire Episode</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-season-5-Michael-Chloe.jpg\"/></figure><p>When Michael first arrived on Earth, he started by posing as Lucifer. His goal was to take his brother's place, gaining the trust of his friends and loved ones until he would finally be ready to strike and dismantle the life Lucifer had built. This plan was, of course, all built around Chloe. Michael hoped that he would be able to seduce her and even sleep with her, something that would be sure to be torturous for her as well as Lucifer when the truth would be revealed.</p><p>However, things didn't work out that way at all. In fact, almost as soon as she saw him, Chloe knew this Lucifer wasn't the real deal. She played him until she was finally ready to confront him, at which point Michael revealed his true self. Then, the real Lucifer returned to stop his brother's rampage, placing Amenadiel in charge of Hell while he cleaned up Michael's mess. Lucifer then spent a bit of time reconnecting with Chloe while Michael disappeared. Then, Amenadiel later returned, revealing that God had told him Hell was no longer in need of a warden, allowing him to return home to his newborn son Charlie.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-michael-disappointing-season-5-villain/\">Lucifer: Michael Is A Disappointing Season 5 Villain</a></span></p><p>As for Michael, he only returned later on, revealing Lucifer's real, demonic nature to Dan. While this dismantled one of the stable friendships in Lucifer's life, it didn't have the intended effect. Indeed, Dan turned on Lucifer but when Chloe's life ended up being in danger, the two were able to put their differences aside to rescue the missing detective. Then, Michael continued to toy with both Maze and Amenadiel, turning the former against Lucifer and tormenting the latter by manipulating his fears.</p><p>All of this was part of his continuing plan to get revenge on Lucifer, but the bigger picture was never really made clear. And yet, there is something else Michael could have done instead, something that would have completely uprooted Lucifer's life, and endangered the entire world. In reality, it's simple: instead of taking Lucifer's place on Earth, he should have just taken his place in Hell.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-season-5-reveals-why-devil-can-be-hurt/\">Lucifer Reveals Why the Devil Can Be Hurt</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-Season-4-Hell-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>When Amenadiel returned to Earth, he left Hell without a warden. This would have been the perfect opportunity for Michael to take his twin's place as ruler of the underworld. In this new role, Michael could have completely changed Hell and turned all of the demons on Lucifer -- if not the entire world. In fact, in Season 4, fans saw the amount of trouble a small number of demons set loose upon Los Angeles could cause. However, with Michael in Hell, he could have set loose hundreds more on the world to make Lucifer's life a living hell.</p><p>Of course, since there is still a whole second half of Season 5 that has yet to be released, Michael's full plan is still a mystery. It's possible that this really is his endgame, and fans certainly hope so, because it would set up one hell of a final season.</p><p><em>Lucifer stars Tom Ellis as Lucifer Morningstar, Lauren German as Det. Chloe Decker, D.B. Woodside as Amenadiel, Rachael Harris as Dr. Linda Martin, Kevin Alejandro as Det. Dan Espinoza, Lesley-Ann Brandt as Mazikeen Smith and Aimee Garcia as Ella Lopez. Season 5, Part 1 is available on Netflix now.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-where-does-eve-fit-in-season-5/\">Lucifer: Where Does Eve Fit Into Season 5?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 21:45:15 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-S5E2-Michael-Wings.jpg","linkMd5":"4490c4799028935f7980608be8af3dff","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-31-469_4180d8579590969e.webp","destWidth":2560,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":209138,"destBytes":209138,"author":"Ian Cardona","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-S5E2-Michael-Wings.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-31-469_4180d8579590969e.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-season-5-Michael-Chloe.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn10@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-42-559_6312fb14fcad8139.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lucifer-Season-4-Hell-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-34-041_71b91ac562c425bb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Power Rangers: Could Drakkon Ever REALLY Be Redeemed? | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/power-rangers-drakkon-green-ranger-redemption/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/green-ranger.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mighty-morphin-power-rangers/\">Mighty Morphin Power Rangers</a></strong> <em><strong>#53 by Ryan Parrott, Moisés Hidalgo, Walter Baiamonte, Katia Ranalli and Ed Dukeshire, on sale now.</strong></em></p><p>After a lot of hard work, the Power Rangers finally have access once more to the power of the Green Ranger, thanks to the repair of the Dragon Power Coin. While it could transform any potential candidate into a new Power Ranger, it might be the first step to the redemption of a major enemy of the Power Rangers.</p><p>If Drakkon does become the new Green Ranger, is there any way the villain could be redeemed?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-rangers-dark-rangers-zords/\">Power Rangers Upgrades the Dark Rangers With DESTRUCTIVE New Weapons</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Power-Rangers-Lord-Drakkon-Return-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>In many realities within the Power Rangers multiverse, Tommy Olver became the Green Ranger at the behest of the dark witch, Rita. But in the timeline eventually known as the World of the Coinless, Tommy didn't join the Power Rangers after being freed from her control. Instead, he remained alongside Rita and worked alongside her to conquer the Earth - leading to a final battle against Zordon and the Power Rangers. Taking the title Drakkon from a story Rita told him, Tommy ended up winning the day -- killing the Red Ranger, destroying Zordon, and taking the energies of the Power Rangers for himself. Drakkon's rule proved to be cruel and efficient, leading to a world controlled by Drakkon and his armies of Ranger Sentries.</p><p>After murdering Rita and corrupting the Pink Ranger Kimberly (turning her into the fearsome Ranger Slayer before the effects of his brainwashing were reversed). Drakkon eventually came up against the Power Rangers of the Mighty Morphin Universe, with the team proving capable of (barely) defeating Drakkon. The villain eventually broke free and set off the events of<em> </em><em>Shattered Grid</em>, rallying an army of like-minded and dangerous Rangers to help him try to conquer the multiverse.</p><p>Stealing the powers of the Morphin Grid and the Heart of the Master, Drakkon even briefly destroyed the multiverse and replaced it with a world of his creation, where he was beloved and accepted by the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers. Eventually confronted by the specter of that universe's Tommy, Drakkon is faced directly with his crimes. Eventually defeated by this resurrected other version of himself, Drakkon seemed to perish when the world fell apart around him. He remains one of the most dangerous and evil villains the Power Rangers have ever encountered. But could he ever be redeemed?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-rangers-drakkon-unknown-ranger-mystery/\">Power Rangers: Drakkon Introduces A NEW Mystery Ranger</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-Rangers-Drakkon-Green-Ranger.jpg\"/></figure><p>Drakkon was revealed to have survived this destruction through some unknown means, arriving in the Mighty Morphin Universe. He's quickly captured by the Power Rangers though and imprisoned within the Power Ranger's base. He's been taunting the Rangers ever since, suggesting that they could be as dark as him if they wanted to be. He hints at the dark power somewhere out there in the universe and suggests that it's a far more powerful threat than they've ever encountered in their own adventures. All of this has led Drakkon to develop a cruel relationship with the Power Rangers, with Kimberly even coming close to killing him while confronting him.</p><p>While the core-Tommy Oliver was able to force some semblance of humanity and regret out of Drakkon. But the villain has never shown any desire to actually change who he is for the better. The Rangers will certainly never fully trust the villain, especially after all the damage he brought to the universe during his reign. But the Power Rangers might not have a choice. With the threats to the Earth growing with each day, Grace has suggested that Drakkon be given the repaired Dragon Ranger Coin, turning him back into the Green Ranger. And that time may have come already, as the Dark Rangers are overwhelming the team in their first real battle. With the group already being beaten back, they might need the kind of ruthless brutality that Drakkon could bring to the battlefield.</p><p>Drakkon might make the perfect reluctant reinforcements for the Power Rangers. While he may not want to change who he is, he could be the ultimate secret weapon for the Power Rangers. And while the Rangers may never forgive him for his past crimes, he could make a case for his continued survival.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lord-drakkon-the-strongest-and-deadliest-power-ranger-ever-explained/\">Lord Drakkon: The Strongest And DEADLIEST Power Ranger Ever, Explained</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 23:20:15 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/green-ranger.jpg","linkMd5":"930314b795a50602ed2d9f796210e33c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn98@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-29-236_e4173a34674ed942.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":148454,"destBytes":148454,"author":"Brandon Zachary","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/green-ranger.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn98@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-29-236_e4173a34674ed942.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Power-Rangers-Lord-Drakkon-Return-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn50@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-41-218_d7739f7197f5acb4.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-Rangers-Drakkon-Green-Ranger.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn93@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-37-984_acaae0c75dd45233.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989067},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"X-Men: The Goblyn Queen Reveals Her SINISTER Plan for Krakoa","link":"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-goblyn-queen-krakoa-plan/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/X-Men-Madelyne-Pryor-Goblyn-Queen.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hellions/\">Hellions</a> #3 by Zeb Wells, Stephen Segovia, David Curiel, &#38; VC's Ariana Maher, on sale now</em></strong></p><p>The X-Men have made a lot of enemies over the years, but their time on Krakoa has led to many of them becoming more and more accepting of each other. A united mutant front has made the X-Men stronger than they've ever been. But some villains don't want peace with the X-Men - and are trying to take their revenge to the next level.</p><p>One such villain is the Goblyn Queen, who has defeated most of the Hellions. While confronting Havok and the rest of his team, the demonic villain revealed her very straightforward and <em>very</em> grisly plan to enact her revenge on Krakoa.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-editor-promises-a-massive-story-for-storm-in-2021/\">X-Men Editor Promises a Massive Story for Storm in 2021</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Goblyn-Queen-Hellions-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Goblyn Queen was once just Madelyne Pryor, an ally to the X-Men, a wife to Cyclops, and secretly a clone of Jean Grey. But after being left by her husband and exposed to demonic influences, Pryor became one of the X-Men's most cruel villains. She caused the events of <em>Inferno</em> in a bid to sacrifice her own son to achieve more power, and has been a demonic threat to the X-Men ever since. Unlike almost all other mutants - even former enemies such as Apoacaypse - Pryor hasn't been welcomed into Krakoa. Other demonic figures (like Magik) and cloned villains (Harpoon) have been given homes on Krakoa. Even Mister Sinister has been found a place there - and he's been made part of the Quiet Council, making him more powerful than ever.</p><p>From Pryor's perspective, there's no reason she shouldn't be a part of the current Krakoa life. That's why she's decided to bring it down and cause sheer mayhem for the mutants. Using her undead variants of the Marauders, Pryor intends to unleash <em>all</em> of the clones, a veritable army's worth. They'll use their mutant DNA to their advantage -- giving them access to the Krakoa Gates. Upon reaching the island, Pryor will unleash them as a swarm, to bring as much death and destruction as she can to the island - killing as many as possible. She intends to leave her mark on the island and become a lingering nightmare for the mutants there, ensuring they never forget Pryor again. She even intends to make a statement of purpose by killing her former lover Havok and sending his head to Cyclops.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-government-mutant-allies/\">X-Men: Marvel's Greatest Mutant Allies Are HIDING In [SPOILER]</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Goblyn-Queen-Hellions-3.jpg\"/></figure><p>It's a brutal and straightforward plan, and if effective - for example, if one of the Five were to be targeted and killed - it could have a huge impact on the infrastructure of Krakoa. Luckily, while most of the team has either been killed (Empath), captured (Nanny, Orphan-Maker, and Scalphunter), or seemingly corrupted (Havok), Psylocke and Wild Child are still in the board. With Wild Child now following Pyslocke's command, it'll fall to the telepathic former villain to bring down Pryor before she can bring destruction to the island.</p><p>But it's important to remember that Pryor isn't the only one with plans to bring down Krakoa. After learning that the X-Men won't allow Destiny to be resurrected, <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/x-men-theory-mystique-is-x-of-swords-secret-villain/\">Mystique</a> has made her intentions to bring down Krakoa clear. With Pryor, the shape-shifter could potentially find an ally who doesn't want to bury the hatchet with the rest of her fellow mutants. As the X-Men approach the \"Swords of X\" crossover and prepare for more and more intense battles, it's important for the mutants to remember that there are still people out there who want them to suffer - no matter what.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-marvel-illuminati-selene-krakoa/\">X-Men: Has Marvel's New Illuminati Already Infiltrated Krakoa?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 01:20:17 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/X-Men-Madelyne-Pryor-Goblyn-Queen.jpg","linkMd5":"fafaf32a957877a38ffc800ab6bbfa3e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn72@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-496_e227167fa0bc9516.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":120152,"destBytes":120152,"author":"Brandon Zachary","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/X-Men-Madelyne-Pryor-Goblyn-Queen.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn72@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-496_e227167fa0bc9516.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Goblyn-Queen-Hellions-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn14@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-38-096_6c98bfa72a5a7d6f.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Goblyn-Queen-Hellions-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn2@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-38-772_d9a28052c5953e9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989064},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The New Mutants Bring Down the X-Men's Most Persistent New Enemy","link":"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-x-men-enemy-dox/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-1.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/new-mutants/\">New Mutants</a> #12 by Ed Brisson, Marco Failla, Carlos Lopez, and VC's Travis Lanham, on sale now</em></strong></p><p>With the global influence of mutant-kind expanding thanks to the sudden rise of Krakoa as a genuine powerplay on a planetary scale, it makes sense that the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men/\">X-Men</a> and their allies have to deal with new and surprising enemies. But at least Krakoa can at least claim a victory over one of their most persistent.</p><p>The New Mutants finally confronted the website DOX head-on, and they may have found a way to shut it down for good in <em>New Mutants </em>#12</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-house-of-x-timeline-tease/\">X-Men Just Teased House of X's Most Important Timeline</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Since the X-Men have united to create a new mutant nation alongside many of their former villains, multiple \"humans-first\" organizations have risen up to fight back against them. While some have been more overtly dangerous than others (such as the mutate-assassins of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-force-domino-luck-ran-out/\">XENO</a>), one of the most persistent has been DOX. A news website within the Marvel Universe, the New Mutants have encountered DOX multiple times recently. Employing a small army of bloggers, DOX has been frequently deploying underhanded tactics to target the mutant population -- insulting them and twisting events to create a narrative where mutants are dangerous agitators.</p><p>They've even been doxxing many mutants who don't live on Krakoa by revealing their identities and locations to anyone with an internet connection. This has led to multiple incidents and attacks, with various mutants being hunted down and murdered before they can make it to the safety of Krakoa. DOX became a major concern for the New Mutants when Túmulo of the Bohem Cartel learned of Beak and Angel living off the island with their family. Attacking the family and demanding Krakoa Drugs for their safe release, the battle ended with Beak's human parents murdered by the Cartel members, and much of the criminal gang dead. Finally having enough with DOX after their \"expose\" on mutants in Carnelia, a small group of mutants decides it's finally time to do something about the website.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-editor-promises-a-massive-story-for-storm-in-2021/\">X-Men Editor Promises A Massive Story For Storm In 2021</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-3.jpg\"/></figure><p>Deciding that it was time to confront DOX head-on, Magik recruits Mirage and Glob Herman to visit their office after Trinary hunts it down. After discovering the location thanks to the technopath Trinary, Magik is quick to intimidate the owner and publisher of the website, Joseph Canning. Although he tries to talk a big game about the mutants only using intimidation tactics and how DOX only ever reports \"the truth\" about events, Magik reveals that Trinary also constructed her a failsafe to deal with DOX.</p><p>The tech-using mutant inserted a flash drive into a computer connected to their servers, it's revealed that the mutants have designed a new permanent aspect of the DOX site.</p><p>Whenever a mutant is doxxed and has their personal information revealed to the world by DOX, the people making the site will have <em>their</em> personal information posted as well. If the mutants are going to get doxxed, then they're going to ensure their enemies are as well. When Canning tries ot threaten the New Mutants over this, Glob Herman lashes out and threatens to personally kill Canning if another innocent mutant death can be traced to the actions of DOX. This genuinely throws off the writers at DOX. Instead of becoming martyrs of the mutant/human conflict like they'd expected, the site can still technically operate but will expose themselves anytime they expose mutants.</p><p>But due to this new tactic, the website is revealed to later be undergoing \"maintenance\" and has been shut down, at least for now. This means that a number of attacks on mutants may be slowed down, and more of the stragglers who have not yet made it to Krakoa can finally make that journey. If this does indeed silence the hate coming from DOX, then this is an unmitigated victory for the mutants of Krakoa. But it also might mean that DOX will start working with other forces to overcome and sidestep the limitation the New Mutants have put on the website and their mutant tracking methods, potentially setting up DOX to be the dangerous beginning to something potentially more devastating down the line.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-marvel-illuminati-selene-krakoa/\">X-Men: Has Marvel's New Illuminati Already Infiltrated Krakoa?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:20:05 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-1.jpg","linkMd5":"f6392023271c3f855b7711cd5e8b7abd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn23@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-413_f901af98e7f0b9ed.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":98812,"destBytes":98812,"author":"Brandon Zachary","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn23@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-413_f901af98e7f0b9ed.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn87@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-36-477_b0235e506928bb5b.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/New-Mutants-DOX-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn75@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-36-919_f6be8e2053257d56.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989071},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Star Wars: 10 Most Hilarious C-3PO Quotes | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-hilarious-c3po-quotes/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/C-3PO-See-Threepio-68fe125c.jpeg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/c-3po/\">C-3PO</a> is one of those <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-wars/\">Star Wars</a></em> characters who has appeared in every film in the original, prequel, and sequel trilogy. The gold-plated protocol droid provides much needed comic relief to these action-filled films. C-3PO is fluent in millions of languages, customs, and etiquette. Along with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/r2-d2/\">R2-D2</a>, these droids are vital to the plot of the movies, performing crucial roles in furthering the story.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-r2-d2-vs-c-3po-best-part-franchise/\">Star Wars: 5 Ways R2-D2 Is The Best Part Of The Franchise (&#38; 5 Why It's C-3PO)</a></span></p><p>Moving from the hands of Anakin Skywalker to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-luke-skywalker-right-wrong-decisions/\">Luke Skywalker</a> and then to Leia, C-3PO has been of service to many and provided audiences with a funny droid who is incredibly intelligent and oblivious at the same time. Here are some of the instances from the original trilogy where this becomes evident.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>\"I'm Going To Regret This\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Star-wars-A-New-Hope-C-3PO-Silver-Leg-R2-D2.jpg' /></figure><p>Viewers are introduced to C-3PO in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-wars-a-new-hope/\"><em>A New Hope</em></a> and one of the first things viewers get to observe is how much of a coward C-3PO is when compared to the more daring R2-D2. When <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-leia-organa-changes-stay-same/\">Leia</a> gives R2 a message to deliver, R2 makes a valiant effort to escape in order to deliver the message promptly.</p><p>In following R2, C-3PO is constantly fretting that they should be escaping. And when R2 gets into a pod to leave, C-3PO reluctantly follows him saying the above quote.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>\"Sometimes, I Just Don't Understand Human Behavior\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/C-3PO-Millennium-Falcon.jpg' /></figure><p>C-3PO repeatedly tries to tell <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-times-han-solo-was-right-mistaken/\">Han</a> that the hyperdrive is not functioning. But Han refuses to pay attention. C-3PO has a very nagging manner that displeases most people, and especially Han.</p><p>So when he again calls attention to the obvious, which is the difficult and troubling situation they are in, Han calls him \"the professor\" and asks <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/han-and-chewie-memes/\">Chewie</a> to take him to figure out the hyperdrive. C-3PO mutters this quote as he is pushed out and it is quite comical to hear him say it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>\"I'm Not Supposed To Know A Power Socket From A Computer Terminal\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/r2-d2-c-3po-feud-.jpg' /></figure><p><em>\"Well, don't blame me. I'm an interpreter. I'm not supposed to know a power socket from a computer terminal.\" </em></p><p>When R2 gets shocked after inserting himself into a power socket, C-3PO says this as a reply of sorts to R2 who seems to be complaining. It's quite cute to watch these non-human droids be this way, and this moment is especially hilarious because it seems to be a moment of self-awareness in this soap opera.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-unanswered-questions-finally-resolved-comics/\">Star Wars: 10 Unanswered Questions That Were Finally Resolved In The Comics</a></span></p><p>Even droids make stupid mistakes, they are not infallible. And the mistake C-3PO makes here is such an amusingly stupid one as well.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>\"R2, This Is No Time For Heroics\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Artoo.jpg' /></figure><p>The dynamic between R2-D2 and C-3Po is quite complementary in nature. They are quite opposite in nature and character and hence work well in making sure the other survives.</p><p>While R2 is more courageous and adventures, C-3PO is terrified of everything and is willing to give up at any given moment. But R2's carelessness is compensated by C-3PO's excessive nagging, and C-3PO's insane cowardice is compensated by R2 heroics. Here, even in the middle of high stakes situation, R2 seems to be going to help. And even though C-3PO shouts this out loud, he still follows R2.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>\"I Thought That Hairy Beast Would Be The End Of Me\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/chewie-artoo.jpg' /></figure><p>C-3PO spends a lot of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-wars-the-empire-strikes-back/\"><em>The Empire Strikes Back</em></a> in pieces. He's dragged around by Chewie the Wookie and it's truly an uncomfortable situation for C-3PO in<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-empire-strikes-back-trivia/\"> this movie</a>. But that doesn't make it less fun for the viewers.</p><p>Watching C-3PO being dragged around by this huge Wookie and have them both communicate with each other is hilarious. And so when C-3PO confides this to his friend R2, it becomes even more comical.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>\"R2, I Have A Bad Feeling About This\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/R2-D2-and-C-3PO-Star-Wars-Feature.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most iconic lines in the<em> Star Wars</em> franchise,<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-have-bad-feeling-about-this/\"> everyone has had a turn at saying this line</a>. In <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-wars-return-of-the-jedi/\"><em>Return Of The Jedi</em></a>, it is C-3PO who says this iconic quote to R2-D2. Everyone adds their own flavor to this quote. When Han Solo says it, viewers know the sarcasm with which he is saying it.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-darth-vader-scariest-quotes/\">Star Wars: 10 Scariest Quotes Of Darth Vader</a></span></p><p>When C-3PO says it, viewers know that he is truly terrified of what is to come, and that makes it all the more funnier.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>\"Well, At Least You're Still In One Piece\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/C-3PO-See-Threepio-68fe125c.jpeg' /></figure><p>This is one of those quotes that again remind viewers that C-3PO is indeed made of metal and wires. C-3PO speaks like humans and is extremely funny and is a necessary character in the franchise.</p><p>But at the end of the day, it is possible for him to be in pieces and still communicate and even fix himself. The whole situation and C-3PO's cribbing about him being in pieces is quite funny.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>\"It's Against My My Programming To Impersonate A Diety\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ewoks-rise-of-skywalker.jpg' /></figure><p>In <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-return-of-the-jedi-concept-art-you-need-to-see/\">Return Of The Jedi</a></em>, the Ewoks take C-3PO to be a kind of God. C-3PO with his golden body and ability to communicate with them in their language, gives the Ewoks the impression that he is a superior being.</p><p>So when <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-ways-luke-best-part-original-trilogy-ways-han/\">Han and Luke</a> are getting attacked by the Ewoks, they ask C-3PO to use this to his advantage and asks him to tell the Ewoks to stop attacking them. C-3PO, without a trace of irony or sarcasm says that he shouldn't be doing that. The immense power he has versus this unique problem he faces makes for one of the funniest moments in the movie.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>\"R2-D2, You Know Better Than To Trust A Strange Computer\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/R2-D2-C-3PO.jpg' /></figure><p>As mentioned earlier, the relationship between these two droids is quite cute. It varies from a mutual camaraderie to a sort of sibling-like or even paternal concern. C-3PO here especially, seems to chide R2-D2 in a very paternal manner saying that he should have known better.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/star-wars-most-memorable-luke-skywalker-quotes/\">Star Wars: 10 Most Memorable Luke Skywalker Quotes</a></span></p><p>It's quite amusing how normal human relationships are transposed on to these droids here.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>\"Here We Go Again\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/C-3PO-wired-up.jpg' /></figure><p>In as much as C-3PO seems to dislike dangerous situations and adventures, he seems to find himself in exactly those kinds of situations all the time. So it's quite funny when C-3PO says \"here we go again\" to R2-D2 because they do indeed seem to go through the same kinds of troubles over and over again.</p><p>It's emblematic of the <em>Star Wars</em> universe that one adventure just follows another and there is really no stopping them.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/star-wars-plot-devices/\">10 Plot Devices Star Wars Can't Seem To Quit</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:30:14 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/C-3PO-See-Threepio-68fe125c.jpeg","linkMd5":"bd7fe633544bbef6fdf099bd8d931b4b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn76@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-31-543_e634e648f348ff6f.webp","destWidth":1408,"destHeight":704,"sourceBytes":84328,"destBytes":84328,"author":"Vandana Devi","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/C-3PO-See-Threepio-68fe125c.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn76@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-31-543_e634e648f348ff6f.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Star-wars-A-New-Hope-C-3PO-Silver-Leg-R2-D2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn14@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-017_a0b1db983352d41a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/C-3PO-Millennium-Falcon.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/r2-d2-c-3po-feud-.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn56@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-37-455_c673540514b8b884.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/Artoo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn69@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-42-359_320f6121d405dc46.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/chewie-artoo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-42-012_d9b572aa11fdaf95.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/R2-D2-and-C-3PO-Star-Wars-Feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn24@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-40-391_ab49d1c9f2a89aaa.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ewoks-rise-of-skywalker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn89@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-38-571_0101d0f9f8585450.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/R2-D2-C-3PO.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-35-252_7ba12b603382c6ed.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/C-3PO-wired-up.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989071},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Trinkets: [SPOILER] Gets Caught but Somehow Doesn't End up in Jail","link":"https://www.cbr.com/trinkets-girls-caught-doesnt-end-up-in-jail/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets-1200x800.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for Season 2 of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/trinkets/\">Trinkets</a>, now streaming on Netflix.</strong></em></p><p>Netflix's <em>Trinkets</em> is all about close calls for its trio of teenage shoplifters as they somehow always get away with their heists. However, the second and final season finds Elodie (Brianna Hildebrand), Moe (Kiana Madeira) and Tabitha (Quintessa Swindell) crossing a line when they steal an exam from Moe's robotics teacher to give to the blackmailing Brady.</p><p>Yet, somehow, when <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/trinkets-series-finale-explained/\">they all get caught</a>, the series leaves fans wondering how the trio didn't end up in jail or at least get kicked out of school for their crimes.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-turned-original-sin-into-nightmare/\">Lovecraft Country Turned 'Original Sin' Into an All-Boys Club Nightmare</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets-4.jpg\"/></figure><p>Brady gets dirt on Moe cheating on her boyfriend, Noah, after a fight, so he uses it to his advantage. Moe and Noah get back together, but Brady blackmails her because he knows Moe doesn't want to ruin her second shot. In addition, he's getting back at Tab for dumping him for being abusive in the past. This leads to Chase getting blamed for the crime, but in the finale, the girls leave a photo exhibit confessing they stole the test. They also out Brady for abusing girls and blackmailing them into the heist.</p><p>So, as they ditch school that day and empty El's mom's ashes, they admit they're in for a world of trouble when they get back. It felt as if their parents were going to ream them out because El was one step away from being sent to rehab, especially after running away with an indie rocker, while Moe and Tab were at Shoplifters Anonymous with bad track records of their own. Instead, the montage at the end shows no repercussions at all, which is odd because Brady knows they stole and dumped his car in the river in Season 1.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lovecraft-country-outdone-stranger-things-one-way/\">Lovecraft Country Has Already Outdone Stranger Things in One Huge Way</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets.jpg\"/></figure><p>In the end, El is walking down the hallway with Jillian, her girlfriend, comfortable as they're finally out as a gay couple, Moe's studying in a cafe and shooting Noah sultry glares and Tab's exhibiting her work at an art gallery. This shouldn't be the case, though, because the trio hacked a teacher's computer and let Chase initially take the fall.</p><p>They even had to storm the hotel, steal a keycard from a guest and then break in from that room into the teacher's room where El did the hack, so there are so many laws broken here. The fact El also just returns all the trinkets she stole to the stores and gets off without being arrested is quite convenient. She even buys Jillian a trinket right after returning to one of many stores, which paints the storeowners as people without a spine. It sets a bad precedent which apparently the school follows up because by not reprimanding the girls, the theme of consequence goes right out the window. Tab was distracting hotel guests so it's easy to understand her getting off, but El and Moe are dead-to-rights guilty, yet the series ends with them studying and focusing on their relationships.</p><p><em>Trinkets stars Brianna Hildebrand, Kiana Madeira, Quintessa Swindell, Brandon Butler, Odiseas Georgiadis and Larry Sullivan. Season 2 is now available on Netflix.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/i-may-destory-you-mind-bending-finale-explained/\">I May Destroy You's Mind-Bending Series Finale, Explained</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 23:45:35 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets-1200x800.jpg","linkMd5":"fbe7008d4e084106b5a93d3c9cefde6b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn92@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-30-798_72587d505b77e82f.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":56722,"destBytes":56722,"author":"Renaldo Matadeen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets-1200x800.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn92@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-30-798_72587d505b77e82f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn16@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-39-530_93b654100f09b22d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/trinkets.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn73@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-37-613_5b5b2be5e95eb945.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989066},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Avengers Endgame: 10 Iron Man Fan Art Pictures That Are Too Good","link":"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-endgame-iron-man-fanart-love-you-3000/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10Avengers-Endgame-Iron-Man-Fan-Art-Pictures-That-Are-Too-Good-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Iron Man is a pivotal character within the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel-cinematic-universe/\">Marvel Cinematic Universe</a>. As he is the one that started it all, it is only fair that he's one of the most prevalent characters. The futurist is known for his playboy personality just as much as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-armor-junji-ito-influence/\">his suit of armor</a>.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-iron-man-love-interests-ranked-best/\">10 Love Interests Of Iron Man, Ranked From Worst To Best</a></p><p>But over the years, the character development he earned has garnered him a lot of love. So much so that many people ended up cosplaying him or drawing fan art of him. This is especially true ever since <em>Avengers: Endgame</em> where he committed the ultimate sacrifice. Here is a taste of some of the best <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tony-stark-iron-man-father-figure-power/\">Iron Man</a> fan art out there from the movie. Be warned, as spoilers are ahead.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>The Futurist Becomes A God</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Iron-Man-Fan-Art.png' /></figure><p><em>Fan Art by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CD4QMVWntnD/?utm_source=ig_embed\">jackriverhernandez</a></em></p><p>First on the list is the iconic moment when <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-2020-right-tony-stark-learned-hard-way/\">Iron Man</a> grabbed the stones from Thanos. Of course, it isn't an exact recreation as it shows the Iron Man armor shiny and bold. The helmet still being on and the infinity stones grafted on his hand without any repercussions.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-changes-comics-marvel-cinematic-universe/\">Iron Man: 10 Best Changes From The Comics The MCU Made</a></span></p><p>That being said, the art created by jackriverhernandez is very impressive. As the Iron Man is colored and shaded well as it contrasts the green background. It is particularly impressive because the armor has a sheen that really makes it look metallic in design.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>And I Am Iron Man</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Contrasting the first entry is the art piece created by Kyle Petchock Art.  A great digital piece, the artist implemented his own cleaner and softer style to contrast the absolute power of the scene from the film. Although that is the case, the art style actually complements it in a way. Having the power and energy of the stones be more poignant and pronounced while combining it with the warm yellow in the background. It's a testament of sacrifice that ultimately embodies the character arc of Tony Stark.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Memory Lane</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>One of the most unique pieces for Iron Man fan art, it is the one created by elite_adi_official.  Incorporating some fun splash art here, there is plenty of things to love. One of the most notable is the variety of Iron Man masks that are at the top of the art.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-iron-man-endgame-tony-stark-changes/\">MCU: 10 Ways Tony Stark Changed Between Iron Man 1 &#38; Endgame</a></p><p>All circling around Tony Stark with the infinity gauntlet on his right hand, with its powers coursing through his veins. The abstract ground as it breaks beneath him only illustrates further, the power of the gauntlet as well as the gravity of Tony Stark's decision.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>The Iron Family</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>One of the most surprising but also genuinely enjoyable developments for Iron Man is the introduction of his family. Specifically his daughter Morgan. As a father, it became a point of his character that made him far wiser than he was before. As such, many fans loved this new addition and have created fan art like the one created by limaocomvodka. Since the art is based on the idea of a fun moment in time, it makes the ending of Endgame all the more depressing.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>What If Things Were Different</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>What if instead of Iron Man, it was Captain America who committed the ultimate sacrifice. Back in the comics when the Civil War was originally introduced, it was Captain America that perished. Even back when the movies were being made, some thought that Captain America dying was a possibility. So it's fun to see the dynamic switch between the two. As the relationship between them has always been a pivotal part of the MCU.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Forever Remembered</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Although this is technically not an <em>Avengers Endgame</em> piece, it is still important to have since it symbolizes the legacy that Iron Man gives to the future generation of superheroes. The grey statue showing how much many people miss the character, while also having a young Spider-Man sitting on his shoulder. Still missing him and also arguably being the living legacy of the invincible superhero.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Determined To Finish Thanos</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Created by Ultraraw26, this is an art piece that is utterly astonishing. The black and grey background with the white snow helps compliment the more somber colors of the Iron Man suit. Combined with the infinity stones, it shines brightly in the dark background along with the other lights within the Iron Man suit. The way the pose is positioned also shows a determined character who is willing to go above and beyond against Thanos.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Journeying Back Into The Past</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>This simple but fun piece is created by nandskarth. Depicting the scene where Iron Man and Captain America journey back in time to get more Pym particles and the tesseract, the piece is very clean. With soft colors and clean linework, it creates a warm and straightforward piece that also has decent expression work done as well. Probably the cheekiest thing that's in the art is the bubble on the top right corner which helps illustrate the scene further with the other character in the elevator.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>The Iron Trinity</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>This gorgeous piece is created by Camille Vialet which depicts the Iron family trinity. Specifically Tony Stark, James Rhodes' <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-tony-stark-closest-allies/\">War Machine</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-pepper-potts-real-hero-iron-man-avengers-tony-stark/\">Pepper Potts</a> who are probably wearing the MCU version of Rescue. It's a straightforward piece with the three being in front of an explosive background.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-best-iron-man-monologues/\">MCU: 10 Best Iron Man Monologues</a></span></p><p>But what makes this piece special is the power that is put behind these three. As they are the first characters that most fans know of, it's only fair that fans are able to get them at their absolute peak. With all of their development generally getting finished and their character arcs complete at this point.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>I love You 3000</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Finally, the last piece to be talked about is the one created by art.eileenkim. Showing the last message given by Iron Man upon his death, although done a little differently, still shows the emotional weight that has been put upon his death. Showing a mixture of sadness and finality.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-cinematic-universe-mcu-tony-stark-pepper-potts-best-couple/\">Proof That Tony Stark Has A Heart: 10 Reasons Pepper &#38; Tony Are The Best MCU Couple</a></span></p><p>Of course outside of that, the art is really special as it seems to have taken elements from animation like Disney or Dreamworks. The expressions from both Morgan Stark and Pepper Potts only makes this whole art piece go the extra mile overall.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-monsters-iron-man-could-destroy-would-beat-him/\">5 D&#38;D Monsters Iron Man Could Destroy (5 That Would Beat Him)</a></span></p>\n +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10Avengers-Endgame-Iron-Man-Fan-Art-Pictures-That-Are-Too-Good-header.jpg","linkMd5":"42a67c1d77fdd97131cc76bebe5c0106","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn79@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-275_e8cf28c43be6b403.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":157092,"destBytes":157092,"author":"Richie Nguyen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10Avengers-Endgame-Iron-Man-Fan-Art-Pictures-That-Are-Too-Good-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn79@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-275_e8cf28c43be6b403.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Iron-Man-Fan-Art.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn72@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-39-312_ad7862ad7e473b11.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989064},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Joker War: The Batman Crossover Is Driving the DC Universe Mad","link":"https://www.cbr.com/joker-war-hallucinations-batman-nightwing-harley-quinn/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Batman-Joker-War-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/batman\">Batman</a> #97-98, <em>by James Tynion IV, Jorge Jimenez, and Tom Morey, </em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/harley-quinn\">Harley Quinn</a> #75, <em>by Sam Humphries, Riley Rossmo, Ngozi, Sami Basri, Emanuela Lupacchino, Joe Quinones, Riley Rossmo, Nicola Scott, Ramon Villalobos, Ray Mccarthy, Hi-Fi, Tamra Bonvillain, Anette Kwok, Ivan Plascencia, and </em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/nightwing\">Nightwing</a> #73, <em>by Dan Jurgens, Ryan Benjamin, Richard Friend, and Rain Beredo.</em></strong></p><p>The Joker War has engulfed the worlds of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman/\">Batman</a> and all of his affiliates. The <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/joker\">Joker</a> has taken over Bruce Wayne's secret Batcaves, divided up Gotham among his gangs, stolen Bruce Wayne's arsenal and forture. And now, it seems that he is even begging to take a hold over the minds of Batman and those around him.</p><p>The Joker is no stranger to madness, and those around him and those who oppose him are equally familiar with the concept. However, it seems that for Batman and Nightwing in particular things are taking a turn away from understanding and toward experiencing. Nightwing has been effectively taken over by the Joker while the souped-up fear toxin coursing through Bruce's veins (courtesy of Punchline) has him hearing the voice of the late Alfred Pennyworth - his former butler/father figure - rattling around underneath the cowl. While it's less of a new phenomenon, Harley Quinn is also experiencing some rather distressing signs of severe psychological stress; namely, a Bat-Mite-like character that arrives to taunt her about her new status in a world where Punchline has taken over her former position with the Joker.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-doom-metal-nightwings-trauma-titans/\">Justice League: Doom Metal Reveals Nightwing's Ric Grayson Trauma to the Teen Titans</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joker-War-Nightwing-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p>Dick Grayson has been dealt a pretty bad hand in recent years. This rough ride began for Nightwing back in <em>Nightwing </em>#50 by Benjamin Percy, Christopher Mooneyham, and Travis Moore, which began to deal with the fallout of him taking a bullet from KGBeast to the head. Things looked pretty dire with Dick falling into a coma. Luckily for fans of the original Boy Wonder, Grayson woke up from the coma, but sadly he did so without any memories of his life with the Bat-Family. Over time, he has steadily put himself back together, however, his condition has been manipulated by a handful of villains. The latest in that long line is, of course, the Joker.</p><p>The Clown Prince of Crime has the former Nightwing laboring under the delusion that it was the Joker who took him in as a boy, that he hated his acrobat parents, was happy when they died, and has always gone under the incredibly unfortunate name \"Dicky Boy.\" In <em>Nightwing </em>#73, by Dan Jurgens, Ryan Benjamin, and Richard Friend, the Joker sets Dicky Boy up to fight against the previously captured Batgirl, Dick's former love interest. Not only is this further salt on an old wound for those fans who shipped Dick and Barbara, but it also shows just how deeply the Joker has inserted himself into Dick's mind with the help of the memory crystal created by Dr. Hass.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Joker-War-Hallucination.jpg\"/></figure><p>For the most part, <em>Harley Quinn </em>#75  is a story about the roast of Harley Quinn which turns out to be a massive and incredibly high definition bit of introspection on the part of the former doctor. However, a back-up tale by Sam Humphries and Riley Rossmo shows the effect that Joker War is having on Harley's already shaky mental state. The story picks up after Punchline and Harley squared off in a fight that left Harley's throat slit by the Joker's new girlfriend and her body dumped into the sewer. As Harley is sinking into the water with an alarmingly large red pool of blood swirling around her, a tiny Bat-Mite-like creature appears. The creature refers to itself as a guardian angel, demon and the desperate firing of her rapidly dimming synapses.</p><p>Instead of offering comfort, the creature repeatedly informs Harley that fighting is useless and that she's going to die after having been beaten by the Joker's newer, more dangerous girlfriend. Harley's near-death experience also gives readers some insight into her past in a collection of flashbacks which help to inform the action in the comic's present while the Imp continues to taunt her about her rapidly oncoming demise via blood loss. She doesn't die, but instead swims out of the sewer, fights a pair of wanna-be Joker henchman, and sews up her gaping neck-wound with a steel guitar string. It'll take more than a deep cut and a set of graphic hallucinations to put Harley down. If anything, Harley's experience only serves to show her actively pushing the Joker out of her head.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/harley-quinn-death-metal-punchline-injury/\"> Joker War Makers Harley Quinn More METAL Than Death Metal</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Joker-War-hallucination.jpg\"/></figure><p>Batman has hallucinated quite a bit since the start of his illustrious career. However, Bruce has recently started hearing the voice of his beloved butler/confidant echoing in his head is upsetting in a way that flashier versions of the same idea can't quite deliver to the reader. Not only is this a similar salt-in-the-wound move to having Dick attack Barbara, but it also plays well into the ideas of the Joker attacking Bruce Wayne in Joker War and not just his Batman persona.</p><p>It feels as though the Joker revealing <em>The Mask of Zorro </em>and it's a connection to Gotham's very own masked vigilante has brought Bruce to a place where he needs to look to the closest person to him, and the only person that knew him at the time that he lost his family and knows who he truly is. Unfortunately, like so many others that he has cared about, Alfred has been lost to him, which gives this bout of hallucination a far more personal feel.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/harley-quinn-outsmarts-batman-white-knight/\"> White Knight: How Harley Quinn Outsmarts the Joker and Batman at the Same Time</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 00:20:59 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Batman-Joker-War-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"1d062248e061796abc45fece37690c93","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":144786,"destBytes":144786,"author":"Carter Burrowes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Batman-Joker-War-feature.jpg":null,"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joker-War-Nightwing-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn30@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-42-035_7627f88b8f1c1431.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Joker-War-Hallucination.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn49@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-42-085_75280a66efe2da8f.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Joker-War-hallucination.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn64@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-36-790_ee32fba3817b0857.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989065},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"1940s Superman Radio Series Announced for DC FanDome: Explore the Multiverse","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dc-fandome-explore-multiverse-superman-radio-series/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/SUPERMAN-COSTUMES-Golden-Age.jpg\"/></figure><p>The acclaimed 1940's <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/superman\">Superman</a> Radio Series is being recreated for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dc-fandome/\">DC FanDome: Explore the Multiverse</a>, courtesy of Warner Bros. Television and The Creative Coalition.</p><p>Warner Bros.' official press release is below:</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"DC FanDome: 5 Stories for the DCEU Elseworlds Films to Explore\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-fandome-elseworlds-dceu/\">DC FanDome: 5 Stories For The DCEU Elseworlds Films To Explore</a></span></p><p><em>(New York, NY) –<strong>Warner Bros. Television</strong> and <strong>The Creative Coalition</strong> are bringing the <strong>1940s Superman Radio Series</strong> to life on <strong>Saturday, September 12</strong>, at <strong>DC FanDome: Explore the Multiverse</strong>, with a cast of today’s biggest stars. Fans from around the world can tune in to this exclusive one-hour event beginning at <strong>10:00 am PDT</strong>, for <strong>24 hours</strong>. The Superman Radio Series will be <strong>available on demand</strong>, so fans can access it throughout the day, whenever they want. Using original scripts from the long-running radio serial recently unearthed from the Warner Bros. Studios vault, this rare, never-before-seen production will allow fans to experience the Man of Steel in a unique way. The exclusive event supports The Creative Coalition’s urgent work to protect and advance the arts in schools and communities across the nation. Fans are encouraged to go to <a href=\"http://thecreativecoalition.org/\">TheCreativeCoalition.org</a> to learn more about keeping arts advocacy alive and vital.</em></p><p><em>The Creative Coalition’s cast includes <strong>Wilson</strong> <strong>Cruz </strong>(“Star Trek: Discovery”), <strong>Tim Daly </strong>(“Madam Secretary”), and <strong>Daniel Dae Kim</strong> (“Hawaii Five-0”) as Superman, and features <strong>Jason</strong> <strong>Alexander </strong>(“Seinfeld,” “Harley Quinn”), <strong>Troian</strong> <strong>Bellisario</strong> (“Pretty Little Liars”), <strong>ErichBergen </strong>(“Madam Secretary”), <strong>Anthony</strong> <strong>Carrigan</strong> (“Barry”), <strong>Terry</strong> <strong>Crews </strong>(“Brooklyn Nine-Nine”), <strong>Sam</strong> <strong>Daly </strong>(“Hunters”), <strong>Lea</strong> <strong>DeLaria </strong>(“Orange Is the New Black”), <strong>Giancarlo Esposito </strong>(“Better Call Saul”), <strong>Sean</strong> <strong>Giambrone </strong>(“The Goldbergs”), <strong>Nicholas</strong> <strong>Gonzalez </strong>(“The Good Doctor”), <strong>Jason</strong> <strong>Isaacs </strong>(“Harry Potter” films), <strong>Richard</strong> <strong>Kind </strong>(“American Dad”), <strong>EricMcCormack </strong>(“Will and Grace”), <strong>Dean</strong> <strong>Norris </strong>(“Breaking Bad”), <strong>CCH Pounder </strong>(“NCIS: New Orleans”), <strong>Anthony</strong> <strong>Rapp </strong>(“Star Trek: Discovery”), <strong>Yolonda</strong> <strong>Ross</strong> (“Black Lightning”),<strong>Caterina</strong> <strong>Scorsone </strong>(“Grey’s Anatomy”), <strong>Tony</strong> <strong>Shalhoub </strong>(“The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel”), <strong>Tamara</strong> <strong>Tunie </strong>(“Law &#38; Order: Special Victims Unit”), <strong>Henry</strong> <strong>Winkler </strong>(“Barry”), <strong>Alfre</strong> <strong>Woodard </strong>(“Luke Cage”), and <strong>Constance</strong> <strong>Zimmer </strong>(“House of Cards”).</em></p><p><em>“We are thrilled to join comic fans and creators at DC FanDome: Explore the Multiverse to bring the original Superman to life and celebrate the arts,” said The Creative Coalition CEO <strong>Robin Bronk</strong>. “We encourage Superman fans to learn more about The Creative Coalition’s mission to support the arts by visiting <a href=\"http://thecreativecoalition.org/\">TheCreativeCoalition.org</a>. We are grateful to Warner Bros. and DC for supporting that work.”</em></p><p><em><strong><u>ABOUT THE CREATIVE COALITION</u></strong></em></p><p><em>The Creative Coalition (<a href=\"http://www.thecreativecoalition.org/\">www.TheCreativeCoalition.org</a>) is the premier nonprofit, nonpartisan 501(c)(3) social and public advocacy organization of the arts and entertainment community. Founded in 1989 by prominent members of the creative community, The Creative Coalition is dedicated to educating, mobilizing, and activating its members on issues of public importance. Actor Tim Daly serves as the organization’s President. The Creative Coalition also creates award-winning public service campaigns including #RightToBearArts to promote the efficacy of the arts. The Creative Coalition harnesses the unique platforms of the arts community and entertainment industry to make positive impacts on social welfare issues.</em></p><p><em><strong><u>ABOUT DC FANDOME: EXPLORE THE MULTIVERSE</u></strong></em></p><p><em><strong>DC FanDome: Explore the Multiverse</strong> is a 24-hour, on-demand virtual experience that will offer fans the experience of a lifetime, with full access to nearly 100 hours of on-demand content via <a href=\"http://www.dcfandome.com/\">DCFanDome.com</a> — completely free to all, worldwide. All content will be presented in nine languages — Chinese, English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese and Spanish — and will be fully accessible on mobile phone or tablet, as well as laptop or desktop. Fans can suit up and determine their own adventure, selecting from exclusive panel sessions, screenings and never-before-seen content from the DC Multiverse of films, television, comics and games — at their own pace and on their own schedule. And the adventure is also heating up for young DC Super Hero fans. <strong>DC Kids FanDome</strong> will offer kids (and their parents) a break from the seemingly endless “at home” summer with a kid-friendly companion event accessed separately at <a href=\"http://www.dckidsfandome.com/\">DCKidsFanDome.com</a>. Young Super Heroes in training around the world will not want to miss it! Both events begin Saturday, September 12, at 10:00 am PDT, and will be accessible, on demand, for 24 hours.</em></p><p><em><strong><u>ABOUT DC</u></strong></em></p><p><em>DC is one of the largest publishers of comics and graphic novels in the world and home to some of the most iconic and recognizable characters ever created. As a creative unit of WarnerMedia, DC is charged with strategically integrating its stories and characters across film, television, consumer products, home entertainment, interactive games, and the DC Universe digital subscription service. For more information visit <a href=\"http://www.dccomics.com/\">dccomics.com</a> and <a href=\"http://www.dcuniverse.com/\">dcuniverse.com</a>.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Adult Swim Teams Up With Crunchyroll to Adapt SEGA's Shenmue to Anime Series","link":"https://www.cbr.com/shenmue-anime-adult-swim-crunchyroll-greenlight-toonami/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/shenmue-3-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Adult Swim and Crunchyroll have partnered for an anime adaptation of Sega's series of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/shenmue/\">Shenmue</a> video games.</p><p>Per <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/shenmue-anime-series-based-on-sega-game-franchise-greenlit-by-crunchyroll-adult-swim-1234569523/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a>, Adult Swim and Crunchyroll -- both of which fall under the WarnerMedia banner -- have greenlit an original anime based on <em>Shenmue</em>, which is currently slated to run for 13 episodes. The <em>Shenmue</em> anime will stream worldwide outside of Japan and mainland China on Crunchyroll. In the United States, it will air on Cartoon Network/Adult Swim's Toonami action block.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/adult-swim-crunchyroll-production-i-g-team-for-fena-pirate-princess/\">Adult Swim, Crunchyroll, Production I.G Team for Fena: Pirate Princess</a></span></p><p>\"The first <em>Shenmue</em> video game was released more than 20 years ago and we're so excited to be working again with Adult Swim to bring this franchise to life through anime,\" said Crunchyroll Head of Development Sarah Victor. \"We're eager to show our fans more of this action-packed adventure series as we move through production.\"</p><p>\"The world of <em>Shenmue</em> is fascinating and unique, and we are so excited to partner with Yu Suzuki to bring his epic creation to anime -- and make a kick-ass martial arts epic!\" added Adult Swim SVP/Creative Director On-Air and Toonami co-creator Jason DeMarco.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shenmue-3-long-awaited-sequel-true-to-originals/\">Shenmue III Video Shows How the Long-Awaited Sequel Stayed True to Originals</a></span></p><p>Created by Yu Suzuki, <em>Shenmue</em> released in Japan for the Sega Dreamcast in December of 1999, later arriving in the United States in November of 2000. <em>Shenmue II</em> followed suit with a 2001 Dreamcast release in Japan and Europe, with an Xbox version hitting the States and in Europe in 2002 and 2003, respectively. <em>Shenmue III</em> released worldwide for the PlayStation 4 and Microsoft Windows in November of 2019.</p><p><em>Shenmue</em> follows Ryo Hazuki on his quest for revenge after his father is murdered at their family dojo, tracking the man responsible from Yokosuka, Japan all the way to Hong Kong. Along the way, Ryo learns of the mystical forces at work and trains to become an expert martial artist.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shenmue-iii-everything-you-need-to-know/\">Shenmue III: Everything You Need to Know About the New Game</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 01:14:14 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/shenmue-3-header.jpg","linkMd5":"24e326178dfa834fa9f3c6d49e53b95a","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":126712,"destBytes":126712,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/shenmue-3-header.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989065},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"WWE's Rey Mysterio to Star in Animated Lucha Libre Series | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-rey-mysterio-animated-lucha-libre-series/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/rey-mysterio-animated-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Cartoon Network Latin America announced that it is collaborating with ¡<a href=\"https://twitter.com/LosVivaCalavera\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Viva Calavera</a>! on an animated lucha libre series starring <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wwe\">WWE</a> Superstar <a href=\"https://twitter.com/reymysterio\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Rey Mysterio</a>.</p><p>The announcement came during a surprise panel celebrating <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cartoon-network-genndy-tartakovsky-primal-season-2/\">Cartoon Network Day</a>, which consisted of Mysterio, Jaime Jiménez Rión (Cartoon Network Content Director for Mexico and Colombia) and masked animation veterans the Hermanos Calavera.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-extreme-rules-rey-mysterio-extracted-eyeball-screenshot/\">WWE Extreme Rules Screenshot Shows Rey Mysterio's Extracted Eyeball</a></span></p><p>Titled after the lucha libre legend, <em>Rey Mysterio</em> will chronicle his adventures against unimaginable forces while mixing the world of wrestling with mystery, magic and the supernatural.</p><p>\"After 35 years of career and multiple achievements, I was still missing something. I always wanted an animated series with the character of Rey Mysterio and when the Hermanos Calavera presented their idea to me, I was immediately captivated,\" Mysterio said. \"Working with Cartoon Network has been incredible, I can't think of anyone better than this group to make this project a reality.\"</p><p>\"We are very excited to finally be able to announce this project and eager to share the result with our fans and lucha libre fans,\" Jiménez Rión said. \"Working with Rey Mysterio and ¡Viva Calavera! It has been a pleasure and we are sure that we have an incredible story to tell. There are many elements to highlight: Mexico as a central element when creating this project, the level of action, the characters and the risks that we have taken in order to make this story resonate and connect with many fans around the world. Booyaka!\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rey-mysterio-son-gruesome-aftermath-initiation-wwe-universe/\">Rey Mysterio's Son Shares Gruesome Aftermath Of His Initiation Into The WWE Universe</a></span></p><p>\"It is a privilege for us to work on this project with one of our idols, Rey Mysterio, and in conjunction with Cartoon Network,\" the Hermanos Calavera added. \"Having the opportunity to tell this story in the context of lucha libre, with the action, epicity and emotion that we have always liked to see on screen is a dream come true. We hope that with this project we can bring a little Mexico, lucha libre and ourselves, to the whole world. Booyaka!\"</p><p>Rey Mysterio and his son, Dominik, have been involved in a heated WWE rivalry against \"The Monday Night Messiah\" Seth Rollins. During the <em>WWE Extreme</em><em> Rules</em> event on WWE Network, Mysterio had one of his eyeballs extracted by Rollins. This resulted in Dominik facing Rollins in a one-on-one match at <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-thunderdome-summerslam-weekend-virtual-fan-experience/\">SummerSlam</a>, with Rollins brutalizing Dominik's body with a kendo stick beforehand. Rey Mysterio is currently on the sidelines with an injury.</p><p>(via <a
