Central</a>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:07:04 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The Witcher 3 Confirmed for Next-Gen, Free Update for Current-Gen Owners","link":"https://www.cbr.com/witcher-3-next-gen-free-update/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Witcher-3-Geralt-Close-Up.jpg\"/></figure><p>CD Projekt Red's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-witcher-3/\"><em>The Witcher 3</em><em>: Wild Hunt</em></a> will be released in its next-gen format for PC, Xbox Series X and PlayStation 5.</p><p>The announcement was made via <a href=\"https://thewitcher.com/en/news/32792/the-witcher-3-wild-hunt-is-coming-to-the-next-generation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>The Witcher</em>'s official website</a>, where it was also confirmed that players who have the game on PC, Xbox One and PS4 will receive the next-gen update for free.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-witcher-monster-slayer-pokemon-go-like/\">T</a><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-witcher-monster-slayer-pokemon-go-like/\">he Witcher: Monster Slayer Gives Players Pokemon Go-like Access to the Continent</a></span></p><p>The update features \"a range of visual and technical improvements,\" including ray tracing and faster loading times. This applies to the base game, as well as its expansions and extra content.</p><p><em>The Witcher</em> games are based on a series of novels by Andrzej Sapkowski that follow the eponymous Witcher Geralt of Rivia, who uses his supernatural abilities to hunt and kill all manner of mystical creatures. Eventually, he becomes linked to a girl named Ciri, who has the power to cross time and space. The series has inspired a wealth of media, including the aforementioned video games and a live-action Netflix series starring Henry Cavill as Geralt.</p><p>Developed by CD Projekt Red, <em>The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt</em> is currently available on Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch and PC.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/witcher-3-geralt-mcfarlane-toys/\">The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Gets Geralt of Rivia Action Figure From McFarlane Toys</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 19:17:08 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Witcher-3-Geralt-Close-Up.jpg","linkMd5":"f4ef2d0cb49b633f54b02f9a15cc136b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn92@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-481_105566e352bed990.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1000,"sourceBytes":296362,"destBytes":296362,"author":"Collier Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Witcher-3-Geralt-Close-Up.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn92@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-481_105566e352bed990.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989073},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Marvel: Iron Fist's Best Costumes (In The Comics) | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/best-iron-fist-costumes-in-the-comics/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Fist-feature-image.jpg\"/></figure><p dir=\"ltr\">Danny Rand aka <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/iron-fist/\">Iron Fist</a> is actually one of the coolest superheroes in the Marvel Universe; not only because of his powers but because of the way he conducts himself even though he is very wealthy. After his parents died in a mysterious plane crash, Danny was rescued by a mythical place, where he trained hard to become <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-heroes-iron-fist-could-defeat-lose-to/\">the immortal Iron Fist</a>.</p><p dir=\"ltr\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-superman-best-worst-comic-costumes/\">Superman: 5 Costumes That Made Him Look Cool (&#38; 5 That Were Just Lame)</a></span></p><p dir=\"ltr\">Over the years in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel-comics/\">Marvel Comics</a>, Iron Fist has played with his fashion sense; wearing old but impactful clothes, thanks to his history of being with a very old organization. It's no secret that he likes the yellow and green texture but there have been many little changes made to his uniform in every other comic. Here are some of them.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>The Immortal One</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Immortal.jpg' /></figure><p><p dir=\"ltr\">When the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-vs-x-men-iron-fist-phoenix-force/\">Iron Fist comic books</a> series went through a reboot in 2006, the writersーEd Brubaker and Matt Fractionーdecided to make a telling change to the look of their superhero, although they tried to keep the main parts intact. The green and yellow didn't leave its place, although the costume changed to give a more modern look. The whole body was covered, with a dragon tattoo printed right in the middle of the costume.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\">There weren't huge changes made from the classic but all of them were clearly visible. In this whole new series, Danny fought shirtless a couple of times as well but he never changed his costume. He was, maybe, the second or maybe the third hottest dude in Hell's Kitchen after Daredevil and Luke Cage, of course.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Not Our Iron Fist</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Orson-randall.jpg' /></figure><p><p dir=\"ltr\">Orson Randall was another <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-netflix-replace-iron-fist/\">Iron Fist</a>, whose history is quite gripping. He was brought up in K'un Lun and as expected, he began to master his skills as an Iron Fist. After he became a master of the trait, he joined a group called The Freedom's Five, who fought in World War 1.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Daredevil Vs. Iron Fist: Which Defender Would Win in a Fight?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/daredevil-vs-iron-first-who-would-win/\">Daredevil Vs. Iron Fist: Which Defender Would Win In A Fight?</a></span></p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\">But his adventures started to weigh heavily on his shoulders, as he went into hiding and became addicted to drugs. His Iron Fist costume was also green and yellow, but with a slight change as the dragon tattoo printed in the middle of the costume gave a black look. Orson also seemed to wear a jacket around his green shirt, which gave a decent golden look, although it kind of ruined the black dragon crest.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Iron Man's Version</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tony-Stark.jpg' /></figure><p><p dir=\"ltr\">This is the most peculiar version of Iron Fist costumes as this came out of nowhere, quite literally, and stayed only for one adventure. The event for this was the emergence of Serpent, an Asgardian villain who craved Odin's throne. Obviously, he attacked and some of the Marvel superheroes had to team up to try and stop him.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\">But the Serpent's powers were so scary that Tony Stark had to engineer new suits for almost everyone in order to gain an advantage over their enemy. Iron Fist's suit was green and yellow but it had a chain attached to it which Danny could use in battle. It was intimidating and scary, to say the least.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Heroes For Hire</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-man.jpg' /></figure><p><p dir=\"ltr\"><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-defenders-strongest-most-powerful-members-ever-ranked/\">In the Netflix series, <em>The Defenders</em></a>, fans saw how well <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-iron-fist-vs-luke-cage-win-lose-fight/\">Luke Cage and Iron Fist</a> gelled together. Well, the inspiration of that was taken from David Walker's reunion comic book series - Power Man and Iron Fist, released in 2016.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/arrowverse-best-costumes/\">15 Best Costumes In The Arrowverse, Ranked</a></span></p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\">A modern-day comic book series demands a modern look from the beloved superheroes and the artists attempted to do exactly that. Iron Fist can be seen sporting a green tracksuit, which feels much lighter, with the ever glowing yellow mask and the dragon printed on the chest looking more lively than ever. It embodies the current generation as people love wearing light and comfortable clothes.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>New Avengers</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/New-avengers.jpg' /></figure><p><p dir=\"ltr\">Luke Cage and Iron Fist have been best friends for a while and upon The Power Man's request, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-new-avengers-decade-ranked/\">Danny Rand joined the New Avengers</a>, only this time, he had a total change in his costume. This happened when the New Avengers were involved in a problem featuring the Eye of Agamotto, with Doctor Strange caught right in the middle of all the chaos.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\">Iron Fist looked completely different, with the mask giving a new golden look and the body covered in a beautiful white suit. The dragon tattoo printed on the white shirt was the best thing because the golden look actually suited Danny a lot. Some might say this is the best Iron Fist costume ever but the very first suit will always remain on top of the chart.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>The Cult Classic</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Classic.jpg' /></figure><p><p dir=\"ltr\"><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-marvel-iron-fist-finn-jones-comics-accurate/\">Danny Rand</a> burst upon the scene with a comic book in 1974, introducing himself as a boy billionaire lost in the world of grown-ups. Fortunately, he found himself in a place called K'un-Lun, and there, he found a purpose. After years of hard work, he finally became the Iron Fist and returned to New York. His first appearance laid the groundwork for his costumes for years to come.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\">The green around his body, while the yellow on his head, with the dragon tattoo on his open chest, left a pretty intimidating look and one that stayed with him and the fans for decades before it was finally changed in 2006. To date, this is Iron Fist's best look because it matches his personality and colorful childhood. Although the new ones have started replacing this look, fans would love to see it being reintroduced.</p></p><p><p dir=\"ltr\"><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Marvel-Less: 20 TV Shows Marvel Cancelled Way Too Soon\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cancelled-marvel-tv-shows/\">Marvel-Less: 20 TV Shows Marvel Cancelled Way Too Soon</a></span></p></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 02:00:33 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Fist-feature-image.jpg","linkMd5":"e1960377392d3d4ab6e60c1791a0361e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-564_18ce63b28c05391a.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":167184,"destBytes":167184,"author":"Nishid Motwani","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Fist-feature-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-564_18ce63b28c05391a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Immortal.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn80@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-39-255_2b53b6363704d632.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Orson-randall.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn43@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-38-111_996490fa4b880617.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tony-Stark.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Power-man.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn44@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-42-721_17ccb123af45619c.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/New-avengers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn21@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-38-027_8970d911571d10c5.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Classic.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989063},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"One Piece: 5 Winners Of Wano Country Arc (& 5 Losers) | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-country-arc-winners-losers/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luffy-vs-Kaido-Wano.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Wano Country arc has been built up to be the greatest story arc of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\">One Piece</a></em> to date. It was first teased by Eiichiro Oda during the Thriller Bark arc of the series and has, since then, been name-dropped quite a bunch of times.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-eustass-kid-facts/\">One Piece: 10 Things You Should Know About Eustass Kid</a></span></p><p>Having finally entered the arc now, the story focuses on Luffy and his newly made allies trying to take on one of the Four Emperors of the Sea, Kaido, in an all-out War. Like with every battle, there will be winners and losers in the end, and here are 5 of each from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-best-arc-improve/\"><em>One Piece's</em> greatest arc in the making</a>.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Winner: Luffy</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luffy-Advanced-Ryou.jpg' /></figure><p>Luffy is the captain of the Straw Hat Pirates and the man central to the Four Emperors Saga. He's allied with the Samurai of Wano to take on Yonko Kaido and Big Mom and declared war everyone at once.</p><p>Luffy may not be on the level of the Yonko just yet, however, he's going to be the winner in the battle at the end of the day. He'll also be the man closest to the <em>One Piece</em> once the Wano arc ends.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Loser: Scratchmen Apoo</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Scratchmen-Apoo-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>The captain of the On-Air Pirates, Apoo is one of the Worst Generation pirates, just like Luffy. Apoo has been allied with Kaido and the Beasts Pirates for quite a long time now and probably serves as one of the Headliners of the crew.</p><p>He's an incredibly powerful character, as expected of a man with a 350 million berries bounty. Unfortunately for Apoo, he's chosen the wrong side to be allied with in the war and will turn out to be a loser.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Winner: Trafalgar Law</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Trafalgar-Law-Punk-Hazard.jpg' /></figure><p>A pirate hailing from the North Blue, Law is almost as important to the Wano Country arc as Luffy. He's the man who set <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-better-marineford/\">the plan to take down Kaido</a> in motion and is largely responsible for everything that is happening in the arc right now.</p><p>Law will, undoubtedly, become a great pirate by the end of the series and the Wano Country arc is a great window for him to show what he's truly capable of.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Loser: Basil Hawkins</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Basil-Hawkins-Featured.jpg' /></figure><p>Basil Hawkins is the captain of the Hawkins Pirates and a member of the Worst Generation as well. His bounty sits at 320 million berries, which just goes to show that he's a rather powerful pirate.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-zoro-better-sanji/\">One Piece: 5 Things Zoro Does Better Than Sanji (&#38; 5 Sanji Does Better Than Him)</a></span></p><p>Hawkins chose to ally with Kaido when Kid decided to fight him and in doing so, joined the wrong side. It goes without saying that Kaido's side will end up getting defeated in the Wano Country war and it is Luffy who will triumph.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Winner: Eustass Kid</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Eustass-Kid-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>The captain of the Kid Pirates, Eustass Kid clashed with Kaido long before the Wano Country arc began and was imprisoned by the Yonko. Having been set free by Luffy, Kid eventually joined the alliance, although his goal is to take all the glory for himself by becoming the one to kill Kaido.</p><p>Along with Luffy and Law, Kid is one of the most crucial characters in the Wano Country war and he'll definitely end up as a winner once everything is done and dusted.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Loser: Kurozumi Orochi</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Orochis-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p>Orochi is the Shogun of Wano Country and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-little-known-trivia/\">the man responsible for putting Wano in a long era of darkness</a>. 20 years ago, he played a big role in the execution of Oden but failed to kill his samurai.</p><p>Now, Oden's men are prepared to end his rule once and for all and set Wano Country free. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-arc-best-moments/\">Orochi was recently shown to have been decapitated by Kaido</a>, however, his death remains unconfirmed. Either way, he'll be on the losing end once the arc is over.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Winner: The Akazaya Nine</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Akazaya-Nine-Oden.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-5-strongest-samurai-in-wano-5-weakest/\">The Akazaya Nine are the Samurai of Kozuki Oden</a> and the men who have inherited his will. Together, they plan to kill anyone standing in the way of their Lord's dream.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-straw-hat-grand-fleet-members-join/\">5 Characters Who Will Join The Straw Hat Grand Fleet (&#38; 5 Who Won't)</a></span></p><p>The Akazaya Nine have allied with several pirates and made preparations over the years to finally get the chance to kill Kaido. With Kaido's potential death at the end of the arc, they could become huge winners.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Loser: Big Mom</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/big-mom.jpg' /></figure><p>Big Mom came to Wano Country in search of Straw Hat Luffy as he ruined all sorts of things that were dear to her during the Whole Cake Island arc. She ended up allying with Kaido and is now up against Luffy and the allies.</p><p>Just like Kaido, Big Mom is, at the end of the day, going to be a loser once the battle is over. With <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-arc-top-pirate-bounties/\">a bounty of over 4.3 billion Berries</a> there's no denying that she's one of the strongest people in the war, she's definitely not someone who will succeed in her goals.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Winner: Kozuki Clan</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Kozuki-Hiyori-Komurasaki.jpg' /></figure><p>Kozuki Oden and Toki died 20 years ago, however, their bloodline still lives in Hiyori and Momonosuke. To pull Wano out from the depths of hell, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-biggest-events-might-happen-wano-country-arc/\">the Kozuki clan will have to eventually return</a> to power.</p><p>Inevitably, once the arc is over, Momonosuke, or preferably Hiyori, will be the one who will lead the Land of Wano and in doing so, they'll get what was rightfully theirs.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Loser: Kaido</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/kaido-in-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-top-strongest-characters-wano-country-ranked-strength/\">Kaido is the current strongest creature in the world of <em>One Piece</em></a> and he's the biggest antagonist of the Wano Country arc. He's up against a massive force and although he's the strongest, he'll end up losing because that's the only way the story can possibly move forward.</p><p>With the combined effort of everyone, Kaido will definitely fall once everything is done and he'll end up as a big loser of the arc.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-highest-bounties/\">One Piece: The 10 Highest Bounties Ever</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:30:43 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luffy-vs-Kaido-Wano.jpg","linkMd5":"e3e1911e65cfb997bd2dd0a47d4180b0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn84@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-31-577_d65d251f64595b3c.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":79366,"destBytes":79366,"author":"Rei Penber","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luffy-vs-Kaido-Wano.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn84@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-31-577_d65d251f64595b3c.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luffy-Advanced-Ryou.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn8@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-39-360_9662827a0a76383b.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Scratchmen-Apoo-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn68@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-43-821_94c33f37cf595ec7.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Trafalgar-Law-Punk-Hazard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn65@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-40-739_fe61e5464ceb7fea.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Basil-Hawkins-Featured.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-39-649_d8fe51a0149c20cd.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Eustass-Kid-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn26@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-43-510_07db6787b94cf767.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Orochis-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn74@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-38-297_5eeb498daa9514d2.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Akazaya-Nine-Oden.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/big-mom.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn86@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-069_4b1735cbcf1dc03b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Kozuki-Hiyori-Komurasaki.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn38@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-41-269_5b4be3dccae2ee65.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/kaido-in-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn53@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-39-910_cf56a81ac6219745.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989071},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"REVIEW: Woke Is a Funny Take on the Struggle Between Art and Activism","link":"https://www.cbr.com/woke-2020-review/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>When the first episode of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/woke/\">Woke</a> begins, cartoonist Keith Knight (<em>New Girl</em>’s Lamorne Morris) is on top of the world. His comic strip <em>Toast N’ Butter</em>, featuring an anthropomorphic breakfast food duo, is about to be nationally syndicated. He’s the featured guest at an upcoming comic-con in San Francisco, where he lives. He’s about to move out of the apartment he shares with a pair of slacker roommates and into a nice house with his beautiful lawyer girlfriend. When local journalist Ayana (Sasheer Zamata) stops him at his favorite comics shop and praises his strip for its subtle commentary on racial politics, he stops her. He doesn’t want the obligation of representing all Black people in his art. He just wants to “keep it light.”</p><p>And then he’s tackled and handcuffed by aggressive cops while innocently posting flyers for his comic-con appearance, mistaken for a robbery suspect who of course looks nothing like him. Although he’s not ignorant of the prevalence of racism in America, he never thought something like that would happen to him, and it shatters his entire world. Keith starts hearing inanimate objects talk to him, berating him for his apathy and his willingness to have his art co-opted by corporate interests. He finally has a full-on breakdown onstage during his comic-con appearance, trashing his own creations and torpedoing his career in the process.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/high-fidelity-zoe-kravtiz-calls-out-hulu-lack-diversity/\">High Fidelity Star Zoë Kravitz Calls Out Hulu for Lack of Diversity</a></span></p><p>It’s an extreme and sometimes off-putting introduction to what quickly shifts into a more low-key comedy about the struggles of a Black creator in the Bay Area, and the real-life Knight, who co-created the show with Marshall Todd, pushes his namesake a little too far in order to make a relatively basic point. The show’s Keith doesn’t need to have a mental breakdown to become aware of societal inequality, and the apparent equation of mental illness and social responsibility is a little disingenuous.</p><p>Luckily, the show tones down the presence of the talking objects in subsequent episodes, without losing its sharply observed social commentary. Keith still hears voices from trashcans and paper bags and his own ever-present marker (voiced by J.B. Smoove), but it’s more of a stylistic choice for the show than a representation of a man losing his grip on reality.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-blake-anderson-lamorne-morris.jpg\"/></figure><p>There’s a lot to like about <em>Woke</em>, which is inspired by Knight’s autobiographical comics (including long-running strips <em>The K Chronicles</em> and <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-knight-life/\">The Knight Life</a></em>), and it settles into an entertaining groove pretty quickly, with a sitcom-style ensemble including Keith, Ayana, Keith’s roommates Clovis (T. Murph) and Gunther (<em>Workaholics</em>’ Blake Anderson), and Keith’s new artist love interest Adrienne (<em>iZombie</em>’s Rose McIver). Once Keith tanks his chances at syndication success with <em>Toast N’ Butter</em>, he struggles to reinvent himself as a socially conscious artist, not entirely comfortable in Ayana’s world of activism or in Adrienne’s world of high art, but unable to just sit back and let the easy money roll in, as Clovis suggests he should. Instead, he works to combine his audience-friendly cartoon style with a more explicitly political point of view, with mixed results.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hulu-renews-solar-opposites-and-crossing-swords/\">Hulu Renews Solar Opposites and Crossing Swords</a></span></p><p>He also navigates relationship difficulties and works to make ends meet, in more familiar kinds of storylines. As the eight-episode season goes on, the supporting characters get their own subplots as well, and the central ensemble has fun, relaxed chemistry. The female characters start out as plot devices for Keith to expand his horizons in various directions, but Zamata and McIver make them vibrant and memorable right away, and the show later develops deeper personalities for them while retaining their humor. Stand-up comedian Murph gets the showiest role as the brash, womanizing Clovis, but he eventually shows a vulnerable side as well.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-t-murph-sasheer-zamata.jpg\"/></figure><p>Throughout, various celebrities lend their voices to the objects that Keith hears talking to him, and it’s an amusing device, if never quite as effective a metaphor for political awareness as the creators seem to think it is. The likable Morris holds the show together as an insecure but well-intentioned creative type who’s still finding his voice, and while Keith is the show’s most subdued character (even when he thinks he’s going crazy), Morris is never overwhelmed by the wackier supporting performances. As in fellow Hulu comedies <em>Shrill</em> and <em>Ramy</em>, both based on the real-life experiences of their artist creators, <em>Woke</em> sometimes shifts awkwardly from the personal to the goofy, but it has more genuine laughs than a lot of overly serious streaming TV “comedies.”</p><p>Knight has decades of experience delivering social commentary in a funny, easy to digest format, and he makes a strong transition to another medium here. <em>Woke</em> may not give viewers the kind of jarring wake-up call that its main character experiences in that first episode, but it provides thoughtful analysis along with humor, and that’s probably more effective in the long run.</p><p><em>Starring Lamorne Morris, T. Murph, Blake Anderson, Sasheer Zamata and the voice of J.B. Smoove, the eight-episode first season of Woke premieres Wednesday, Sept. 9 on Hulu.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/feels-good-man-review/\">Feels Good Man Thoroughly Chronicles the Strange Journey of Pepe the Frog</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 17:45:36 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-header.jpg","linkMd5":"3f743c83299a37ef3ca68f103647ad02","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-644_01bc8edf3563799a.webp","destWidth":6000,"destHeight":3000,"sourceBytes":2458703,"destBytes":1772062,"author":"Josh Bell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-644_01bc8edf3563799a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-blake-anderson-lamorne-morris.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn69@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-39-766_fa06b249cf8261d5.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/woke-t-murph-sasheer-zamata.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn5@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-44-301_4fb66eb93c61db9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Super Mario 3D All-Stars: Scalpers Are Already Listing ‘Preorders’ on eBay","link":"https://www.cbr.com/mario-all-stars-scalpers-already-listing-preorders/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mario-3d-all-stars.jpg\"/></figure><p>With the 35th anniversary of the world's favorite Italian plumber right around the corner, Nintendo has announced a brand new collection of classic <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mario/\"><em>Super Mario</em></a> games for the Switch. Unfortunately, this announcement has come with the albatross that has been hanging around Nintendo's neck for a long time: scalpers.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nintendo-switch-super-mario-64-sunshine-galaxy-remasters/\">The rumors</a> swirling about Nintendo's plans to remaster much of Mario's back-catalog for his 35th anniversary were true, and <em>Super Mario 3D All-Stars</em> was finally announced <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/super-mario-bros-35th-anniversary-direct/\">during a Direct</a> focusing on how Nintendo plans to celebrate its mascot. This title combines <em>Super Mario 64, Super Mario Sunshine</em> and<em> Super Mario Galaxy</em>, three of Mario's popular 3D platformers, into one package. However, However, this exciting announcement comes with a caveat: the collection will only be available to purchase until the end of March 2021.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/super-mario-galaxy-tragic-story-rosalina/\">Super Mario Galaxy Contains the Series Most Tragic Story</a></span></p><p>As gamers rush to secure their copies to have some <em>Mario</em> fun in two weeks, another group is rushing to take advantage of the situation and profit off of the potential scarcity. Scalpers are the bane of many fan bases, buying up limited items like collectibles and concert tickets to sell at increased prices. Nintendo in particular has had issues with scalpers, especially with collectibles like its mini-consoles and amiibo figurines.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/NES-Classic-Mini.jpg\"/></figure><p>For its part, Nintendo hasn't done a great job of keeping scalpers in check. The company is known for producing fewer products than would sell, most notably only making about 2.3 million NES Classic Edition consoles at launch. These sold out almost immediately, making it virtually impossible to find. Those who were unable to secure preorders were faced with the prospect of paying at least double due to scalpers.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/animal-crossing-super-mario-furniture-march-2021/\">Animal Crossing: Nintendo Announces Super Mario-Themed Furniture</a></span></p><p>The decision to limit <em>Super Mario 3D All-Stars</em>' availability to six months is an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mario-all-stars-limited-makes-no-sense/\">odd choice</a> that practically invites scalpers to take advantage of the situation. Within just hours of the game's announcement, there were already pages and pages of preorders listings for the game <a href=\"https://www.ebay.com/sch/i.html?_from=R40&#38;_trksid=p2380057.m570.l1313&#38;_nkw=super+mario+3d+all-stars&#38;_sacat=0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">on sale on eBay</a>. Most scalpers are asking for between $90 and $120 dollars for a game that is priced at $59.99.</p><p>However, for those who can't secure a preorder but don't want to pay a scalper's asking price, there is another option: buying the game digitally. While it may not come with the box and cartridge that many fans, especially collectors, want to own, it'll keep you from making the difficult choice between missing out on the game and paying a bad actor for a copy. Still, much of the blame falls on Nintendo for limiting sales and having a reputation for dragging its feet when re-upping supply for collectibles. If history is an indicator, it may be hard to get a hold of a physical copy of <em>Super Mario 3D All-Stars</em>, so it's not at all surprising that some people would see that as an opportunity.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/super-mario-bros-35-battle-royale/\">Super Mario Bros. 35 Transforms the Classic Platformer Into a Battle Royale</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:15:45 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mario-3d-all-stars.jpg","linkMd5":"074f984833153f998add757db8a83071","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn40@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-485_b40fabc6045cc3e3.webp","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":65766,"destBytes":65766,"author":"Leo Holman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/mario-3d-all-stars.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn40@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-485_b40fabc6045cc3e3.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/NES-Classic-Mini.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn65@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-43-534_da17408c59ca2662.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The 10 Best Anti-Heroes In DC Comics | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/best-anti-heroes-dc-comics-harley-quinn/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-10-Best-Anti-Heroes-In-DC-Comics-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p>In the history of the medium, anti-heroes are a relatively new addition to comics. Coming out of the late-'70s, these heroes were different than the ones that came before them, more willing to get extreme with their punishment of crime. They were harder-edged heroes living in a harder-edged world.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-characters-old-lady-harley-treatment/\">10 DC Characters We Want To See Get The Old Lady Harley Treatment</a></span></p><p>While the heroes of the DC Universe are more known for being bright, cheery, and optimistic, there are some who walk the darker path of the anti-hero. This would bring them into conflict with some of the older heroes of the DC Universe, but that wouldn't stop them. Let's take a look at the best anti-heroes in DC Comics.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Wild Dog</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Wild-Dog.jpg' /></figure><p>Let's get this out of the way at the start – <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wild-dog/\">Wild Dog</a> is basically the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/punisher/\">Punisher</a> in hockey clothes. The character feels like someone came up with a look first and built around it. However, there's something that's actually pretty cool about Wild Dog. Sure, he's partly a copy of a more popular character but there are so many comic characters like that out there.</p><p>Wild Dog doesn't get a lot of love; in fact, he rarely gets any at all. However, he had a nice turn in <em>Cave Carson Has A Cybernetic Eye, </em>re-introducing him to a whole new segment of fans and showcasing what set him apart from the Punisher – that he has an actual personality <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-heroes-wild-dog-beat-cant/\">beyond vengeance</a> and killing.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Artemis</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/artemis-requiem.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/artemis/\">Artemis</a> started life in the '90s. An Amazonian from the city of Bana-Mighdall, she would win a contest to become the new Wonder Woman, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-artemis-replacement-great-terrible-comparison/\">replacing Diana for a time</a>. She would lose her life during this period but this being comics, Artemis would eventually get resurrected. She would be a background player on Themyscira for years.</p><p>Recently, Artemis joined up with Red Hood and Bizarro, the three forming a dark mirror to the Trinity at the center of the DC Universe, fighting crime with a more violent edge than their counterparts.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Black Adam</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Black-Adam-2.jpg' /></figure><p>For years, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-adam/\">Black Adam</a> was an opponent of Shazam. He started life in the far-off past as a hero and possessed the body of a descendant but eventually, his \"heroic\" side sprang forth. He would start hanging out with the Justice Society, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-characters-black-adam-destroyed/\">fighting evil with more of an edge</a> than his teammates.</p><p>This would bring Black Adam into conflict with the rest of the team and he would break away from them, violently taking back his home country of Kahndaq from a monstrous dictator with the help of friends he made during his JSA days. From there, things would go downhill, as Black Adam would become more openly evil but still followed his ancient code of conduct while thinking he was the good guy.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>The Comedian</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/before-watchmen-comedian-vietnam-display.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most morally repugnant heroes of the comic <em>Watchmen, </em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-comedian/\">the Comedian</a> was known for his violent nature from the beginning of his career. There were very few things he found any qualms about doing and he gloried in the insanity of war, indulging his bloodlust in the chaotic orgy of violence that was Vietnam. The Comedian qualifies as an anti-hero because he was a member of the Watchmen, but he was also an awful person who committed many unforgivable atrocities.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/heroes-marvel-dc-comics-stole-each-other/\">5 Heroes Marvel Stole From DC (&#38; 5 DC Stole)</a></span></p><p>The Comedian's murder was the catalyst for the entire mystery at the center of the comic, the taint of his darkness throwing a pall over everything that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/watchmen-most-thought-provoking-quotes/\">made readers ponder the central question of the book- \"Who watches the watchmen?\"</a></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Huntress</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Huntress.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/birds-prey-huntress-trivia-details/\">Helena Bertinelli took a strange road to heroism</a>. The child of a mob boss, she watched her family get gunned down and swore vengeance, spending her early years training herself into a machine meant for revenge. Helena would come to Gotham City to take her revenge, assume the mantle of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/huntress/\">Huntress</a>, and ultimately run afoul of Batman.</p><p>Batman didn't like her bloody tactics and the two would come to blows on multiple occasions, but eventually, Huntress would become an ally to the Dark Knight. She would work with the rest of the Batman family in their mission to clean up Gotham, although she may have used a bit too much force at times.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Deadshot</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GalleryComics-1920x1080-20160803-SuicideSquadDeadshot1-577fe69ad10589.20985089-57a136d8eb72c6.64997058-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>A former Batman villain and long time member of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/suicide-squad/\">Suicide Squad</a> and the Secret Six, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/deadshot/\">Deadshot</a> would totally front like he was still a villain but he has been more of an anti-hero for years. While he is still a killer and walks on the more violent side of things, Deadshot spends most of his time now fighting against worse people than him.</p><p>A complicated man, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-suicide-suqad-vs-secret-six/\">Deadshot's runs with the Suicide Squad and Secret Six</a> have gained him more fans and recognition than he ever got as a villain, turning him from someone who started out evil to becoming one of the best anti-heroes in DC Comics.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Red Hood</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Red-Hood.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/jason-todd/\">Jason Todd</a> was once Robin before he had an unfortunate meeting with the Joker, a crowbar, and a whole mess of explosives. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-jason-todd-resurrection-good-idea-stayed-dead/\">He would stay dead for years before being resurrected</a> and becoming the Red Hood, clashing with his old mentor and generally making a nuisance of himself throughout Gotham City.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-powerless-villains-pose-threats/\">DC: 5 Powerless Villains That Pose A Serious Threat (&#38; 5 That Do Not)</a></span></p><p>Eventually, Red Hood would rejoin the side of angels, becoming the deadliest member of the Batman family. While Batman and the others would have to rein in Jason's more violent tendencies at times, Red Hood has fully embraced a return to heroics, even if his methods are more of the anti-heroic persuasion.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Deathstroke</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/deathstroke.jpg' /></figure><p>With <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/deathstroke/\">Deathstroke</a>, things go back and forth. Sometimes, he's the best mercenary in the DC Universe, using his enhanced strength, speed, and intellect to battle the heroes and make money. Other times, he's fighting against threats that are worse than he is...and still making money. That's Deathstroke in a nutshell – he doesn't mind doing good or bad things if the price is right.</p><p>It certainly helps that Deathstroke is one of the most formidable combatants on the planet, able to singlehandedly defeat teams of both heroes and villains. He's always several steps ahead of his opponents and has no problem proving just how good he is, whether it's for the right or wrong reasons.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Rorschach</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Rorschach-Watchmen-12.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/rorschach/\">Rorschach</a> is probably the most popular character from <em>Watchmen. </em>Forged by a terrible childhood full of abuse and violence, he would create a new identity for himself as a crime fighter, becoming more and more unhinged as he gazed into the abyss of the criminal psyche. Walter Kovacs, what little there was of him, died and Rorshach took over.</p><p>Rorschach was never meant to be the character that readers loved and empathized with but that is what happened. A line can be drawn from his popularity to the subsequent \"grim and gritty\" era of comics that blossomed after <em>Watchmen. </em>However, many people learned the wrong lesson from Rorschach – he was a damaged yet compelling character who used his violence to make sense of the world. While he is a near-perfect anti-hero, Rorschach is not someone to look up to.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Harley Quinn</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BM80-KeyMoments-marq-HarleyQuinn-5ce444cb576b16.98898302-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/harley-quinn/\">Harley Quinn</a> is the little engine who could. Starting out as Joker's girlfriend on <em>Batman: The Animated Series, </em>she would continue to grow in popularity over the years. She would get her own book, join teams, and move away from the Joker, becoming one of DC's most popular characters.</p><p>There's just something about Harley – her attitude, madcap humor, the tenderness underneath it all – that really speaks to fans, from comic readers to movie-goers and Hot Topic shoppers. She tells jokes while beating people to death with mallets, but underneath it all there is a heart that makes her wonderfully palatable and a great character to spend time with.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-retcons-best-worst-hated-loved/\">DC: 5 Controversial Retcons Fans Actually Loved (&#38; 5 They Hated)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:30:36 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-10-Best-Anti-Heroes-In-DC-Comics-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"8dd95a8fb868f8edbb5dbbb0bc4b26ad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn63@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-29-502_5c93fc75e4482e8d.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":200466,"destBytes":200466,"author":"David Harth","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-10-Best-Anti-Heroes-In-DC-Comics-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn63@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-29-502_5c93fc75e4482e8d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Wild-Dog.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn74@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-34-176_ad5b2b6298a24f53.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/artemis-requiem.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn4@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-35-196_78ade7f6fbd6b4a6.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Black-Adam-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn88@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-35-375_c23f68124da07f47.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/before-watchmen-comedian-vietnam-display.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn60@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-36-741_9b3771f301606401.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Huntress.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-35-225_e2f20dd266a2ef55.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GalleryComics-1920x1080-20160803-SuicideSquadDeadshot1-577fe69ad10589.20985089-57a136d8eb72c6.64997058-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn82@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-40-848_0afc41dfe5aac743.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Red-Hood.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn40@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-43-537_240fc892fd3110da.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/deathstroke.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-38-410_93c3086b3cde56e1.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Rorschach-Watchmen-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn98@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-41-811_cb41970019df54dd.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BM80-KeyMoments-marq-HarleyQuinn-5ce444cb576b16.98898302-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn44@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-40-624_737f42effb023f29.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Mulan: Ming-Na Wen DOES Have a Cameo in the Remake - Here's Where to Find It","link":"https://www.cbr.com/mulan-ming-na-wen-remake-cameo-where-to-find-it/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Mulan-Live-action-Animated-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mulan/\">Mulan</a>, available now through Premier Access on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/disney-plus/\">Disney+</a>.</strong></em></p><p>Ming-Na Wen broke ground as one of the first Asian actresses to go on to star or guest star in popular television series such as <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/er/\">E.R.</a>, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/agents-of-shield/\">Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.</a> </em>and<em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-mandalorian/\">The Mandalorian</a>, </em>but she's probably best known as the voice of Fa Mulan in Disney's original 1998 animated classic. She returned to the role several times, in 2004's <em>Mulan II</em> and in guest appearances in other Disney properties. In the fourth decade of an illustrious career, Wen was no longer an appropriate age to play the character in the 2020 live-action remake -- that honor went to Liu Yifei -- but the veteran of stage and screen played coy as to whether or not she'd make an appearance, saying she could <a href=\"https://www.bustle.com/p/ming-na-wen-hinted-at-a-mulan-cameo-while-giving-disneys-live-action-movie-her-blessing-12574206\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">neither confirm nor deny</a> suspicions in interviews.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mulan-why-mushu-left-out/\">Mulan Director Digs Deeper Into Why Mushu Was Left Out Of The Live-Action Remake</a></span></p><p>Rumors abounded as to what character she might portray if she did appear, and details were kept secret from most of the cast and crew. With the primary cast list published long before the movie's planned-then-canceled March premiere, Wen was always unlikely to play a major character. However, Wen does in fact have a cameo in the Disney+ premium release, and it comes at the perfect moment.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/ming-na-wen.jpg\"/></figure><p>At the film's climax, Mulan rescues the Emperor during a high-wire fight with one of the film's villains, Böri Khan (Jason Scott Lee).  Having defeated their mutual enemy, she bows before the Emperor respectfully, fearing he will disapprove that a girl was leading his army. He asks for her name. The scene cuts to the inside of a throne room.</p><p>Having just saved the kingdom and its leader, Mulan is being officially presented at a grand ceremony. That's when Ming-Na Wen, billed in the credits as \"Esteemed Guest,\" walks into view, regal and beautifully costumed. She has the privilege of reintroducing Mulan to the Emperor and the public he commands, speaking one line, “Your Imperial Highness, Huan Mulan.” It's an endearing gesture, and passes the baton from one generation to the next. Both Wen and Liu Yifei clearly grasp the significance of the moment in their performances.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-reveals-mulans-debut-date-for-all-subscribers/\">Disney+ Reveals Mulan's Debut Date For All Subscribers</a></span></p><p>Fans of Wen's and Disney aficionados will spot the actress immediately and appreciate the homage, but the cameo is definitely a bit of an inside reference. The moment might be lost on some younger viewers who've seen the animated <em>Mulan</em> but weren't alive during the pop cultural phenomenon that followed it, including the regular airplay of its theme song \"Reflection\" on the radio. Though Wen voiced the title character's dialogue, singer Lea Salonga is responsible for the vocal performance of \"Reflection\" in the movie, while Christina Aguilera performs the radio version of the song for both films.</p><p>For her part, Wen seems delighted to have been involved in the new film, and even made it a family affair. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com.au/live-action-mulan-ming-na-wen-cameo-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Her daughter</a> can also be found in the crowd of Mulan's presentation ceremony.</p><p><em>Directed by Niki Caro, Disney's live-action Mulan stars Yifei Liu as Mulan, Donnie Yen as Commander Tung, Jason Scott Lee as Böri Khan and Yoson An as Chen Honghui, with Gong Li as Xianniang and Jet Li as the Emperor. The film is now available through Premier Access on Disney+.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mulan-2020-review/\">Mulan Turns Disney's Animated Classic Into An Exciting Action Movie</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 03:45:19 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Mulan-Live-action-Animated-header.jpg","linkMd5":"d7331166938060a6a933faae3cf42f3d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn20@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-30-168_150ff0200c67ae8c.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":101064,"destBytes":101064,"author":"Rita Dorsch","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Mulan-Live-action-Animated-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn20@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-30-168_150ff0200c67ae8c.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/ming-na-wen.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn19@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-42-562_97b30f40ab45844a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989060},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Brizzy Voices YouTuber Returns to Rap Your Favorite Cartoon Character Voices From A-Z","link":"https://www.cbr.com/brizzy-voices-youtuber-rap-cartoon-character-voices/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/BrizzyVoices-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>YouTuber Anna Brisbin, better known as BrizzyVoices, has posted a new video of herself performing Blackalicious' \"Alphabet Aerobics.\" In the video, Brisbin imitates a wide range of cartoon characters. New episodes of Season 2 arrive Fridays.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 17:55:03 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/the-boys-funko-header.jpg","linkMd5":"cf8d7ce1cfc789fb6a5ccb34b503608c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn7@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-026_c9474e755c51a536.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":87554,"destBytes":87554,"author":"John Ridlehoover","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/the-boys-funko-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn7@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-026_c9474e755c51a536.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Crunchyroll’s New Tiered Membership Is a BIG Step Forward to Combat Piracy","link":"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyrolls-new-tiered-membership-is-a-big-step-forward-to-combat-piracy/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/crunchyroll-logo.jpg\"/></figure><p>Watching anime has never been more popular, and thanks to Crunchyroll, it's equally as convenient. With a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crunchyroll-tiered-membership-offline-viewing/\">revamped series of membership</a> services and the ability for fans to watch episodes of their favorite shows faster than ever, Crunchyroll has positioned itself as the premiere anime streaming service. The various new perks offered to its members not only provide simple entertainment for the fans, but also help to officially support the Japanese anime industry from all across the world. This, along with KissAnime's recent death, continue to kill off the rampant piracy that has consistently been a part of the non-Japanese fandom.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/how-you-can-support-anime-industry/\">How YOU Can Support the Anime Industry</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CR-Premium-Tiers-PR16x9-Orbs.png\"/></figure><p>Instead of the simple Free and Premium tiers of the previous version of Crunchyroll's membership, the service now has several options. These include Free, Fan, Mega Fan and Ultimate Fan. The latter three all offer a variety of benefits, with the most notable being unhindered access to Crunchyroll's entire library. This means that fans can not only read through the numerous manga that the service provides, but also watch the entirety of the available anime shows, completely ad-free. Likewise, viewers will have access to same-day simulcasts of shows' Japanese airings, while those with only the free version of the service will have to wait a week for new episodes.</p><p>Other features include offline viewing for when wireless streaming isn't possible. The higher cost memberships also allow for multiple streams across one account. These features, common among other streaming services like Hulu and Netflix, have been demanded from Crunchyroll for years, and their presence make the service more competitive than ever. Ironically, Crunchyroll itself began as an illegal streaming service for anime, but not only has it legally offered content for years, it has potentially become the best way to gain access to the most popular and obscure anime out there.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/death-note-another-note-best-american-names/\">The Death Note: Another Note Has the BEST 'American' Names</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Light-Laughed-At-The-Death-Note-In-the-Manga-.jpg\"/></figure><p>This paid access to material helps to officially support production studios and the anime industry as a whole. Piracy has been a constant moral issue with many fans outside of Japan who wish to watch or read certain series, but don't have an official international release to support. This lack of international availability drastically increased piracy within the industry, as many took to torrents and sites such as Putlocker to watch shows that were otherwise unavailable. Recently, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/kissanime-is-dead-and-it-deserved-to-die/\">well-known pirating website</a> KissAnime was shut down for good after years of essentially robbing the anime industry and the creators within it.</p><p>The convenience factor was one of the biggest reasons to pirate anime, as viewers didn't have to pay outrageous prices for shows that were unavailable in their native country or wait for official releases of episodes. But, with same-day simulcasts, easily affordable price, and an ever increasing library of mainstream and niche shows, Crunchyroll continues to help eliminate the need to turn to illegal means for anime viewing. The official subs and translations will also likely be of a much higher quality than what was found on KissAnime, where oftentimes \"fanlations\" were stolen from other groups. Though piracy sites are seemingly dying their deserved death, Crunchyroll and the anime industry are in a better position than ever to thrive.</p><p><em>Updates to the Crunchyroll Android and iOS applications will be rolling from Aug. 21 to give fans access to these new benefits. Not all users will have access right away, but the updated application should be fully available to global fans in early September. </em></p><p><em>Fans without a current premium membership can learn more by going to <a href=\"http://crunchyroll.com/welcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">crunchyroll.com/welcome</a>. Premium members can learn more at <a href=\"https://www.crunchyroll.com/acct/membership\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">crunchyroll.com/acct/membership</a>.</em></p><p>KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/gundam-seed-what-happened-cosmic-era/\">Gundam SEED: Whatever Happened to the Cosmic Era?</a></p>\n                        \n                        \n dark fates for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman/\">Batman</a> from across the DC Multiverse, ranging from unexpected deaths to eventual corruption. But one of the most tragic may be the most recent, which sees Batman finally accept death on its own terms, even after he helped the future of the world by ensuring the survival of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-woman/\">Wonder Woman</a>.</p><p>Now, <em>Wonder Woman: Dead Earth</em> #4 reveals the final fate of the Batman of this doomed world, and it's tragically fitting end for the Caped Crusader.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-dead-earth-cheetah-ally/\">Wonder Woman: Dead Earth Finally Gives Diana the Perfect Ally</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wonder-Woman-Death-Earth-Batman.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>Wonder Woman: Dead Earth</em> #3 revealed that the Superman of this world ended up being attacked by an enraged Wonder Woman after nuclear war erupted and Thymiscara was wiped out. Wonder Woman soon entered a catatonic state. She would eventually wake up centuries later, unaware of what had happened or who had saved her. In reality, it was the other third of this world's Trinity. Working with the last remaining Superman Robot, Batman ensured that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-uses-superman-skeleton-as-weapon/\">Wonder Woman</a> was protected while recovering from her battle. While the Superman Robot was quick to ask about his own status, Batman revealed that just like the other major cities in the world, Gotham now lays in ruins.</p><p>On top of that, the lingering radiation of the surrounding world has already affected him. He predicts that he wouldn't be much use for much longer anyway, and instead leaves a box--a box that can only be opened by human hands--that could eventually restore Wonder Woman's power. Batman brings her back to the remains of Wayne Manor, and hides her away in suspended animation. Batman notes how much he wishes he could \"end\" Diana for her actions, but his faith that she could restore the world eventually keeps him from lashing out at her. After ensuring her survival by hiding her in the remains of the Bat-Cave, a dying Batman retreats back to the surface.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-dead-earth-remixes-legends-of-the-dead-earth/\">Wonder Woman: Dead Earth Remixes One Of DC's Most Underrated '90s Events</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Wonder-Woman-Dead-Earth-Batman.jpg\"/></figure><p>Reaching into his family liquor cabinet, Batman sits down in his chair and actually takes a drink of alcohol--something he's avoided while putting on the airs of loving to drink as Bruce Wayne. After a moment, the exhausted hero chuckles and finishes his drink. This was where he remains until he dies, drinking amid the ruins of the city he long fought for. This is where Diana finds Bruce decades later, his body reduced to a skeleton on that couch. Diana later takes Batman's utility belt to help her on her journey, in part as a tribute to her fallen friend.</p><p>While Batman may have been enraged by her actions and wished for nothing more than to get his revenge, he still made sure to do the right thing and help protect her. This gives humanity a champion to protect them in the future, helping ensure their survival. In a way, Batman's choice to get over his own sense of vengeance helps ensure the survival of this world, even if he didn't get to see it. But it's also a decidedly tragic end for Batman, the ultimate defeat of the Dark Knight who could conquer any threat, with Batman just accepting his death and letting it come for him as he looked over It hits home hard for Jason as this was the same treatment meted out to him, but now Punchline and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nightwing-bat-family-showdown/\">a brainwashed Dick Grayson</a> are making the mission harder. Jason's freaked out seeing Duela with the mask which the Dollmaker gave it to her <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jokers-daughter-explained/\">to feel closer to the clown</a>, who she believed to be her father.</p><p>Jason knows that she's not actually the Joker's daughter, and he hates seeing her paying for these alleged sins. Noticing the tears in her eyes and pain in her voice, Jason wants to free her, but as he's incapacitated outside, the bomb he set to kill the Joker's thugs actually kills the woman inside the building. Terrified, he rushes in and cradles Duela's dead body, just like the Bat did him as a kid.
