Allan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/5-Times-Batman-Went-Undercover-And-It-Worked-And-5-Times-It-Didnt.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn73@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-29-316_d71258a0c4f28b50.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/matches-malone-display.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn30@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-38-900_46691a1ec5559e10.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-War-Games.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-35-237_b5219d0324c5b129.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Superman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn13@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-44-412_35ffa29cd72fe161.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Skullface.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn34@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-41-979_7bbd849ef35fd0a9.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Hawkman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn4@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-40-314_326e0838eae12d4b.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Sir-Hemingford-Gray.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn18@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-44-252_aeb4fb9af0fbf6c5.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/cyborg-superman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn88@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-35-092_6a84f9947d577a6a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Lefty-Knox.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn21@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-38-904_2564398afaaed7c7.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Jack-Shaw.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-41-409_58f09f5fd9febe50.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/BATMAN-UNDERCOVER-Trey-Malone.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn96@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-37-129_1c6284652d462346.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Hunter x Hunter: 5 Winners Of The Chimera Ant Arc (& 5 Losers)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-chimera-ant-arc-winners-losers/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Chimera-Ant-Arc.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Chimera Ant arc is arguably the most crucial story arc of the <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hunter-x-hunter/\">Hunter x Hunter</a></em> series to date and it plays a massive role in both the progression of the main characters and the worldbuilding in the story.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-fights-best-ranked/\">10 Best Fights In Hunter X Hunter, Ranked</a></span></p><p>The arc sees a man-eating species known as Chimera Ants slowly take over the NGL and to deal with them, Hunters are deployed in the area. Gon and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-hunter-characters-with-most-aura-vs-average-amount-royal-guards-killua-adult-gon/\">Killua</a> are both central to the arc and play a significant role in how the story unfolds. At the end of the arc, though, who are the winners and the losers?</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Winner: Kite</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Kite-killua-gon-vs-pitou-hunter-x-hunter.jpg' /></figure><p>Kite was introduced in the <em>Hunter x Hunter</em> series during the Chimera Ant arc where he also trained Gon and Killua to quite an extent. Although he was unlucky enough to cross paths with Neferpitou and get killed in the process, in doing so, he shaped Gon quite a bit.</p><p>At the same time, once everything was done, Kite was revealed to have reincarnated thanks to a Nen ability.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Loser: Zazan</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Zazan-HxH.jpg' /></figure><p>Zazan was one of the Squadron Leaders of the Chimera Ants. Once the Chimera Ant Queen died, she, like many others, decided to go her own way. Zazan aimed to become the next Queen, however, her dreams came crumbling down when she was confronted by Feitan.</p><p>The two fought quite an intense battle which ended in the death of Zazan and a massive victory for Feitan and the Phantom Troupe.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Winner: Komugi</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/meruem-komugi-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Komugi is one of the very few characters in the arc who played no role in the ongoing fighting yet influenced the story in a major way. She was initially supposed to be a stepping stone for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-meruem-facts-trivia/\">Meruem</a>, however, the King eventually got attached to this frail girl.</p><p>Komugi shaped Meruem in ways nobody could've imagined. She ended up dying with him happily, and there can't be a better winner than her in the arc.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Loser: Meruem</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/meruem-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-meruem-vs-chrollo/\">The King of the Chimera Ants, Meruem</a> started off this arc as someone on the quest for power and the total eradication of inferior species. Thanks to the influence of Komugi and Netero, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-meruem-good-bad/\">Meruem's ways changed eventually</a>, however, he still planned to kill off the unworthy humans.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunterxhunter-characters-can-cannot-defeat-kurapika/\">Hunter X Hunter: 5 Characters Who Can Defeat Kurapika (&#38; 5 Who Can't)</a></span></p><p>As a result of Netero setting off the Poor Man's Rose, Meruem was badly poisoned and his plans didn't come to fruition.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Winner: Netero</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/netero-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Isaac Netero's powers were a big mystery for the <em>Hunter x Hunter</em> fans right from the very beginning of the series. The Chimera Ant arc gave everyone a chance to see what he was truly capable of doing when he took on the mighty Meruem in battle.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-characters-can-potentially-defeat-netero-could-never/\">Netero lost the fight</a>, yet impressed the King and even made him feel fear for the first time. Eventually, he managed to kill him with the Poor Man's Rose and succeeded in what he wanted to do.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Loser: The Royal Guards</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Neferpitou-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>The Royal Guards were the three strongest subordinates of Meruem with incredibly high aura who were sworn to protect him no matter what. They served him quite well and looked out for him throughout most of the arc.</p><p>As Meruem was killed eventually, so were the Guards. Essentially, they failed in their purposes and died, becoming losers of the arc in the process.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Winner: Killua</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/killua-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Killua Zoldyck was one of the main characters in the arc and he played a decent role in stopping the Chimera Ants as well. He progressed by leaps and bounds in the arc and even gained new powers like Godspeed.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/strongest-hunterxhunter-characters/\">10 Strongest Characters Hunter X Hunter Characters</a></span></p><p>What's more, Killua finally broke free of Illumi's control and was finally able to face his biggest fears. Without a doubt, he was one of the biggest winners of the Chimera Ant arc.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Loser: Cheetu</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Cheetu-hxh.jpg' /></figure><p>Another Squadron Leader like Zazan, Cheetu was quite a tough one to take on in battle. He clashed against the likes of Morel and did well against him. His downfall, however, was his overconfidence, which eventually led to his death as well.</p><p>Towards the end of the arc, Cheetu crossed paths with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-zoldyck-family-members-ranked-strength/\">the Zoldyck family</a> and made the mistake of challenging them to a battle. He was one-shot by Silva Zoldyck.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Winner: Gon Freecss</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Adult-Gon-Featured.jpg' /></figure><p>Gon progressed in the Chimera Ant arc like none other and got several times stronger than he already was before. Upon knowing what loss feels like, Gon's character changed completely and he got obsessed with revenge.</p><p>A taste of his true power was also given to the fans in the arc and although the experience was certainly not good for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-gon-freecs-best-shonen-hero-fell-short/\">Gon, it did help him grow as a person, both mentally and physically</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Loser: Chimera Ant Queen</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chimera-Ant-Queen.jpg' /></figure><p>The Chimera Ant Queen was the one who lay the foundation to everything in the arc. Originally coming from the Dark Continent, she birthed all the Chimera Ants to serve her son, the strongest Chimera Ant, King Meruem.</p><p>Unfortunately for her, she was killed by her very own son and in doing so, she became a massive loser of the arc. She died shortly after Meruem was born and her death certainly was not a happy end to her story.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a title=\"Hunter x Hunter: 10 Strongest Enhancers In The Series, Ranked\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hunter-x-hunter-strongest-enhancers/\">Hunter X Hunter: 10 Strongest Enhancers In The Series, Ranked</a></span></p>\n                        \n +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Chimera-Ant-Arc.jpg","linkMd5":"63388b5bcd19db4a954e4cddf129f64b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn83@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-30-228_fdf9b7d8d4542bee.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":84350,"destBytes":84350,"author":"Rei Penber","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Chimera-Ant-Arc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn83@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-30-228_fdf9b7d8d4542bee.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Kite-killua-gon-vs-pitou-hunter-x-hunter.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn96@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-44-017_a288c547098ae7ff.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Zazan-HxH.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn9@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-44-154_ab5e142abf55db5b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/meruem-komugi-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn22@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-638_3fa31bd54cb4c553.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/meruem-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn84@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-39-825_1deeeb8c53d11c2b.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/netero-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn33@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-38-918_675e191626eed144.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Neferpitou-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn42@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-41-961_d20a922583893919.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/killua-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn48@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-43-634_3330f508606dca06.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Cheetu-hxh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn93@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-41-700_32258865ed499f52.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Adult-Gon-Featured.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn83@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-34-789_77c01cdb26c1446c.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chimera-Ant-Queen.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn36@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-43-114_9ed401873ebd7562.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"KonoSuba: 10 Pieces Of Aqua Fan Art We Love | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/best-konosuba-aqua-fan-art-anime/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KonoSuba-10-Pieces-Of-Aqua-Fan-Art-We-Love-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p>The cast of characters that inhabit <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/konosuba/\">Konosuba</a> </em>is nothing if not colorful, and that can be especially said of the goddess-turned-helpless-adventurer, Aqua. She enjoyed a cushy life of being praised by the Axis Order for quite a long time, laughing at foolish humans and the ridiculous ways in which they met with an early end. That is, until one human has the idea to drag Aqua along with him to be essentially 'reborn,' keeping her abilities as a goddess but losing the praise and recognition she once had. Most simply laugh or scoff at Aqua when she insists about her goddess origins, and one man early on even gave her money out of pity for her 'delusions.'</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-best-worst-isekai-anime/\">Konosuba: 5 Times It Proved To Be The Best Isekai Anime (&#38; 5 Times It Fell Short)</a></span></p><p>That isn't to say that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-konosuba-characters-more-useless-than-aqua/\">Aqua is entirely useless</a>, as the main meme surrounding her goes. She's bright, cheerful, and accepting for the most part, and that combined with her adorable design easily won the hearts of fan-artists everywhere.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Self-Assured Stare</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Confident-Aqua-Fan-Art.jpg' /></figure><p>Despite being quite clumsy and slow at times, Aqua is able to redeem herself with her boundless optimism, energy, and self-confidence. All of these traits are perfectly on display in this piece by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/zarory\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Zarory</a>, and the coloring is absolutely beautiful to boot.</p><p>While the background is quite simple, it pleasingly <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-anime-characters-worse-kazuma/\">represents the area where Kazuma</a> and Aqua briefly spent a scene before being reborn. The vibrant bubbles floating around add a nice visual touch.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Aqua At The Ready</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Cute-Wink-Fan-Art.jpg' /></figure><p>Due to Aqua's incredibly outgoing and cheerful nature, she can be seen reassuring her teammates and striking iconic anime poses, such as the one drawn above by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/kitsuneco\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Kitsuneco</a>.</p><p>Both Aqua's confidence and bubbly, humorous personality are on full display, and the line art is clean. Finally, the simple coloring complements the shading well, and having the silhouette behind her adds a fun extra layer of depth overall.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Goddess Of Panic</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Crying-And-Dancing.jpg' /></figure><p>Aside from Aqua being less-than-useful in many situations throughout <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-konosuba-tattoos/\">the series,</a> as well as being known for her bubbly, cheerful attitude, she's also known for being prone to panic or burst into tears quite often. Her high range of emotional reactions is part of what makes her such an on-screen joy, and that wildly colorful personality is drawn beautifully by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/nikusenpai\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NikuSenpai</a> here.</p><p>Aqua's pose mirrors the dance that she performs during the second opening, just with her trademark freaked-out face replacing the joyful expression she makes in the anime. All of the ornate little details in the background add to the piece's appeal.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Trusty Staff</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/aqua-by-kwanfi-dc31xsl-fullview.jpg' /></figure><p>Whenever Aqua and the others have to charge headfirst into battle, she'd be caught dead without her trusty trademark staff. Not only is it simply gorgeous in its design, but it boosts the power of every spell she casts, making it a must-have weapon to have at her side. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/kwanfi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Kwanfi's</a> rendition of Aqua holding her dear weapon came out beautifully, with the coloring style being especially pleasing to the eye.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-characters-chinese-zodiac-signs/\">Which Konosuba Character Are You Based On Your Zodiac Sign?</a></span></p><p>The background is simple, yet effective, as the rainbow illuminating Aqua and the splashes of water at her feet from the puddle are nice touches. They also manage to hint at parts of her personality for those who might be unfamiliar as an added bonus.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Chibi Trio</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Megumin-And-Darkness-Chibis.jpg' /></figure><p>The two other girls that make up the series' main party, Megumin <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-anime-characters-more-hopeless-than-darkness/\">and Darkness</a>, are just as much of an exciting, humorous joy to watch as Aqua. That makes it incredibly fun to see all three of them in an art piece together, and <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/yuries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Yuries</a>' chibi style is super adorable.</p><p>Aqua's loud personality is perfectly displayed here, along with Darkness's submissive nature and Megumin's constant exhaustion. The simple coloring style works well with the look of the piece itself.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Confident Pose</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Confident-Art.jpg' /></figure><p>Aqua's go-getter personality is on display throughout most of the series, save for the situations that Kazuma always seems to wrap her up into, which she'll vehemently reject – until she's usually made to do so anyway.</p><p>Aqua's more positive side is shown wonderfully here by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/phiphiauthon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">PhiphiAuThon</a>, and the thick navy line art is a great stylistic touch that really makes the piece pop. The coloring style being flat compliments the art style well and adds a cute, retro-cartoony atmosphere to everything.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Healer's Helping Hand</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Although it can be hard to remember at times whenever Aqua's general incompetence is played up for laughs, she's not a complete airhead and is actually <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/aqua-vs-emilia-best-isekai-magic-user/\">quite an advanced healer</a>. This piece by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/mizzuiita/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">mizzuiita</a> makes her look like quite the lively and bubbly healer. That isn't entirely wrong, although Aqua is also prone to wildly flailing and screeching in the face of giant enemies.</p><p>The thick, dark lines complement the piece's overall look, and using tiny lines themselves for shading is a pretty creative touch.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Still Sleepy</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-aqua-cosplays-you-need-see/\">Another trait of Aqua's</a> that's typically played up for comedic purposes is how much she loves to sleep, and specifically how easy she can nap just about anywhere. This includes the barn that she and Kazuma stayed in at the start of the series, as she was already dead asleep by the time he'd laid down and started complaining. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/fooshikeyy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Fooshikeyy's</a> interpretation of Aqua gives off the impression that she's still half-asleep, raising to cover her mouth as she yawns with one eye open.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-megumin-awesome-cosplay-look-just-like-anime/\">Konosuba: 10 Awesome Megumin Cosplay That Looks Just Like The Anime</a></span></p><p>The coloring style is simply adorable and matches with the chibi aesthetic well – the hair especially shines and stands out.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Sailor...Aqua?</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>In May 2020, the internet was swept off its feet by the <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/sailor-moon/\">Sailor Moon</a> </em>redraw challenge. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/kenpaiarts/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Kenpaiarts</a> chose a character that fits the scene incredibly well, arguably just as good as the self-dubbed 'clumsy crybaby' Usagi herself.</p><p>The artist included the original meme at the end as well, just in case somehow this drawing is a viewers' first introduction to it. Aqua truly does fit as early-series crybaby Usagi so well that it begs the question of which scouts the other members of the main cast might be.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Capable (Looking) Goddess</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-aqua-megumin-best-character/\">Aqua is incredibly good</a> at looking as if she's incredibly coordinated, confident, and capable. It's only a shame that most of the time, only one of those things is truly accurate. Fans still love her regardless, of course, and that love is captured in this Aqua portrait by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/https.miyadraws_/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">hhtps.miyadraws_</a>.</p><p>The pencil-sketch looking lines have a certain kind of charm to them, and Aqua's expression is especially darling. Who knew Aqua could still look absolutely adorable rocking thicker eyebrows?</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/konosuba-best-episodes-imdb/\">The 10 Best Episodes Of Konosuba (According To IMDb)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:00:20 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KonoSuba-10-Pieces-Of-Aqua-Fan-Art-We-Love-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"bb2b7362f0a4c4b1a3cf41afc9d48302","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn94@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-278_f4df88b74cae89f0.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":107560,"destBytes":107560,"author":"Hannah Grimes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KonoSuba-10-Pieces-Of-Aqua-Fan-Art-We-Love-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn94@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-278_f4df88b74cae89f0.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Confident-Aqua-Fan-Art.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn68@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-36-807_3bc6ff1b02707c47.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Cute-Wink-Fan-Art.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-44-094_73f0b0297fced6cb.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Crying-And-Dancing.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn73@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-39-924_85f07f6d66c4c2a6.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/aqua-by-kwanfi-dc31xsl-fullview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn3@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-37-074_9227cf4930784c14.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Megumin-And-Darkness-Chibis.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn97@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-42-414_525b290009d6e3ea.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Konosuba-Aqua-Confident-Art.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn70@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-022_7efba3f4d6c99415.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"John Ridley Reveals the DC Series That Was Most Influential to His Work","link":"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-worlds-finest-influenced-work/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/DC-Comics-Justice-League-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/john-ridley/\">John Ridley</a>'s new comic <em>The Other History of the DC Universe </em>was announced over two years ago, but it's set to hit shelves next month. An acclaimed writer, Ridley has worked on projects ranging from the small screen to the big screen --and now he's revealed which <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dc-comics/\">DC comic books</a> influenced his work the most.</p><p>Ridley told <a href=\"https://www.polygon.com/comics/2020/9/3/21408118/dc-comics-alternate-history-other-black-lightning-john-ridley-interview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Polygon</a>, \"But I would say I’ve been more informed, probably, by the series that I first read when I was a kid. It was a two-part <i>World’s Finest</i> series with Batman and Superman, where they ended up in a Soviet-style gulag, Superman without his powers in Batman without his utility belt. So you have these two characters — and this was literally one of the first comic books I read.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-dc-project-batman-person-of-color/\">John Ridley Reveals New DC Project --'47% Chance This Batman is a Person of Color'</a></span></p><p>He added, \"I obviously was aware of Batman when I was a kid — mostly from the TV show, and Superman also mostly from the TV show. Because I was so young, I mean, I was not even a reader yet, [but] you can sit in front of a TV and absorb. And I don’t even remember how exactly I got these books, but I got them. And mind you, these were stories that I think were reprints, even, so the stories themselves were from the ’60s and I think by the time I read them, it was probably in the early ’70s.\"</p><p>Ridley continued, \"But what I remember more than anything, is that they were literally graphic. Obviously [with] stories from that time period it wasn’t that there was blood or gore or things like that, but there was something about the stories about these two heroes. Superman’s uniform was torn, they were standing in line and getting poured food, and [they were] behind barbed wire. And there was obviously, politics involved, it may have been agitprop at that time. But it was about the Soviets, and it was about gulags, and it was about “our enemies,” it was about, you know, <i>it’s not this alien threat</i>. It may be communism that’s coming for us.\"</p><p>The experience was formative, though not entirely heartwarming. He clarified, \"And more than anything, I just remember that reading those books and truly feeling upset, upset in my stomach, upset reading them. I remember, I think Curt Swan was the artist, but it just didn’t feel like the light, happy Superman or Batman that I’d seen.\"</p><p>Ridley concluded, \"So for me, reading these stories where it was less about the powers — they had no powers. It wasn’t Superman flying into outer space. It wasn’t Batman fighting criminals in an alleyway. It was these two guys who were fighting a system. It was two guys who were fighting oppression. Again, I really want to stress, it may have been agitprop at that time, but you’re a kid reading it going, <i>Oh my god, that’s the threat</i>.\"</p><p>Written by John Ridley and drawn by 'Cammo' Camuncoli, Andrea Cucchi and José Villarrubia, <em>The Other History of the DC Universe </em>is set to hit shelves Nov. 24.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-batman-comic-massive-impact-dc-universe/\">John Ridley's New Batman Comic Has a Massive Impact on the DC Universe</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 21:20:05 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/DC-Comics-Justice-League-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"a1545385cd358691b13691d0a7014fe9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn36@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-849_af6333f607ff22e9.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":292413,"destBytes":257292,"author":"Evangelia Galanis","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/DC-Comics-Justice-League-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn36@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-849_af6333f607ff22e9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Dear Super-Villains: DC Debuts Cover Art for Dear Justice League Sequel","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-dear-super-villains-cover-art/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dear-super-villains-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>DC Comics has revealed the official cover art for Michael Northrop and Gustavo Duarte's upcoming middle grade original graphic novel <em>Dear Super-Villains</em>, the sequel to last year's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dear-justice-league/\">Dear Justice League</a>.</p><p>Also by Northrop and Duarte, <em>Dear Justice League</em> was published in August of 2019 and followed members of DC's premier superhero team as they answered mail from curious young fans. <em>Dear Super-Villains</em> turns that premise on its head, with the inquisitive kids now sending mail to DC's various rogues. Similar in layout to the cover of <em>Dear Justice League</em>, which starred a number of popular DC heroes, <em>Dear Super-Villains</em>' cover sees baddies such as Harley Quinn, Sinestro, Black Manta, Lex Luthor, Catwoman, Gorilla Grodd and what appears to be Giganta take the spotlight (and the smartphone) for themselves. They do so with about as much subtlety as you'd expect, with the kids understandably looking a bit more concerned than they did when contacting the Justice League last year.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-middle-grade-graphic-novels-flipbook-sampler-batman/\">Batman Headlines DC's Middle Grade FCBD Flipbook Sampler</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dear-super-villains.jpg\"/></figure><p>The cover reveal for <em>Dear Super-Villains</em> comes a little over a week ahead of the second day of DC Kids FanDome on Sept. 12, during which the entirety of <em>Dear Justice League</em> will be available to read free of charge via the DC Kids comics reader for 24 hours. Dear <em>Super-Villains</em>, meanwhile, is set to go on sale in April of next year and will retail for $9.99 USD. An official synopsis for the sequel can be found below.</p><blockquote><p><strong>Peek inside the lives of DC's infamous rogues in DEAR SUPER-VILLAINS, the sequel to DEAR JUSTICE LEAGUE, where curious kids write to notorious scoundrels, asking them about life on the dark side.</strong></p><p>How did Gorilla Grodd get so smart? Did Harley Quinn ever try a career in comedy? Why does Catwoman always lose to Batman?</p><p>Each chapter highlights members of the Legion of Doom in a sympathetic way that is relatable to kids. But look closely and you may notice the baddies are up to something big! Will the Justice League show up in time to stop them? You'll have to write in to the Tip-line of Evil to find out!</p></blockquote><p>Written by Michael Northrop and illustrated by Gustavo Duarte with colors by Cris Peter and letters by Wes Abbott, <em>Dear Super-Villains</em> goes on sale wherever books are sold April 6, 2021 from DC Comics and is currently available for pre-order.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-announces-teen-titans-beast-boy-loves-raven-ogn-from-garcia-picolo/\">DC Announces Teen Titans: Beast Boy Loves Raven OGN From Garcia &#38; Picolo</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 02:22:25 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dear-super-villains-header.jpg","linkMd5":"3bde69c9cdd8b6b6b5722f196b7c9147","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn48@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-30-526_df5286bd589a905e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":125733,"destBytes":123582,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dear-super-villains-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn48@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-30-526_df5286bd589a905e.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/dear-super-villains.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn42@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-36-717_006f87701362a1cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989061},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"WWE Releases AOP's Akam and Rezar | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-releases-aops-akam-and-rezar/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/aop-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/wwe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">WWE</a> has released Akam and Rezar, the duo known collectively as AOP (formerly the Authors of Pain).</p><p>\"<a href=\"https://www.wwe.com/article/akam-and-rezar-released\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">WWE</a> has come to terms on the release of Akam and Rezar (AOP),\" the company wrote. \"We wish them all the best in their future endeavors.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Announcer Mauro Ranallo Departs WWE to Focus on Family, Mental Health Charities\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/announcer-mauro-ranallo-departs-wwe-to-focus-on-family-mental-health-charities/\">Announcer Mauro Ranallo Departs WWE To Focus On Family, Mental Health Charities</a></span></p><p>Akam (real name Sunny Dhinsa) and Rezar (real name Gzim Selmani) both signed with WWE around 2015 (Akam shortly before) and the pair made its debut as a tag team at <em>NXT TakeOver: The End</em> in June 2016, attacking American Alpha following its <em>NXT</em> Tag Team Championship loss. The team went on to win its first televised match the following week and in November, Akam and Rezar won the Dusty Rhodes Tag Team Classic. By the next year, they captured the <em>NXT</em> Tag Team Championship themselves after defeating #DIY.</p><p>In April 2018, the Authors of Pain made their main roster debut by beating Heath Slater and Rhyno on <em>Raw</em>. In September, they had shortened their name to AOP and were partnered with Drake Maverick, who served as their manager. Two months later, they defeated Seth Rollin in a handicap match to win the <em>Raw</em> Tag Team Championship.</p><p>Most recently, the team served as enforcers for Rollins.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"REPORT: WWE Is Considering Moving NXT Off of Wednesday Nights\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-reportedly-moving-nxt-to-tuesdays/\">REPORT: WWE Is Considering Moving NXT Off Of Wednesday Nights</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:48:53 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/aop-header.jpg","linkMd5":"61b8864706f2240d50544430751a12af","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn72@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-337_0916510d195b6e5f.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":55931,"destBytes":55286,"author":"Jon Arvedon","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/aop-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn72@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-337_0916510d195b6e5f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989070},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Avatar Theory: Yue Was Meant to Be the Next Avatar | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-theory-who-next-avatar/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Avatar-the-last-airbender-cycle.jpg\"/></figure><p>For 100 years, the world of<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avatar-the-last-airbender/\"> <em>The Last Airbender</em> </a>went without an Avatar. The speculation about what could've happened if Aang did not go into the iceberg is endless. He could've been killed with the rest of his people, or he could've survived and stopped the war earlier. If it were the latter, then the next Avatar most likely wouldn't be Korra, unless Aang lived a ridiculously long time, like Kyoshi did.</p><p>While some fans have theorized that the next Avatar in this situation was supposed to be Katara, another<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=krfytI-wXQk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"> theory suggests </a>it was supposed to be Yue. The root of this theory is based on the mystery of her birth. As a newborn, Yue was born silent, and none of the healers could help, so they put her in the Spirit Oasis, where the Moon Spirit gave some of her life force to Yue.</p><p>Once this happened, Yue's hair turned white, and she started to cry. As youtuber Chunkyjammer explains, it's like Yue was a vessel in need of a spirit to come to life. As <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the%20legend%20of%20korra/\">Avatar: The Legend of Korra</a></em> reveals, the Avatar is connected to the spirit Rava, acting as a human vessel for the powerful spirit. When the Avatar passes away, the next Avatar inherits Rava.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/legend-of-korra-most-forgettable-villain-lieutenant/\">Legend of Korra's Most Forgettable Villain Should Be Its Next Mastermind</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Princess-Yue-Avatar-Moon-Spirit-header.png\"/></figure><p>It's possible that Yue was born silent because she was supposed to inherit Rava after Aang; however, he was alive longer than the cycle anticipated, so Rava could not be passed on to Yue. While the show does not explain how the next Avatar is chosen beyond the elemental cycle, it is a possibility that the cycle is predetermined yet flexible. As seen in both series, destiny is real, but it is not crystal clear or set in stone.</p><p>The fan theory further explains how Yue fulfills the role of the Avatar in Season 1. The Avatar is the bridge between humans and spirits, and they work towards maintaining balance. Not only does Yue have a connection with spirits, but she also restores balance by sacrificing her human form to bring the Moon Spirit back to life and restore waterbenders with their bending abilities.</p><p>There are factors working against this theory, like the uncertainty of reincarnation. While it is possible that the Avatar cycle is predetermined, it is equally possible that it is arbitrary. Furthermore, it is unclear what would've unfolded if Aang was never frozen. While he may have been able to escape the Fire Nation attacks, it is also possible that he would've been killed, meaning that the next Avatar would've been born decades before Yue. On the other hand, if Aang survived, then he would've needed to live up to the exact date of Yue's birth.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-theory-kyoshi-real-animal-companion-unagi/\">Avatar Theory: Kyoshi's REAL Animal Companion Was the Unagi</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Yue-After-The-Death-Of-The-Moon-Spirit-In-Avatar-The-Last-Airbender.jpg\"/></figure><p>Along with these uncertainties, the Avatar cycle works against this theory. If Yue was supposed to be the Avatar, then the following Avatar would be an earthbender; however, Korra is the Avatar in the following series. This would mean the cycle either readjusted to accommodate the change in destiny or Yue was never supposed to be the Avatar in the first place.</p><p>Finally, Yue does not appear to be a waterbender. It could be argued that audiences don't see her bend because the Northern Water Tribe had strict restrictions for female waterbenders at the time; however there is not much evidence to prove this is the case for Yue. If she isn't a waterbender, then she couldn't be the next Avatar in the cycle.</p><p>Even if Yue was never meant to be the next Avatar, she remains one of the few humans to have a strong bond with the spirits. She lives up to the role of the Avatar by restoring balance between humans and spirits during the Siege of the North. While her character is minor, she manages an Avatar level feat, and her backstory further supports the notion that destiny may have had greater things in store for her if Aang never went in the iceberg.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-legend-of-korra-should-have-been-the-third-avatar-series/\">The Legend of Korra Should Have Been the THIRD Avatar Series</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 00:00:50 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Avatar-the-last-airbender-cycle.jpg","linkMd5":"e651e9c1ef7cce9b58d775febb3088fb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn93@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-785_7639b9d80d00b794.webp","destWidth":1800,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":113832,"destBytes":113832,"author":"Caitlin Chappell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Avatar-the-last-airbender-cycle.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn93@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-785_7639b9d80d00b794.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Princess-Yue-Avatar-Moon-Spirit-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn38@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-38-154_24c27c380dc9c9ef.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Yue-After-The-Death-Of-The-Moon-Spirit-In-Avatar-The-Last-Airbender.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-39-878_31529c2172b0f216.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989066},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Brie Larson Shares Her Rejected Movie Auditions List - Including Multiple MCU Roles","link":"https://www.cbr.com/brie-larson-rejected-movie-auditions-list-mcu-roles/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/captain-marvel-brie-larson-display.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/brie-larson/\">Brie Larson</a> has portrayed a number of roles, including Captain Marvel in the <a href=\"http://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel-cinematic-universe\">Marvel Cinematic Universe</a>. However, as is the case for many actor, there were quite a number of roles that she auditioned for and didn't get throughout her career.</p><p>On her official YouTube channel, Larson posted a new video as the second part of her \"Audition Storytime\" series. There she discussed how she auditioned for a wide range of roles in various film and television projects, facing multiple rejections. \"That's a lot of heartbreak, folks,\" Larson said while discussing the rejections. Among the films Larson auditioned for included parts in <em>Iron Man</em> and <em>Iron Man 2</em>, as well as James Cameron's <em>Avatar</em> and <em>Sucker Punch</em>. Television roles she auditioned for included <em> Halt and Catch Fire</em> and <em>The Big Bang Theory.</em></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/brie-larson-film-audition-dress-sexy/\">Brie Larson Recalls Being Asked to Dress Sexier for Film Audition</a></span></p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/t9CcjI0SOcU?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>For the parts she did get, Larson described her process of getting into character. When she was cast as Envy Adams in <em>Scott Pilgrim vs. The World</em>, she said that her vocal performance was inspired by the Adult Video Awards. Talk then turned to her <em>Captain Marvel</em> role, which she received a call about while working on <em>Kong: Skull Island</em>.</p><p>Larson revealed that she initially declined the role, several times in fact, saying it was \"too much\" for her. After meeting with Marvel Studios, she recalled being \"moved\" by their take on Carol Danvers. \"It was amazing, I loved everything they had to say.\"</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/brie-larson-breaks-down-audition-process-for-captain-marvel-reveals-the-roles-she-lost-out-on\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Hollywood Reporter</a>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 21:15:18 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/captain-marvel-brie-larson-display.jpg","linkMd5":"ed6fe3e2fde500465fd257e836d63633","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn16@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-038_6a953528e21cb789.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":73836,"destBytes":73836,"author":"Collier Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/captain-marvel-brie-larson-display.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn16@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-038_6a953528e21cb789.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Crusader Kings III: Tips, Tricks & Strategies for New Players","link":"https://www.cbr.com/crusader-kings-iii-tips-tricks/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/crusader-kings-iii-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/crusader-kings/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Crusader Kings</a> </em>is a strategic, historical roleplaying game centered around the rise and fall of multiple empires. It marries the personal and political aspects of historical life, focusing on people and their interactions with others in order to simulate historical events. <em>Crusader Kings III </em>builds on this idea and improves upon its predecessors.</p><p>This title is great for players who favor strategy, simulations, historical themes and some micromanaging. <em>Crusader Kings III</em> had been long awaited by fans of the series, because <em>Crusader Kings II</em> lasted about seven years with expansions and downloadable content.</p><p>For new players interested in trying out <em>Crusader Kings III</em> or fans of the series who have been waiting to get their hands on it, here are some tips, tricks and strategies to succeed.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/crusader-kings-what-know-paradox-upcoming-sequel/\">Crusader Kings III: 5 Things We Know About Paradox’s Upcoming Sequel</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crusader-kings-3-border-gore-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>A lot of <em>Crusader Kings III</em> draws from its predecessors. There are feuds between empires, strategic alliances through marriage and court drama that sets up a lot of the main strategy game tasks. This includes things like constructing castles, waging war with neighboring nations and researching new technology. The slightest personal vendettas between two rulers can plunge entire countries into a bloody battlefield.</p><p>Meanwhile, well thought-out marriages between nations can unite multiple kingdoms, keep the peace and strengthen an empire. However, <em>Crusader Kings III</em> is not meant to be an exact replica of or sequel to <em>Crusader Kings II.</em> Rather, it is an improvement on the many things that had made <em>Crusader Kings II</em> work so well.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ghost-of-tsushima-tips-tricks-strategies/\">Ghost of Tsushima: Tips, Tricks &#38; Strategies for Beginners</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/crusader-kings-iii-art.jpg\"/></figure><p>In the previous games, each character had personality traits that did not really serve much of a function in the grand scheme of things. <em>Crusader Kings III</em> improves upon that by making each character's personality traits their decisions and interactions more. These personality traits now play more important roles in guiding a character's behavior, via a stress system.</p><p>For example, someone who is cruel will build up amounts of stress if they show their enemies too much mercy. This encourages players to feel more connected and roleplay more with their characters, because now personality traits affect more than just character stats. Make sure to have the correct personality trait to fit the kind of dynasty being created.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/final-fantasy-xiv-tips-tricks-strategies/\">Final Fantasy XIV: Tips, Tricks &#38; Strategies for New Players</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crusader-kings-3-stress-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>As stated before, the main consequence to denying a personality trait is a buildup of stress. Of course, being an important person in a powerful empire can be stressful in itself, so keeping an eye on how much stress a character has is a good idea. Too much stress leads to the character having a mental break. Once this happens, a couple of choices are offered to the player that act as coping mechanisms.</p><p>These include drinking, fighting, or frequenting a brothel, all of which throw curveballs at the character's development. More opportunities for drama and conflict will open up as character begins to engage more in their stress-relieving pass time. One example could be the development of a temper. This causes characters to lash out at other important figures, like priests or other rulers, creating unnecessary enemies.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/paper-mario-oragami-king-tips-tricks-strategies/\">Paper Mario: Tips, Tricks &#38; Strategies for New Origami King Players</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Crusader-Kings-3-Knights-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>The addition of Knights in <em>Crusader Kings III</em> gives individual, named warriors larger roles to play in turning the tides of war. It also opens opportunities for more personal stories and character development. Battle resolution is a lot easier to read, with an advantage bar that shows who has the high ground during a battle. However, some additions to the game don't totally succeed.</p><p>An effort was made here to lessen the amount of micromanaging present in <em>Crusader Kings II</em>'s warfare. Unfortunately, it's a little wonky because all the player's armies now rally at a single point. This makes it so troops do not always split up evenly, which creates more of a task to evenly distribute an attack force.</p><p>This combat system can be a little frustrating, as this system can drastically impacts the outcome of a campaign and can ruin war tactics or strategies, so try not to rely on it too much.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tlous2-survivor-difficulty-tips-tricks/\">The Last of Us Part II: Tips &#38; Tricks for Winning on Survivor Difficulty</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Crusader-Kings-3-King-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Politics in <em>Crusader Kings III</em> is nothing short of shady, because manipulation and deceit are incredibly important. The new system of secrets and hooks allows players to gain leverage over other characters.</p><p>It's a perfect system for those who prefer working in the shadows to build their ideal empire off of things like blackmail, assassinations and guiding other characters to fulfill schemes. The new system is a lot more hands-on and also more rewarding.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/stardew-valley-beginner-tips-tricks/\">Stardew Valley: Tips &#38; Tricks to Know When Starting the Game</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Crusader-kings-3-Religion-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Religion can be customized to fit whatever suits the player and their plans for mandating the laws of their kingdoms. New forms of religions can also be created, like a new Muslim faith. Religions can be abandoned or changed whenever they no longer suit a player's goals, which makes the possibilities for a developing country virtually limitless.</p><p>Customization can be anything from equal rights between genders to the roles of the clergy and more. This allows not only for unique personal gameplay in <em>Crusader Kings III</em>, but also flexibility to extend an empire's longevity and reach.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fall-guys-tips-tricks-strategies/\">Fall Guys: Tips, Tricks &#38; Strategies for New Players</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 23:15:41 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/crusader-kings-iii-header.jpg","linkMd5":"859ed657541f17851dd42f23811830bd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn90@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-31-733_edbc4f7b59f96d8b.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":59534,"destBytes":59534,"author":"Matthew Carbonell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/crusader-kings-iii-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn90@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-31-733_edbc4f7b59f96d8b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crusader-kings-3-border-gore-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn12@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-35-658_2164f292454ee621.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/crusader-kings-iii-art.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn16@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-37-213_af9c75975d2a975b.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/crusader-kings-3-stress-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-38-337_9b30842137f3bdc8.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Crusader-Kings-3-Knights-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn17@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-37-955_90eb1fad6080661f.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Crusader-Kings-3-King-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn84@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-36-306_882e41218195d46d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Crusader-kings-3-Religion-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-39-771_777c2ff07ae1a948.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989067},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"How Tenet's 'Time Inversion' Works (We THINK) | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/how-tenets-time-inversion-works-we-think/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/tenet-3.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/tenet/\">Tenet</a>, now in theaters.</strong></em></p><p>The distortion of time is a hallmark of an original Christopher Nolan movie; however, <em>Tenet</em> deals with temporal manipulation more directly than any of his previous films. How time works doesn't just stylize the drama or set up a twist; it explains the whole plot. While Tenet is full of promising, innovate ideas about time travel and the science behind it, the execution of those ideas is a bit confounding.</p><p><em>Tenet</em> is about time spies scheming to prevent an apocalypse sent from the future. Its use of time travel is unlike the kind moviegoers are accustomed to. From <em>Back to the Future</em> to <em>Avengers</em>:<em> Endgame</em>, time traveling characters usually approach the practice like a journey. Various moments are merely destinations for them to visit. Once they've arrived, they're free to move about the periods with the laws of physics firmly in place.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-imax-featurette-behind-scenes/\">Tenet IMAX Featurette Takes You Behind The Scenes Of The Christopher Nolan Blockbuster</a></span></p><p>The rules that govern time travel in <em>Tenet</em> are more restrictive, which is a brilliant, ambitious addition to the genre. Early on, a covert research scientist (Clémence Poésy) explains the concept of \"inversion\" to \"the Protagonist\" (John David Washington). In the future, someone devises a process that inverts an object's entropy so it travels through time in reverse. Entropy is a measure of thermodynamic energy, involving time and randomness, so Nolan's off to a plausible start. Bullets returning to the chamber of a gun illustrate the point. The character then advises the Protagonist to \"feel\" it rather than think too hard about it.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tenet.jpg\"/></figure><p>The lesson fans are meant to take away is the same one the Protagonist now understands. Inversion is physics in reverse, <em>but </em>whatever happens in rewind has to have happened first. In other words, time is a mirror, as the palindrome title suggests. This is also the first indication that, no matter how confusing things get, what audiences are watching is likely a closed loop. What happens is what is always going to happen, except bullets don't have free will like people do; therefore, whether time is fixed or changeable in <em>Tenet</em> is an open question until the end.</p><p>The most surprising thing about the movie is that a long stretch of time goes by before there's an obvious time distortion; however, clues are present. In one of the film's highlights, the Protagonist and his partner, Neil (Robert Pattinson), fight a masked figure who's been inverted. Masks are a necessary component, since inverted lungs can't handle non-inverted air. This science flourish possibly exists to help audiences identify characters during inversion and to hide the reveal that the Protagonist is wrestling his inverted self.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenets-drive-in-theater-availability/\">Tenet's Drive-In Theater Availability Hinges On Whether Local Indoor Theaters Are Open</a></span></p><p>It's a strength of the film that audiences keep learning about inversion, the mission and the Protagonist; although, some plot points are more clear than others. Tenet's big bad, Andrei Sator (Kenneth Branagh), has been receiving parts of a doomsday device called \"the Algorithm\" from the future, which would destroy the world. Future generations decides to do so because climate change has wrecked the planet they inherited. Sator is terminal ill and lusts for the power to end the world, so the Algorithm will go off upon his suicide.</p><p>To stop them, the Protagonist has to invert himself. In another stand out scene, viewers see a car chase twice. The first happens in forward moving time, as the Protagonist loses a piece of the Algorithm. He notices a car un-crash and repair itself before it tails him in reverse. The chase ends with Sator shooting his wife and leaving to assemble the Algorithm. This pivotal moment serves as the N in <em>Tenet</em>, or the mid-point where the forward moving subject and the inversion meet. In a replay of the scene from an inverted Protagonist's perspective, fans see him driving the silver car, trying to alter the course of events.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Tenet-Sator-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Characters in <em>Tenet</em> are able to invert with purpose because of a tactic known as temporal pincer movement. People with knowledge of how events transpire can, using designated turnstiles, reverse course, creating a mini closed loop. The film's climax is a mirror image battle, with Tenet forces using the pincer method to attack Sator's grunts, from both ten minutes in the past and the future. They have to delay Sator's suicide and disassemble the device at the exact right moment.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-amc-reopen-70-percent-theaters-christopher-nolan-blockbuster/\">Tenet: AMC To Reopen 70% Of US Theaters For Christopher Nolan's Blockbuster</a></span></p><p>Twice, the plan appears to fail; however, an operative with a red string on his backpack saves the day, but he is shot in the process. As they discuss the mission's success, the Protagonist notices Neil's backpack with its red string. <em>Tenet</em>'s final twist confirms two things that are teased throughout the movie. One, the Protagonist has, with a few exceptions, been moving forward through time, and he will found Tenet and recruit Neil. Secondly, and more importantly, time appears to be a closed loop.</p><p><em>Tenet</em> goes so far as to bring up the grandfather paradox to explain the central conflict. That brain teaser holds that if a person goes back in time to kill their grandfather, they'd never exist; therefore, they'd be unable to kill their grandfather. This, along with Neil's heartfelt goodbye, hints at Nolan's interpretation of the film's conclusion. Despite the espionage, combat and explosions, the world is never doomed, at least not because of the Algorithm.</p><p><em>Written and directed by Christopher Nolan, Tenet stars John David Washington, Robert Pattinson, Elizabeth Debicki, Kenneth Branagh, Dimple Kapadia, Martin Donovan, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Himesh Patel, Clémence Poésy, Denzil Smith and Michael Caine. The film is now playing in theaters overseas and arrives in select U.S. cities Sept. 3. Early access screenings will be held at IMAX theaters starting Aug. 31.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nolan-tenet-time-twisting-finale-explained/\">Tenet's Time-Twisting Finale, Explained</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n Dorsch","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/tenet-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn30@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-180_a14ba873a8226fc3.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/tenet.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn48@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-36-079_b76227d0026f2e9a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Tenet-Sator-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn66@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-39-930_4e1d2d693d8c99f6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989064},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05
