Play","link":"https://www.cbr.com/steam-recommendations-cyber-doge-2077-rogue-legacy-2-wandersong/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/SteamRoundup0904.png\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nintendo-needs-change-approach-indie-marketplace/\">A slew of new games</a> are released every week on <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/steam\">Steam</a> and the <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/nintendo-switch\">Nintendo Switch</a>, which can make it hard to pick the exact right game to invest time and money into. Algorithms are OK, but not great, especially when it comes to indie titles that may not exactly adhere to a player's gaming history but are still a great match.</p><p>This week, we're highlighting three new release or under-appreciated titles, including a meme-heavy endless runner that may redeem a dumpster fire year, an action-adventure genealogical rogue-lite and a musical platformer. Check out each title below.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/steam-recommendations-best-friend-forever-spiritfarer-wasteland-3/\">Steam: Best Friend Forever, Spiritfarer &#38; 3 Other New Titles You Should Play</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Cyber-Doge-2077.png\"/></figure><p><em>Cyber-Doge 2077: Meme Runner</em> is an endless runner with an incredible synthwave soundtrack. Players control a distressingly beefy doge and run through a fluorescent, cyberpunk world that plays on the aesthetics of <em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/cyberpunk-2077\">Cyberpunk 2077</a>.</em> The goal is the same as any endless runner: Get as far as possible and collect all the coins. Although it's absolutely absurd, that's a good thing. <em>Cyber-Doge 2077</em> may actually be the soothing, synthwave fever dream we all need to get through the remainder of this year.</p><p><em>Available on <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/app/1383720/Cyberdoge_2077_Meme_runner/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Steam</a>; $1.99 </em></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Rogue-Legacy-2-title.png\"/></figure><p><em>Rogue Legacy 2</em> is a genealogical rogue-lite, which means it still has randomized runs, changing characters and other roguelike staples, but it also has persistent upgrades and dead heirs. Legacy is the name of the game here -- literally. Players spend their parents' inheritance and grow the family manor in order to set their children up for success. Each child has unique traits and abilities that are randomly generated to keep the stakes high and prevent boredoms. It's possible to play <em>Rogue Legacy 2</em> at full speed or in a slower manner and still get a great experience.</p><p><em>Available on <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/app/1253920/Rogue_Legacy_2/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Steam</a> and <a href=\"https://www.epicgames.com/store/en-US/product/rogue-legacy-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Epic Games</a>; $19.99</em></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/indie-roguelikes-deserve-chance/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">5 Indie-Made Roguelikes That Deserve a Chance</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wandersong.jpg\"/></figure><p>Although <em>Wandersong</em> came out in 2018, the musical platformer has a limited physical release for <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/playstation-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">PlayStation 4</a> and Nintendo Switch from <a href=\"https://limitedrungames.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Limited Run Games</a> in October; it's also currently on sale on Steam. In <em>Wandersong</em>, players control a bard who <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/legend-zelda-ocarina-time-music-accessibility/\">uses music to interact</a> with everything around them, on a journey that takes them around the world. There's exploration, puzzle-solving and a massive cast of great NPCs. The music is, obviously, phenomenal and the mechanics are especially unique. The world here is also brightly colored and immersive, allowing players to dig in and stay a while.</p><p><em>Available on <a href=\"https://store.steampowered.com/app/530320/Wandersong/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Steam</a>, Nintendo Switch and PlayStation 4; $19.99</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/animal-crossing-acorns-pine-cones-revitalizing-players/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Animal Crossing: Acorns &#38; Pine Cones Are Revitalizing Bored Players</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:15:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/SteamRoundup0904.png","linkMd5":"d46df581121b9753ed607a3ad3d2c581","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-29-826_c942d0bf7825cccf.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":1123672,"destBytes":1123672,"author":"Samantha Puc","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/SteamRoundup0904.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-29-826_c942d0bf7825cccf.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Cyber-Doge-2077.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn98@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-34-138_307f6e067d3956fd.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Rogue-Legacy-2-title.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-42-840_a45d00ba7b01eed0.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wandersong.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn74@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-41-505_5472e50e07d8bf8b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989072},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Warner Bros. CEO Doesn't Understand Disney's Mulan Release Strategy","link":"https://www.cbr.com/warner-bros-ceo-disneys-mulan-strategy/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mulan-disney-plus-premier-access-poster-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Originally set for a wide theatrical release this past March before being delayed by the COVID-19 pandemic, Disney's live-action remake of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mulan/\"><em>Mulan</em></a> is now available to stream for those with Premier Access on Disney+.</p><p>While the film is exclusive to Premier Access domestically until <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-reveals-mulans-debut-date-for-all-subscribers/\">this December</a>, certain foreign markets will see a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-mulan-china-release-date/\">theatrical release</a> as September continues. For Warner Bros. CEO Ann Sarnoff, Disney's hybrid release strategy for the big-budget blockbuster film doesn't quite make sense, as Sarnoff's studio rolls out its own blockbuster film <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/tenet/\"><em>Tenet</em></a> theatrically, both domestically and abroad.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mulan-why-mushu-left-out/\">Mulan Director Digs Deeper Into Why Mushu Was Left Out of the Live-Action Remake</a></span></p><p>\"I don’t completely understand Disney’s strategy, but they are releasing <em>Mulan</em> internationally in some theaters,\" Sarnoff observed in an interview with <a href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/warner-bros-ceo-talks-batman-filming-halt-tenet-theatrical-release-amid-covid-19\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>The Hollywood Reporter</em></a>. \"I’m rooting for anybody who is getting a movie out. Fans are anxious for new content.\"</p><p>She continued, \"I actually went to see <em>Tenet</em> last night in Connecticut. I’m in Bedford, New York, and drove 10 minutes to the theater with friends. And it was amazing. It was safe. There were no crowds. I even found a way to eat popcorn with a mask on.\"</p><p><em>Tenet</em> has already exceed box office expectations overseas, earning a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-strong-opening-weekend-overseas/\">combined $53 millio</a>n from foreign markets its opening weekend, with many theaters in the United States <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-amc-reopen-70-percent-theaters-christopher-nolan-blockbuster/\">planning to reopen</a> to accommodate the film's domestic release. According to Sarnoff, there were never serious plans to release Christopher Nolan's latest film straight to home video like <em>Mulan</em>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-imax-featurette-behind-scenes/\">Tenet IMAX Featurette Takes You Behind the Scenes of the Christopher Nolan Blockbuster</a></span></p><p>\"It is a remarkable, cinematic, beautiful film. It is so impactful. It is a movie meant for the big screen,\" Sarnoff declared. \"I’m very proud of our approach. A lot of people are pushing stuff into next year. <em>Tenet</em> absolutely deserves to be seen in theaters.\"</p><p>Written and directed by Christopher Nolan, <em>Tenet</em> stars John David Washington, Robert Pattinson, Elizabeth Debicki, Kenneth Branaugh, Dimple Kapadia, Martin Donovan, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Himesh Patel, Clémence Poésy, Denzil Smith and Michael Caine. The film is now playing in theaters in select cities.</p><p>Directed by Niki Caro, Disney's live-action <em>Mulan</em> stars Yifei Liu as Mulan, Donnie Yen as Commander Tung, Jason Scott Lee as Böri Khan and Yoson An as Cheng Honghui, with Gong Li as Xianniang and Jet Li as the Emperor. The film is now available through Premier Access on Disney+ before being available to all Disney+ subscribers on Dec. 4.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 00:20:51 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mulan-disney-plus-premier-access-poster-header.jpg","linkMd5":"93363309ed2737d213f33d5b9ed39934","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":114702,"destBytes":114702,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mulan-disney-plus-premier-access-poster-header.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989065},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Jujutsu Kaisen Brings Yuji Back After Sukuna’s HAVOC | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-chapter-119-yuji-returns-sukunas-havoc/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jujutsu-kaisen.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/jujutsu-kaisen/\">Jujutsu Kaisen</a>, Chapter #119, by Gege Akutami, Stefan Koza and Snir Aharon, available now in English from Viz Media.</strong></em></p><p><em>Jujutsu Kaisen</em>'s Yuji Itadori has been absent for the last few chapters after losing control of his body to Sukuna. In that time, Sukuna has made sure the world remembered why he is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-chapter-115-sukuna-king-of-curses/\">known as the King of Curses</a>. Unfortunately for Yuji, he'll have to come to terms with all the death and destruction Sukuna has unleashed since possessing his body.</p><p>Megumi Fushiguro, Yuji's friend and fellow <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-which-sorcerer-could-become-shaman-king/\">Jujutsu Sorcerer</a>, is known for his use of the Ten Shadows Technique that allows him to summon various Shikigami he can command. Part of this ability includes calling a Shikigami that the user doesn't have control of yet, but can if they're able to exorcise it. Fushiguro does the first part of that ritual by bringing the immensely powerful, and so far undefeated, Shikigami named Mahoraga onto the battlefield. This <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-chapter-117-fushiguros-exorcism-strategy-risky/\">risky plan</a> was meant to cause issues for the Cursed Spirits, even if it meant Fushiguro could lose his life in the process.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-trailer-plot-release-date-news/\">Jujutsu Kaisen: Trailer, Plot, Release Date &#38; News to Know</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Jujutsu-Kaisen-Sukuna-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Mahoraga immediately knocks Fushiguro unconscious, but Sukuna arrives and saves the young sorcerer's life, claiming there is something he still needs from him. As the two square off, Sukuna begins to understand how Mahoraga's abilities work. Aside from using the Sword of Extermination, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/monster-hunter-milla-jovovich-dual-blades-image/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">a blade</a> specialized for taking down Cursed Spirits, Mahoraga can adapt to any attack. This allows it to see and recover from Sukuna's slashing abilities, but its limits are tested when Sukuna unleashes his Malevolent Shrine.</p><p>Malevolent Shrine, like most Domain Expansions, is guaranteed to hit anything within its effective area. Described as an artist's masterpiece painted on air instead of canvas, Malevolent Shrine is unlike other Domains as it hits everything within a 200-meter radius instead of creating a separate space surrounded by a barrier. As long as Malevolent Shrine is maintained, Sukuna's Cleave will strike anything with cursed energy, and Dismantle hits inanimate objects relentlessly. Sukuna makes sure to reduce the radius so Fushiguro isn't in range, but unfortunately, that kindness isn't extended to all the people obliterated by his attack.</p><p>Mahoraga can't escape the nonstop slashing of Malevolent Shrine, but it does try to regenerate after the flurry ends. Sukuna recognizes his chance to finish the fight, uttering the word \"Open,\" as he lets the same explosive flaming arrow that defeated Jogo fly into Mahoraga. After a massive explosion, the only thing remaining of the Shikigami is the strange wheel attached to its back, which Sukuna tosses towards Haruta Shigemo, a Curse user working with the Cursed Spirits. The area around Sukuna, which had once been a dense metropolis, is now a barren 140-meter circle of dirt.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-amaterasus-dark-secret-revealed/\">Fire Force: The Amaterasu's Dark Secret, Revealed</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Jujutsu-Kaisen.jpg\"/></figure><p>Haruta is a Curse user seen throughout the \"Shibuya Incident Arc,\" fighting with both Nanami and Fushiguro, but his name and the nature of his cursed technique have only just been revealed. By collecting everyday miracles that erase themselves from Haruta's memory, these stored moments release when his life is in danger. Haruta can't believe his luck when Sukuna tells him to leave, but as he happily obliges the King of Curses, we see that his lucky miracles have run out. Believing he'll live to see another day, Haruta gets a couple of steps away before being sliced in half vertically.</p><p>With that final gruesome act, Sukuna can sense he'll soon lose control of Yuji's body. As Masamichi Yaga and Shoko Ieiri, the principal and doctor of Jujutsu High respectively, look at the utter destruction left by Sukuna, they spot the unconscious Fushiguro. Yaga notices Yuji/Sukuna for a moment, wondering which one is currently in control. The final panel reveals an extremely troubled and disturbed looking Yuji.</p><p>Yuji, like most <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-anime-stream-exclusively-crunchyroll-fall/\">shonen protagonists</a>, is against taking a life, but has slowly learned that there are instances where he won't have the luxury of sticking to that principle. He's already reluctantly crossed that line, but that's nothing compared to the scale of Sukuna's massacre. Considering Yuji probably had a front seat view of Sukuna demolishing the city and murdering an unknown number of people, there's a big chance he'll struggle to cope with the aftermath.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-kimetsu-no-yaiba-vol-16-final-arc/\">Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaiba Vol. 16 Sets Up the Manga's Final Arc</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:00:00 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jujutsu-kaisen.jpg","linkMd5":"d8f5053c3cb359b3845e5ee8cf167a2b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn38@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-334_f2a218122e3d0250.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":105466,"destBytes":105466,"author":"Erik Kozura","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/jujutsu-kaisen.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn38@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-334_f2a218122e3d0250.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Jujutsu-Kaisen-Sukuna-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn38@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-34-121_292bf21148d0b3b2.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Jujutsu-Kaisen.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn5@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-37-925_ad436d44a13948b9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Friday the 13th Blu-ray Box Set Details Are Scary Impressive ","link":"https://www.cbr.com/friday-the-13th-blu-ray-collection-details-scream-factory/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-jason-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>He's Back. He's the man behind the mask. And and he's on Blu-ray.</p><p>Scream Factory -- Shout! Factory's horror label -- has revealed the final details for its upcoming <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/friday-the-13th/\">Friday the 13th</a> Blu-ray collection, which is slated to go on sale this October. The box set includes every single film in the <em>Friday the 13th</em> series (including <em>Freddy vs. Jason</em>) and bonus materials that were previously available on other home video releases of the films, as well as all-new bonus materials like new cast and crew audio commentaries.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/pamela-voorhees-dark-leagcy/\">Pamela Voorhees: The Dark Legacy of Friday the 13th's Original Killer</a></span></p><p>The collection is 16 discs in total. The first 14 discs are to one film each. Including <em>Freddy vs. Jason</em> and the 2009 <em>Friday the 13th</em> reboot, the franchise has 12 films in total. However, the box set also includes the uncut versions of the original 1980 <em>Friday the 13th</em> and 1993's <em>Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday</em>, which have their own discs separate from the theatrical versions. Meanwhile, the final two discs are dedicated entirely to special features -- some old, some new.</p><p id=\"title\" class=\"a-size-large a-spacing-none\"><span id=\"productTitle\" class=\"a-size-large product-title-word-break\">The <em>Friday the 13th</em> Collection arrives on Blu-ray Oct. 13 and is currently available for <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Friday-the-13th-Collection-Blu-ray/dp/B07GNV288V?tag=bluray-000-20&#38;linkCode=xm2&#38;m=ATVPDKIKX0DER\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">pre-order</a>. It retails for $132.99 USD. The complete Blu-ray specs, which break down each disc and specify which bonus content is new, can be found below.</span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-front.jpg\"/></figure><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-slip.jpg\"/></figure><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-set.jpg\"/></figure><blockquote><p class=\"a-size-large a-spacing-none\">DISCS ONE: R-RATED THEATRICAL VERSION OF FRIDAY THE 13TH (1980)</p><ul><li><b>NEW</b> 4K Scan Of The Original Camera Negative</li><li><b>NEW</b> International Theatrical Trailer</li><li><b>NEW</b> TV Spot</li><li><b>NEW</b> S. Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-jason-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn6@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-534_58bed985a90efe97.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-front.jpg":null,"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-slip.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn86@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-37-889_05775aecf9330859.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/friday-13th-set.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn53@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-34-146_6b68928c9b4b093c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989068},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Keanu Reeves' New Comic Goes SUPER-Meta With an Ode to the 'Sad Keanu' Meme","link":"https://www.cbr.com/keanu-reeves-brzrkr-sad-meme/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Keanu-Reeves-BRZRKR.jpg\"/></figure><p>Later this year, Keanu Reeves is jumping into the world of comics with the upcoming BOOM! Studios series, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/brzrkr/\"><em>BRZRKR</em></a>. Co-written by Reeves and Matt Kindt, with art by Ron Garney, colors by Bill Crabtree, and letters by Clem Robbins, the new brutal and violent new series about an immortal warrior will pay tribute to one of the most beloved images the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/bill-and-ted-3/\">Bill and Ted Face the Music</a> star has ever appeared in, the \"Sad Keanu\" meme.</p><p>The meme, which surfaced in May of 2010, features a sad-looking <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-makes-creepy-arc-even-creepier/\">Keanu</a> eating a sandwich on a park bench. Since it first surfaced, it's exploded into a series of colorful memes and has been remixed into countless variations over the past decade.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/keanu-reeves-brzrkr-comic-series/\">Keanu Reeves Launches BRZRKR Comic Series With Kindt &#38; Vitti</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/SadKeanu.jpg\"/></figure><p>Although Reeves told the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UtuWvi0fkb4\">BBC</a> that he wished he hadn't had his picture taken while \"eating a sandwich on the streets of New York\" in 2011, the meme cemented him as one of the Internet's most beloved actors. While Reeves has continued to star in genre fare like <em>Bill and Ted: Face the Music </em>and <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/cyberpunk-2077/\">Cyberpunk 2077</a>, </em>Reeves is equally celebrated for his various charitable contributions and overall positivity.</p><p>And in a preview of <em>BRZRKR </em>#1, Reeves and his creative collaborators have paid tribute to the mem in loving detail. In a preview, the protagonist of <em>BRZRKR </em>sits on a bench, striking that iconic, sandwich-eating pose in the rain.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-george-carlin/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music Has a Righteous George Carlin Tribute</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Reeves-Meme-BRZRKR.jpg\"/></figure><p>Although it's not clear why the titular Berzerkeris sad here, he has a long life of violence to look back on. As the Kickstart describes, the series will follow the immortal demigod warrior as he tries to uncover the truth behind the lifetimes of violence that have pushed his sanity to the breaking point. He'll also try to figure out how to free himself from the curse of immortality while fighting the battles that are too dangerous for anyone else.</p><p>While Reeves' public persona is positive and wholesome, <em>BRZRKR's </em>dark soldier seems to have far more in line with the ruthless killer Reeves portrays in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/john-wick\">John Wick</a> franchise. With this image, <em>BRZRKR </em>reclaims the image that inspired thousands of jokes to highlight the pain and isolation of its violent lead. While the Internet rallied around the idea of cheering Keanu up, it seems like the Berzerker will have to carve out his own path to happiness.</p><p><em>BRZRKR </em>#1<em> is set to be released in October 2020.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fortnite-nexus-war-ends-meowscles-avengers/\">For Fortnite's Nexus War, Meowscles Needs to Join the Avengers</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:20:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Keanu-Reeves-BRZRKR.jpg","linkMd5":"e48defe6fc5e2065c0b63836799041af","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":200661,"destBytes":159328,"author":"Ian Powell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Keanu-Reeves-BRZRKR.jpg":null,"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/SadKeanu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn58@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-41-520_1a78aff6e3134e92.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Reeves-Meme-BRZRKR.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn77@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-40-803_17c609f686e77717.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989067},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Bleach: 10 Facts About The Series Even Hardcore Fans Forgot | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-series-facts-hardcore-fans-forgot/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Bleach-Featured.jpg\"/></figure><p>The iconic series, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/bleach/\">Bleach</a></em>, has been going on for so long that most fans, even the most fanatic ones, do not recall some of the core details about the story (and its creation). The manga ended in 2016, after a whopping 74 volumes comprising 686 chapters in total, but the in-world timeline barely takes two years for the narrative to reach completion.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-ichigo-kurosaki-transformations/\">Bleach: The 10 Transformations Of Ichigo Kurosaki</a></span></p><p>However, discussing everything about <em>Bleach</em> would require far greater space than is available in this article, so here are the ten most important facts pertaining to the series that deserve to be remembered.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>The Gigantic Franchise</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/bleach-social.jpg' /></figure><p>There are a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ways-bleach-ripped-off-yu-yu-hakusho-reasons-why-own-thing/\">lot of similarities between <em>Bleach</em> and <em>Yu Yu Hakusho</em></a>, but that didn't stop the former from becoming one of the most beloved series of all time.</p><p>In addition to its manga and associated anime series, the story has been adapted to various other forms of media, as well, including several movies, video games, artbooks, novels, trading card series, and even <em>Rock Musical Bleach</em>. The latter is especially fascinating, as it seems that <em>Bleach</em> is popular enough to be represented via live stage performances.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Kyouka Suigetsu's Bankai</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bleach-Facts-Fans-Forgot-Aizen-Bankai.jpg' /></figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-kyoka-suigetsu-ryuujin-jakka-comparison-most-powerful/\">zankapkuto known as Kyouka Suigetsu is no ordinary one</a>, and its inescapable hypnotic powers serve as both offense and defense while in combat (combined with Aizen's overpowering <em>reiatsu</em>). Interestingly, this is only his shikai's ability, leaving his unknown bankai a complete mystery.</p><p>He probably does have one, but there can be no confirmation about this due to the very nature of Kyouka Suigetsu. Some fans have even suggested that Kanzen Saimin is a feature of the bankai, implying that Aizen has woven yet another layer of lies about his true strength.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Orihime As Deus Ex Machina</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bleach-Fans-Forgot-Orihime-Deus-ex-Machina.jpg' /></figure><p>Yes, the same girl who is best known for her plaintive and interminable mewling of Ichigo's name might just be the most powerful character in Bleach (in her own way). Orihime's Shun Shun Rikka, a result of the Hogyouku's long-distance blessing, is able to bring about, as Aizen puts it, \"the rejection of phenomena,\" in that it can simply reverse a performed action, making it so that it had never occurred in the first place.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-manga-nerf-female-characters/\">Bleach: 10 Ways In Which The Manga Nerfs Female Characters</a></span></p><p>This ability of hers, considerably more effective than space-time manipulation, is actually sufficient to restore Ichigo's destroyed bankai — although only with the assistance of Tsukishima and his dreaded Book of the End.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Tite Kubo, Fashionista</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Bleach-Cast-of-Characters.jpg' /></figure><p>Several <em>Bleach</em> characters have been dressed up by the mangaka in really spectacular outfits, ranging from casual homegrown attire to blazing beachwear. Apparently, Kubo has a thing for clothes, as can be seen from <a href=\"https://unrealitymag.com/bleach-creator-tite-kubo-one-hell-bleach-cosplay/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">his unbelievably authentic Captain Kurotsuchi cosplay</a>.</p><p>Further, he has admitted that he loves the aesthetic nature of fashion, claiming that the haori worn by the Shinigami are also an attempt to make them look stylish while fighting. Too bad he doesn't incorporate some of his funkier designs into the actual story.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Ichigo's Kill Count</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Bleach-Ichigo-Fullbring.jpg' /></figure><p>Surprisingly, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-ichigo-fights-survive/\">Ichigo hasn't really killed a lot of characters</a> in the course of events, because, while he's a nice guy and everything, he doesn't care much about not spilling blood (unlike, for instance, Aang from <em>Avatar: The Last Airbender</em>). Regardless, he has only officially murdered one person in the whole story, the previous Substitute Shinigami and antagonist of the <em>Fullbringer</em> arc, Kugo Ginjou.</p><p>Also, his Vasto Lorde incarnation pretty much vaporizes Ulquiorra Cifer's Segunda Etapa, but there is no clear consensus on if this can be included in the list, as he has absolutely no recollection of the event. Yhwach doesn't count, because it is Kazui Kurosaki who actually deals the final blow a decade later.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>The Nazi References In The Fourth Arc</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage-10-1.jpg' /></figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-villains-unfair-endings/\">final villains, the Wandenreich</a>, are apparently Quincy, so everything about them screams German. Unlike the Ishida family however, the Sternritter are possibly based on the German and Weimer Empires of the late 19th and early 20th centuries (and their successor, Hitler's dictatorship).</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-anime-most-hated-characters/\">Bleach: The Anime's 10 Most Hated Characters, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Not only are Yhwach's minions utterly devoted to him, much like the Nazis' worship of their Führer, but the Soldat are a likely representation of the Wehrmacht. To top it all off, Yhwach's sword hilt is designed much like the Reichsadler, the eagle-based herald that was, and still remains, part of Germany's official standard.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Too Many Filler Episodes</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/bleach-filler-kisuke-mirror-match.jpg' /></figure><p>If there was one thing that diluted <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-moments-that-changed-everything/\">the momentous events in <em>Bleach</em></a>, it was the ridiculous number of fillers that the show's producers kept pumping out to pass time until the manga's storyline caught up to the anime.</p><p>Of the 366 total episodes created, covering all events that occurred before the <em>Thousand Year Blood War</em> arc, 163 of them are considered to be unrelated plots that include all the characters, their backstories and mythologies, but deviate from the essence of the narrative way too much to be acceptable. It's not that something this annoying is easy to forget, but the anime did stop production in 2012.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Rukia Was The Planned Protagonist</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rukia-bleach-ichigo-funny.jpg' /></figure><p>Before the fire-haired main character came into the picture, <em>Bleach</em> was supposed to be called <em>Snipe</em>, and Kuchiki Rukia (wearing her standard robes but holding the Grim Reaper's scythe to mark her as a Death God) was to be the story's protagonist.</p><p>More importantly, the antagonists were not meant to be Hollows at all, but actually human villains armed with guns instead of reiatsu and magical katanas. As fascinating as this version might have been, choosing Ichigo was a very smart decision made by Tite Kubo: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-uryu-wrong-smarter/\">At least it wasn't Uryuu</a> or Chad.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>The Anime Is Returning!</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Bleach-Anime.jpg' /></figure><p>As stated above, the anime ended in 2012 (actually shelved because it was not receiving as much traction as before). Luckily, it has been recently announced that the series last arc would be given its own TV adaptation in 2021, eight agonizing years after most fans had lost hope that it would ever come back.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-characters-questionable-forgotten-things/\">Bleach: 10 Questionable Things Its Characters Did (Which Everyone Has Forgotten)</a></span></p><p>It will cover the manga chapters from 480 to 686, which means that there might be over a hundred episodes, at the very least! This decision makes more sense considering that next year happens to be <em>Bleach</em>'s twentieth anniversary.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Why Is It Named Bleach?</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Bleach-Ichigo-Final.jpg' /></figure><p>The word Bleach is said to refer to the color \"white,\" evincing monochrome vibes in contrast with the Shinigami's black garments. This is the direct, and most believable, explanation for the origin of the name, but there remains another possibility.</p><p>Some fans have speculated that <em>Bleach</em> is a verb, not a noun — this way it can be read as the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-ichigo-wrong-smarter/\">release command for Ichigo's zanpakuto</a>, the only major one for which the words are still unknown. To put it another way: Bleach, Zangetsu!</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bleach-power-couples-not-romantic/\">Bleach: 10 Platonic Power Couples</a></span></p>\n 7.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Bleach-Ichigo-Final.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn26@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-42-031_fa8515286e2242dd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Metallica Is Scoring Disney's Jungle Cruise Movie | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/metallica-scoring-disney-jungle-cruise-movie/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/jungle-cruise-header-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Disney's upcoming film <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/jungle-cruise/\">Jungle Cruise</a></em> has got some significant star power in the project's music department. Iconic heavy metal band Metallica will create an orchestral version of \"Nothing Else Matters\" alongside composer James Newton Howard especially for the movie.</p><p>\"It really goes back to [Disney production president] Sean Bailey, who is a lifelong rock fan,\" Metallica drummer Lars Ulrich explained to <a href=\"https://collider.com/metallica-jungle-cruise-movie-score-lars-ulrich/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Collider</a>, \"and is just all-around one of the greatest, most friendly, generous, warm, and embracing people you'll find in the music business.\" While the thought of one of the most influential heavy metal bands in history working with Disney may surprise some, Ulrich revealed that Bailey was responsible for the musical crossover.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dwayne-johnson-reflects-on-jungle-cruises-covid-19-delay/\">Dwayne Johnson Reflects on Jungle Cruise's COVID-19 Delay</a></span></p><p>\"We've gotten to know each other well,\" said Ulrich. \"My wife and I are big Disney fans, so there's a great friendship there, and he's always looked for the right match where there was a way that Metallica could contribute to some project of theirs.\" The drummer has expressed he believes <em>Jungle Cruise</em> is the right fit for the band's sensibilities, with Bailey leading the charge, and the musical talent evident in James Newton Howard's track record over an illustrious career.</p><p><em>Jungle Cruise</em>, which is based on Disney Parks' classic attraction of the same name, is directed by Jaume Collet-Serra and stars Dwayne Johnson, Jack Whitehall, Emily Blunt, Jesse Plemons, Paul Giamatti and Èdgar Ramírez. The film will arrive in theaters on July 30, 2021.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jungle-cruise-rock-emily-blunt-fake-posters/\">The Rock, Emily Blunt Prank Each Other with Fake Jungle Cruise Posters</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:35:45 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/jungle-cruise-header-2.jpg","linkMd5":"45a25e2426c69528b31675211e7e7351","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn42@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-29-299_345fafc4cb7e0065.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":207918,"destBytes":169918,"author":"Neeraj Chand","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/jungle-cruise-header-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn42@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-29-299_345fafc4cb7e0065.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989073},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Jim Janes, DC Comics Artist and TMNT Cartoon Storyboarder, Passes Away","link":"https://www.cbr.com/jim-janes-obituary/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Jim-Janes-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Comic book artist and cartoon storyboarder Jim Janes -- known for his work on such comics as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/\">Legion of Super-Heroes</a> and shows as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles/\">Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles</a> -- has passed away.</p><p>Janes' passing was confirmed on <a href=\"https://twitter.com/PaulKupperberg/status/1301874179055194113?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Twitter</a> by former collaborator Paul Kupperberg. \"I just learned of the death of artist Jim Janes, my long ago collaborator on the <em>Secrets of the Legion of Super-Heroes </em>miniseries,\" Kupperberg wrote. \"Jim was a complete pro who didn't blink at these overstuffed scripts. 'It's the Legion,' he said. 'Bring them on!'\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-kept-casey-jones-origin/\">2003's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Kept All of the '80s in Casey Jones' Origin</a></span></p><p>In addition to working on the three-part <em>Secrets of the Legion of Super-Heroes</em> series alongside writers Kupperberg and E. Nelson Bridwell in 1981, Janes also penciled no fewer than 15 issues of DC Comics' main <em>Legion of Super-Heroes</em> title from May of 1980 to December of '81. Some of his other DC credits include<em> House of Mystery</em> and <em>Superman Family</em>. He also did some work for Marvel Comics, penciling <em>Marvel Comics Super Special</em> #17 and <em>Marvel Team-Up</em> #95.</p><p>In the world of animation, Janes worked as a storyboard artist on numerous different shows, including <em>RoboCob: Alpha Commando</em>, <em>Extreme Ghostbusters</em>, <em>Exosquad</em>, the animated adaptation of <em>The Karate Kid</em> and 1987's <em>Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles</em>. He also worked on numerous cartoons based on DC and Marvel properties, including <em>Swamp Thing</em>, <em>Batman: The Animated Series</em>, <em>The Incredible Hulk</em>, <em>Spider-Man: The Animated Series</em> and <em>X-Men: The Animated Series</em>.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-the-animated-series-revival-disney/\">X-Men: The Animated Series Revival Has Been Discussed - It's Up to Disney</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 03:31:17 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Jim-Janes-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"86238f9cd665266786a50754b91b5db9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn11@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-31-028_22d9bf738af9d8d5.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":123356,"destBytes":123356,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Jim-Janes-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn11@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-31-028_22d9bf738af9d8d5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989060},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Marvel's Spider-Man: Modder Unearths Unused Spider-Cop Skin in the PS4 Game","link":"https://www.cbr.com/marvels-spider-man-unused-cop-skin-ps4/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Spider-Cop-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>A PlayStation 4 modder has unearthed an unused Spider-Cop skin from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man-ps4/\"><em>Marvel's Spider-Man</em></a> and posted gameplay footage of the skin in action.</p><p>Youtuber jedijosh920 shared in-game footage of the outfit, which they discovered under the file name of \"hero_spiderman-spidercop model.\" The outfit is equipped with a traditional police jacket, hat and sunglasses, as well as Stan Lee's iconic mustache. Though the character is incomplete, stuck in a T-Pose with no working animations, it does reveal two of its intended special abilities, one being the ability to spawn friendly cops for in-battle assistance and the other, a backup Donut Drone.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-ps4-mr-negative-explained/\">Spider-Man PS4: Mister Negative, Explained</a></span></p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/2TnuyFQIsEg?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>Fans have long speculated Insomniac Games' inclusion of this particular skin due to the game's story mode containing a running gag of Spider-Man dubbing himself Spider-Cop while interacting with Police Captain Yuri Watanabe. The Spider-Cop identity's popularity even led to a cameo appearance by the character in <em>Spider-Geddon</em> #5.</p><p>The immense popularity of <em>Marvel's Spider-Man</em> lead to the announcement of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man-miles-morales/\"><em>Spider-Man: Miles Morales</em></a>, a standalone expansion game that will be exclusive to PlayStation 5. While little has been revealed about <em>Miles Morales' </em>plot, it has been revealed that the game will see Miles face off against a malevolent corporation, among other villains.</p><p>Developed by Insomniac Games and PlayStation Studios, <em>Spider-Man: Miles Morales </em>will be available for the PlayStation 5 this holiday season.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-miles-morales-from-batman-arkham/\">Spider-Man: Miles Morales Should Take a Page From Batman: Arkham</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:43:41 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Spider-Cop-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"ef074fc54419897517c317af365da5c2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn67@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-30-315_aabebdd7d7e1c9bc.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":32740,"destBytes":32740,"author":"Andrew Cavalluzzi","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Spider-Cop-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn67@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-30-315_aabebdd7d7e1c9bc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989070},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"One Piece: Every Arc In The Summit War Saga, Ranked | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-every-arc-summit-war-saga-ranked/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Best-Summit-War-Saga.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Summit War Saga is among the longest sagas in the series. It has some of the best arcs in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\">One Piece</a></em>. There are a total of five arcs in the Summit War Saga: Sabaody Archipelago arc, Amazon Lily arc, Impel Down arc, Marineford arc, and Post-War arc.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-arc-top-pirate-bounties/\">One Piece: Predicting The Top 10 Pirate Bounties After The Wano Arc</a></span></p><p>All the arcs are unique and two of them in particular are highly rated by the <em>One Piece</em> community. It is quite difficult to rank all the arcs because each of them is special in their own way. But, we will give it a fair go in this post. Here are all the arcs in the Summit War Saga ranked!</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Amazon Lily Arc</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Amazon-Lily-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After beaten ruthlessly by Bartholomew Kuma, Luffy was sent to Amazon Lily. The island was inhabited by women and Luffy was not welcome there. He had to fight against Boa Sandersonia and Boa Marigold, and in the meantime, he won the heart of Boa Hancock. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It was on Amazon Lily that Luffy found out that Ace was going to be executed by the Marines. Luffy made up his mind that he was going to save his only brother. So, he sought help from Boa Hancock, who couldn't turn him down. This lead to the start of the mission \"Save Ace\".</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Post-War Arc</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Luffy-Sabo-Ace.jpg' /></figure><p>After the crushing defeat of the Whitebeard Pirates, the entire world rejoiced as they believed that the Marines rid them of one of the most malevolent pirates in the world. Luffy was distraught; he watched Ace die in his arms. It fell to Jinbe to motivate his future captain and made him realize that Luffy still had his crew, who were waiting for him.</p><p>This was one of the most difficult times in Luffy's life, but he didn't give up. Luffy went to Marineford with a message for his crew inscribed on his arm. The arc also covered Luffy's childhood including the time when he <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-ace-sabo-best-big-brother/\">met Ace and Sabo</a>. The arc is perfect and it complimented the fast-paced Marineford arc. The post-war arc toned down the seriousness and showed how the brothers bonded together.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Impel Down Arc</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Ace-Impel-Down.jpg' /></figure><p>In this arc, all hell broke loose. Luffy managed to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-characters-impel-down-arc/\">enter Impel Down</a> with help from Boa Hancock. Luffy had one goal in mind and that was to free his brother. He had no idea that it was going to be such a difficult job. Luffy almost got himself killed when he tried to fight against Magellan. But, Luffy didn't care about getting himself killed, he wanted to save his brother and he was willing to go to any lengths to do so.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-characters-surpass-blackbeard/\">One Piece: 5 Characters Who Will Surpass Blackbeard (&#38; 5 Who Won’t)</a></span></p><p>With help from Ivankov, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-fan-favorite-villains-myanimelist/\">Bon Clay</a>, and a few others, Luffy managed to reach the level where Ace was being kept. However, he was met with disappointment when Jinbe told him that Ace was taken away to Marineford. Now, Luffy's goal became to chase away Ace and reach Marineford. In order to help Luffy, Bon Clay used himself as a distraction. He stayed behind which allowed him to open the Gates of Justice. This solidified the bond between Luffy and Bon Clay.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Sabaody Archipelago Arc</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/One-Piece-Sabaody-Archipelago-arc-Luffy-Celestial-Dragons.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Sabaody Archipelago is one of the most highly rated arcs in the series. The arc saw all the Supernovas gathering together at the same place. If this wasn't enough, one of the members of the Roger Pirates was revealed. Silvers Rayleigh stole the spotlight when his real identity was revealed. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In this arc, Luffy did one of the most outrageous things; he actually punched a Celestial Dragon, which put all the pirates at Sabaody Archipelago in jeopardy. Sentoumaru and his Pacifista wreaked havoc on the island. To pile further misery on the pirates, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-marine-admirals-yonko-level-reasons-below-close/\">Admiral Kizaru</a> and Bartholomew Kuma were also present on Sabaody. Kizaru crushed several Superonovas with minimal effort. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-worst-loss-straw-hat-pirates-ranked/\">The Straw Hats suffered</a> the most as all of them were sent to different places. The arc showed that Luffy and co. were not ready to enter the New World, that was crawling with insanely powerful pirates, who were merciless.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Marineford Arc</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Whitebeard-using-the-tremor-fruit.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The best arc in the Summit War saga is Marineford. The stakes were very high during the arc. Portgas D. Ace, the son of Pirate King, Gol D. Roger was going to be executed by the Marines. Adding to this, Ace was a member of the Whitebeard Pirates and their captain didn't like it if anyone of his crewmates was harmed. So, the Marines were ready for an all-out with Whitebeard who had the title of the Strongest Man in the World. The war at Marineford involved the Whitebeard Pirates, the Shichibukai, and the entire Navy.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> The arc was a rollercoaster of emotions; in one instance it seemed that the Marines had the advantage and Ace was gonna be executed but then things would change quickly and the tide would turn in favor of the pirates. The entry of Luffy at Marineford made for an emotional reunion of the brothers. The arc ended with Ace and Whitebeard dying, thus the Marines emerged victorious. The arc also saw cameos from Shanks and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-blackbeard-pirates-bounty-ranked/\">Blackbeard</a>. There are some really iconic moments in the arc and some of them will never be forgotten, but one will forever stand out among the rest; the confirmation of the existence of One Piece by Whitebeard. Truth be told, the arc remains the best arc in the entire series, but <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-best-arc-improve/\">Wano might surpass it in the future.</a></span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-legendary-fights-story-who-won/\">One Piece: 5 Legendary Fights In The Story (&#38; Who Won)</a></span></p>\n
