             \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 02:49:47 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Spawn-310-McFarlane-Variant-Ninja-Spawn-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"110218ab54f275976817c77e843b18ec","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn70@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-154_076fcf97f2705640.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":143720,"destBytes":143720,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Spawn-310-McFarlane-Variant-Ninja-Spawn-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn70@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-154_076fcf97f2705640.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EhBp5ulU8AAK-Ti.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-016_32288c28b7914321.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989060},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The Matrix 4: Hugo Weaving Says Lana Wachowski 'Pulled the Plug' on Negotiating Agent Smith's Return","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-matrix-4-lana-wachowski-pulled-plug-hugh-weaving-return-negotiations-agent-smith/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Agent-Smith-replicated.jpg\"/></figure><p>It has long been known that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-matrix\">Matrix</a> alum Hugo Weaving would not be reprising his role as Agent Smith for the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/matrix-4/\">upcoming fourth film</a> due to scheduling conflicts. However, Weaving has now revealed that it was director Lana Wachowski who made the decision to \"pull the plog\" on negotiations for his return, as she believed Weaving's commitments to London's National Theatre wouldn't fit in with the shooting dates she had in mind for him.</p><p>\"Lana Wachowski had rung me at the beginning of last year,\" Weaving said in an interview with <a href=\"https://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/1147360-exclusive-hugo-weaving-talks-about-his-involvement-with-the-matrix-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">ComingSoon.net</a>. \"We've worked together five times, the Wachowskis and I on three <em>Matrix</em> films, <em>V for Vendetta</em> and <em>Cloud Atlas</em>. I've hung out with them all over the world for many, many years. So, yes, Lana was very keen for me to be involved in <em>The Matrix</em>. There was a reading with Keanu [Reeves], Carrie[-Anne Moss] and myself and a few others from the old family.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/matrix-4-keanu-reeves-on-covid-19-precautions/\">As The Matrix 4 Shooting Resumes, Keanu Reeves Comments on COVID Precautions</a></span></p><p>Weaving admits he had reservations about returning for <em>The Matrix 4</em>, as he had mixed feelings about its script, saying that he \"loved a lot of it and wasn't sure about other bits.\" Still, Weaving initially did agree to reprise his role as Agent Smith. \"Ultimately, we talked about it and when the offer came through to do it for Warner's I said yes the next day and I talked to Lana,\" he said.</p><p>Weaving was scheduled to work the National Theatre from November to April. However, Wachowski wanted Weaving to shoot his scenes from February until May.\"I thought we could have done my scenes in May, June and July; and we talked about money and we talked about -- they were negotiating,\" Weaving shared. \"And we were all pretty much sorted and agreed on dates and it was all fine, but then Lana decided she didn't think it was going to work. So, she pulled the plug on the negotiations. That's where it ended up. She basically didn't feel that my commitment to the National Theatre was going to fit in with the dates that she had in mind for me.\" While Weaving is disappointed that he will not be returning as Agent Smith in <em>The Matrix 4</em>, he says he does look forward to seeing the film.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/matrix-4-why-laurence-fishburne-not-returning/\">The Matrix 4: Why Laurence Fishburne Isn't Returning for the Sequel</a></span></p><p>Directed by Lana Wachowski, <em>The Matrix 4</em> stars Keanu Reeves, Carrie-Anne Moss, Jada Pinkett Smith, Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, Neil Patrick Harris, Jessica Henwick and Jonathan Groff. The film arrives in theaters April 1, 2022.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:44:41 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Agent-Smith-replicated.jpg","linkMd5":"eb63b7d89ec3e41f3ca314b4d943a04f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn35@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-565_7d8853e91f20be3e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":47054,"destBytes":47054,"author":"Noah Dominguez","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Agent-Smith-replicated.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn35@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-565_7d8853e91f20be3e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989067},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Doctor Manhattan Vs. Lucifer Morningstar: Who Wins In A Fight?","link":"https://www.cbr.com/doctor-manhattan-vs-lucifer-morningstar/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Doctor-Manhattan-Vs-Lucifer.jpg\"/></figure><p>Comic creators love to portray godlike characters in their stories. It adds something to them; it allows creators and readers both to get into the minds of beings that are by their very nature unknowable and inject something human into them, to meld the sacred and profane. One of the most popular examples of this is <em>Watchmen</em>'s <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dr-manhattan/\">Doctor Manhattan</a>- a man who basically becomes a science god but still has a glimmer of humanity in him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/alan-moore-watchmen-miracleman-better-worse/\">5 Reasons Alan Moore's Miracleman Is Better Than Watchmen (&#38; 5 Reasons Watchmen Is Better)</a></span></p><p>Another example of this is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/lucifer/\">Lucifer Morningstar</a>. The biblical Devil, he was introduced in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-sandman/\">The Sandman </a></em>before abandoning Hell, going to Earth, and getting his own book about his adventures. If Doctor Manhattan were to clash with Lucifer Morningstar, who would win?</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">11 </span>Doctor Manhattan: Recreator Of Worlds</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Dr.-Manhattan.jpg' /></figure><p>The New 52 was an ambitious move by DC to garner new readers by wiping much of their slate clean, much like <em>Crisis On Infinite Earths </em>was before it. However, it never gained the success of its fabled predecessor and was shuttered about five years after its inception. There were <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-new-52-aged-well-badly-batman-female-characters/\">a lot of changes to the universe that were great, and some that weren't</a>, but DC came up with a novel reason for all of these changes.</p><p>Doctor Manhattan came to the DC Universe and decided to start messing around with it. He went back in time, stopping certain events and literally stole time from the universe, basically recreating the DC Universe.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Lucifer Morningstar: First Fallen</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Lucifer.jpg' /></figure><p>Lucifer was once God's favorite archangel and he was also the first rebel. Cast out of Heaven, he became the ruler of Hell. It's all pretty standard to people who are familiar with Judeo-Christian tradition. Lucifer was the first being to question God and led the war against Heaven for uncountable years after that until he got tired of it.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-lucifer-morningstar-memes-best/\">DC: 10 Hilarious Lucifer Morningstar Memes True Fans Will Enjoy</a></span></p><p>Lucifer has been conscious since the beginning of the all things and has watched creation develop. He has seen and done things that no other being has, giving him more experience in just about everything than most beings can possibly imagine.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Doctor Manhattan: Master Of Energy</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/04.-Dr.-Manhattan-Hand-Raised-DC-Costume-Pile.jpg' /></figure><p>Doctor Manhattan came from a world without superpowered beings. He helped the US government and was their main deterrent to Soviet nuclear attack. He could render the warheads inert and even absorb and change the nature of the nuclear energy released.</p><p>When he came to the DC Universe, he would eventually face some of the most powerful heroes and completely defeat them. He was able to turn their energies against them completely, even showing the ability to manipulate magical energy. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-villains-dr-mamhattan-can-defeat-and-villains-he-cant/\">This ability would serve him well against just about any foe</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Lucifer Morningstar: Eons Of Conflict</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DC-Lucifer-19-Header.jpg' /></figure><p>As ruler of Hell, Lucifer had to deal with some of the worst beings in existence. Hell was a constantly squabbling hierarchy of demons trying to gain power and they would often target Lucifer himself in their machinations, which was a huge mistake. Lucifer was much more powerful and canny than them and was always able to defeat any pretenders to his throne.</p><p>In his eons of existence, Lucifer has not only dealt with nearly every kind of scheme, but also been a part of many of them. He did it for so long that he got tired of it and decided to leave Hell. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-warriors-lucifer-morningstar-could-beat-lose-against/\">His experience in conflict is unprecedented</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Doctor Manhattan: A Man Of Learning</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/dr-manhattans-child-the-secret-to-dcs-watchmen-sequel.jpg' /></figure><p>Doctor Manhattan's obsession is knowledge. One of the reasons he worked for the US government on his world for so long was because they gave him the means to not only do any experiments he wanted, but to use his powers for all kinds of beneficial scientific endeavors, such as designing an entirely new energy system based on lithium he could synthesize, revolutionizing technology.</p><p>All of this learning and knowledge had the added effect of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/watchmen-dr-manhattans-greatest-powers-ranked/\">teaching him new ways of using his powers</a>- the more he learned about the universe and the way it worked, the more he could do with his powers.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Lucifer Morningstar: Feared By All</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/tumblr-inline-oumqqy728n1qec1pk-1280-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Lucifer was once the most powerful, wise, and beautiful angel of them all, and after his fall he still retained all of that. The universe is full of powerful forces, yet they all have one thing in common- they fear Lucifer Morningstar. Gods, angels, demons, it doesn't matter who, they all tread lightly in his presence.</p><p>Even beings like the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-endless/\">Endless</a>, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/sandman-the-endless-facts/\">who gods listen to and fear</a>, are afraid of Lucifer. Morpheus treated him with dignity and respect in an attempt to mollify Lucifer and even the elder Endless, like Destiny and Death, knew better than to trifle with the Star of Morning.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Doctor Manhattan: Time's Orphan</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Dr.-Manhattan.jpg' /></figure><p>Doctor Manhattan doesn't experience time like anyone else. For him, it's all happening at once- the past, present, and future all occurring simultaneously. This gives him a unique, almost unprecedented view of the universe and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dr-manhattan-vs-thanos/\">has allowed him to do some extraordinary things</a>- he knows what's going to happen and yet he also doesn't. It's can be confusing and yet it works for him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/watchmen-most-thought-provoking-quotes/\">Watchmen: 10 Most Thought-Provoking Quotes From The Comic</a></span></p><p>The only thing that can mess with his perception of time are tachyons, which muddle his visions of the future.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Lucifer Morningstar: Created A Universe</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lucifer-feat.jpg' /></figure><p>As powerful as Lucifer is, he can't create things on his own, only transmute them from one thing to another. However, if he works in concert with the archangel Michael or his niece Elaine, he gains creative powers, and he's used this ability once to create an entirely new universe. The whole thing ended badly, but he still was able to do it.</p><p>Even though he can't do it on his own, the fact that he was able to create a universe at all is very impressive. He understood how things worked well enough to create one on his own, and that shows just how intelligent he really is.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Doctor Manhattan: Hard To Defeat</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/doomsday-clock-9-dr-manhattan-naked-header-copy.jpg' /></figure><p>Doctor Manhattan was created in a terrible accident. He used his prodigious knowledge to reassemble his molecular structure, and this allowed him to learn how to manipulate matter of all kinds and it also made him extremely hard to destroy. There are probably ways to do it, of course, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-watchmen-dr-manhattan-battle/\">beings who could</a>, but the problem is figuring out how.</p><p>This makes battling Doctor Manhattan a daunting proposition- how does one destroy someone who learned how to reconstruct their molecular structure from scratch the first time they used their powers?</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Lucifer Morningstar: Actually Immortal</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lucifer.jpg' /></figure><p>Immortality is a tricky thing. There are many beings who have the potential to live forever and yet can still be killed. Conversely, there are beings who are completely indestructible who will one day die. Lucifer, however, is actually immortal- he will live forever and cannot be killed by anything other than a literal act of God- God himself is the only one who can do away with him.</p><p>Fighting Lucifer is a losing proposition, because there's no way to gain a final victory over him. Even on the small chance that someone was able to outmaneuver him, they couldn't kill him and this would give him a chance to come back and destroy them.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Winner: Lucifer Morningstar</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/lucifer-header.jpg' /></figure><p>Doctor Manhattan is one of the most powerful beings in existence, however even his powers are dwarfed by those of Lucifer Morningstar. Lucifer is the second most powerful being in all of creation; he can do just about anything.</p><p>As hard as Doctor Manhattan can be to defeat, Lucifer would have the power to do so, whereas nothing Doctor Manhattan can do would put him down.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-tom-ellis-perfect-mannerisms-source-material/\">Lucifer: 10 Mannerisms From The Comics That Tom Ellis Nails</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:00:21 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Doctor-Manhattan-Vs-Lucifer.jpg","linkMd5":"22f7c0f5f569cd5be27270fff0742bd3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn67@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-29-367_674be1a99201d055.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1000,"sourceBytes":188614,"destBytes":188614,"author":"David Harth","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Doctor-Manhattan-Vs-Lucifer.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn67@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-29-367_674be1a99201d055.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Dr.-Manhattan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn85@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-42-283_c10b8ee833f3c459.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Lucifer.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn78@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-41-648_ef8b7b5580660e1a.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/04.-Dr.-Manhattan-Hand-Raised-DC-Costume-Pile.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn12@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-35-162_2f1f8490af40dbeb.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DC-Lucifer-19-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-38-372_3d061d0ec3a83ff4.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/dr-manhattans-child-the-secret-to-dcs-watchmen-sequel.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn84@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-36-884_dccb9c5e7f04c66f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/tumblr-inline-oumqqy728n1qec1pk-1280-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn20@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-40-379_bd87df124c310e89.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Dr.-Manhattan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn24@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-39-508_aa4e42be73e4b5d1.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lucifer-feat.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn6@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-43-307_bb92d82632ddc78d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/doomsday-clock-9-dr-manhattan-naked-header-copy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn52@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-37-432_7cc5ddab62a90201.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lucifer.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn38@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-37-357_8aa19ffd409f594d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/lucifer-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn91@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-41-042_07301bc362a44580.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"5 Ways Squidward Is Secretly A Good Guy (& 5 Ways He's The Worst)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/squidward-secret-good-the-worst/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Good-Squidward-bad-Squidward.jpg\"/></figure><p>Love him or hate him, Squidward is one of the most recognizable and significant characters in cartoon history. While not exactly a stereotypical fountain of knowledge for kids in a kid's show, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spongebob-square-pants-squidward-facts/\">Squidward being an antithesis</a> of SpongeBob gives the show its own special character dynamics and unique brand of humor that rivals adult cartoons,' a tough feat for kid's cartoon.</p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/transformers-cartoon-comic-book/\">5 Reasons Why The Original Transformers Cartoon Is The Best Version Of The Story (&#38; 5 Why It's The Comics)</a></span></p><p>Of course, Squidward is a mixed bag and unlike the genuinely well-meaning but clueless SpongeBob, he's more agenda-driven. As a result, he's done a lot of deeds both good and bad-- mostly the latter, showing his egocentric and elitist side. Still, deep down, Squidward is a good guy, he just doesn't want to show it because of his pride. Here are five examples of each extreme of Squidward's moral spectrum.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>SECRETLY GOOD: GENUINE CONCERN FOR SPONGEBOB</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Spongebob-and-Squidward-wallpaper-spongebob-squarepants-40591291-1920-1080.jpg' /></figure><p>This one's certainly not a secret to the viewers and is generally a known quality of Squidward due to how often he shows it. At the bottom of his inky heart, Squidward actually cares for SpongeBob– enough to stand up for him and even fight for his rights.</p><p>This is especially noticeable when Mr. Krabs sold SpongeBob for 62 cents and Squidward got angry. There was also that one time where Squidward smacked a pizza at a customer's face after they berated SpongeBob. The list goes on to show just how Squidward secretly acts as a true friend to SpongeBob.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>THE WORST: KICKING OUT A HOMELESS SpongeBob</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-eyes.jpg' /></figure><p>Too bad Squidward can't maintain the momentum of being nice to SpongeBob as his more sociopathic nature gets the best of him. When SpongeBob's pineapple house gets destroyed, he tried to bunk up with Squidward only to get kicked out in the middle of the night right into the cold ocean floor.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spongebob-squarepants-battle-bikini-bottom-primer/\">SpongeBob: Everything You Need to Know About Battle for Bikini Bottom</a></span></p></p><p>What's even more heartbreaking for SpongeBob is that he did the opposite for Squidward and even sheltered the cephalopod when he became homeless after quitting Krusty Krab. Goes to show just how destructively cynical and remorseless Squidward can get.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>SECRETLY GOOD: HANDSOME SQUIDWARD REVERSAL</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Two-Faces-of-Squidward-24.jpg' /></figure><p>Squidward becoming handsome was a huge deal for him especially since he's an artist. He quickly got the attention he wanted and even became a sensation with his music despite being a mediocre clarinet player. He soon discovered that not all that glitters is gold and life as a handsome creature can be taxing.</p><p>This was a humbling lesson for Squidward and he quickly wanted to revert back to his old self. He was even happy when it happened and didn't seem to regret what he had lost, which displays just how content he is with his regular appearance. Needless to say, he's happier with not being shallow or superficial. His heart's in the right place with that one.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>THE WORST: VIOLENT APRIL FOOLS PRANK</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/April-fools-squidward.jpg' /></figure><p>There's no doubt that Squidward is the most neurotic character in <em>SpongeBob Squarepants</em>. He's quick to anger &#38; annoy and is also prone to mental breakdowns. That's why he went overboard with one April Fools prank for SpongeBob.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/adventure-time-best-quotes/\">Adventure Time: 10 Of The Most Relatable Quotes from the Beloved Cartoon</a></span></p></p><p>It was a rather overkill prank that involved injuring SpongeBob and humiliating him several times over in front of Bikini Bottom. Sure, it might have been SpongeBob's plan all along, but there's no denying that Squidward's schadenfreude humor is in poor taste.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>SECRETLY GOOD: TOLERANCE FOR NONSENSE</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Spongebob-Squarepants-Squidward-feature.jpg' /></figure><p>Despite the neuroticism and his annoyance with SpongeBob and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/patrick-star-vs-sandy-cheeks-spongebob-real-best-friend/\">Patrick's shenanigans</a> or even with Mr. Krabs' unfair treatment, Squidward deserves a world record award for patience. He puts up with Bikini Bottom's nonsense every single day of his life.</p><p>It's even more impressive when one considers his location, he's practically stuck between two riots (SpongeBob and Patrick's houses). Yet, there were only a couple of episodes where he tried to move out. The rest of the series, he stayed and endured.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>THE WORST: RUINING A FRIENDSHIP</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-concern.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the worst things about being neighbors with two uber-optimistic dorks is the noise they create when they're having fun. Too bad Squidward cannot stand this cacophony of happiness because of his sad life, so he had to share his negativity to the world.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cartoons-childhood-romances-best/\">10 Best Romances From Childhood Cartoons</a></span></p></p><p>He did this <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cartoon-characters-most-destructive-ever/\">most destructively</a> when he ruined SpongeBob and Patrick's friendship in one episode. It was a surprisingly effective action and the two despised each other quickly all because Squidward can't stand their joy. Thankfully, it backfired against Squidward.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>SECRETLY GOOD: FORGIVING NATURE</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/squidward.jpg' /></figure><p>One would think that Squidward, neurotic as he is, would hold a grudge against most citizens of Bikini Bottom after being the whole town's figurative punching bag. However, he holds no such ill-intent and grievance towards SpongeBob, Patrick, or Mr. Krabs.</p><p>He might have some slight resentment but the stuff he's been through because of them would have filled a regular person with hatred. Instead, Squidward seems to have forgiven most of their missteps towards him. He moves on in life and goes through each episode only to get slighted or ridiculed as the cycle continues.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>THE WORST: MOOCHING OFF SPONGEBOB</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-bum.jpg' /></figure><p>The rock bottom for Squidward was when he resigned from Krusty Krab and hoped to become a football-playing king in space. Except that didn't happen and he instead became a vagrant with no practical or professional skills. So SpongeBob, being a good friend, took him in and cared for him until he found a job.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/gi-joe-original-cartoon-best-reasons-comics-better/\">5 Reasons Why The Original G.I. Joe Cartoon Is The Best Version Of The Story (&#38; 5 Why It's The Comics)</a></span></p></p><p>Except Squidward never found a job and quickly descended into an ungrateful bum who took advantage of SpongeBob's kindness and generosity. He even went as far as enslaving SpongeBob in his own house. Even SpongeBob noticed this and didn't put up with it for it too long.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>SECRETLY GOOD: PRETENDING TO BE SANTA CLAUS</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-Santa.jpg' /></figure><p>As for Squidward's most noble deed of unrecognized kindness? Being Santa Claus. It was Squidward at his nicest where he gave away everything dear to him (mostly house furnishings) just to complete SpongeBob and Bikini Bottom's first Christmas.</p><p>Since he pretended to be Santa, all credit went to the plump pensioner and it was a mostly thankless act of goodwill from Squidward. Oddly enough, a hiding Santa was there all along and let it all happen, but he did voice out his gratitude to Squidward as a compensation of sorts.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>THE WORST: NEARLY KILLED GARY</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/I-Was-a-Teenage-Gary-076.jpg' /></figure><p>Finally, we see Squidward at his worst when he got an important responsibility thrust upon him by SpongeBob. All Squidward had to do was feed Gary for three days but he didn't because he prioritized his sunbathing. As a result, Gary became sick and was probably close to death by starvation by the time SpongeBob came home. At the very least, Squidward had karmic judgment handed to him quickly by the end of that episode.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-cartoon-cosplays/\">10 Cartoon Cosplays You Have To See To Believe</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 02:00:52 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Good-Squidward-bad-Squidward.jpg","linkMd5":"3a4315f46fb4af73af69b7f806ef7007","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn84@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-717_b4a8308fa5540418.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":110912,"destBytes":110912,"author":"Sid Natividad","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Good-Squidward-bad-Squidward.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn84@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-717_b4a8308fa5540418.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Spongebob-and-Squidward-wallpaper-spongebob-squarepants-40591291-1920-1080.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn58@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-42-946_08253995a719ea65.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-eyes.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn58@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-34-073_ac0611d566e88343.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Two-Faces-of-Squidward-24.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn32@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-35-267_3b48267b93842a14.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/April-fools-squidward.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn85@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-38-398_e66a8adf9c80956b.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Spongebob-Squarepants-Squidward-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn20@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-35-689_3dfe327012bb91be.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-concern.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn39@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-35-853_0f52b2bc529b0223.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/squidward.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn81@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-41-655_a3199f7e18f7047e.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-bum.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn90@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-37-903_32ed899b91821894.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Squidward-Santa.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn10@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-34-027_7fe7f87b96991bed.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/I-Was-a-Teenage-Gary-076.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn74@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-43-068_754064e5abbd64f8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989062},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"REVIEW: Archer's Season 11 Is a Disappointing Step Backward | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/archer-season-11-review/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>For the past three seasons, both <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/archer/\"><em>Archer</em></a> the show and Archer the character have been in a fantasy world. When self-involved superspy Sterling Archer (voiced by H. Jon Benjamin) slipped into a coma at the end of the series’ seventh season, creator Adam Reed took that as an opportunity to escape from the continuity and the sometimes repetitive storytelling that the show had built up, and reinvent the characters and the setting in different genres and time periods for each new season.</p><p>Archer and his entire supporting cast became the players in a noir-style detective story, a pulpy adventure serial, and a far-future space adventure. Sometimes the characters closely resembled their previous incarnations, but not always. It gave Reed and his collaborators the creative freedom to essentially create entire new shows while holding onto <em>Archer</em>’s talented voice cast and devoted fan base.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/archer-season-11-information-guide/\">Archer Season 11: Trailer, Plot, Release Date &#38; News to Know</a></span></p><p>However, some among that devoted fan base grew increasingly frustrated with the lack of answers about what was happening to the “real” Archer and his compatriots, and so at the end of the Season 10, Archer woke up from his coma, returning to the world he (and the audience) had previously known. It’s no coincidence that <em>Archer</em>’s return to the show’s old format comes as Reed has further stepped back from his duties on the show, although he approved the new direction. Whereas in prior seasons, Reed would write or co-write all of the episodes, he only wrote half of  Season 19, and in the new outing, he’s only writing a single episode. This leaves the show with a sense of falling back on what worked before, on imitating Reed’s distinctive voice rather than exploring something new.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-pam.jpg\"/></figure><p>Granted, very few shows remain creatively vibrant so far into their runs, and it’s hard to blame the creators for <em>Archer</em> not being as fresh and exciting as it was a decade ago. The fantasy seasons were frequently uneven, full of funny moments that never quite came together into a satisfying story, and the new season is similarly hit-and-miss. There are still big laughs in all of the four episodes available for review (out of eight total for the season), and the characters and performances are so well-defined at this point that it’s a pleasure just to spend time with them again. But the world that Archer returns to is very, very familiar, even though it’s been tweaked slightly from the one he left several years ago.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/archer-first-season-11-teaser/\">Archer Adjusts to Post-Coma Life in First Season 11 Teaser</a></span></p><p>He’s still working for an independent spy agency run by his mother Malory (Jessica Walter), with the same dysfunctional set of colleagues, although they’ve become slightly more functional in Archer’s absence. The first episode of the season opens with a propulsive heist and chase sequence set to Judas Priest’s “You’ve Got Another Thing Comin’,” in which the team works together effortlessly. Two of them are in masks as they run from bad guys, and one reveals herself as Lana Kane (Aisha Tyler), Archer’s former lover and frequent rival, and it seems likely that the other will be Archer himself, back in action. But instead it turns out to be Archer’s dorky colleague Cyril Figgis (Chris Parnell), who is now respected and in control. That’s when the team gets the call that Archer has woken from his three-year coma.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-release.jpg\"/></figure><p>The main thematic resonance of the season is Archer’s feeling that time has passed him by. He’s welcomed back only reluctantly, despite his eagerness to return to duty and take his place as the world’s greatest spy. Over the course of the pre-coma seasons, the show had built up some surprisingly poignant character development, mainly for Archer and Lana, and the new season sporadically returns to that while also settling back into old rhythms. Archer’s newfound outsider status makes him more aggressively annoying, and it feels like a regression in his personality rather than a step forward. Most of the time, he just does exactly what he used to do, while the supporting characters yell at him.</p><p>Plot-wise, the show returns to episodic spy missions, including a <em>Bloodsport</em>-style underground martial arts tournament and a sting operation to stop an art thief. Some longtime recurring characters return, and there are plenty of callbacks to long-running jokes. The show has always excelled at complex wordplay, and the writers on this season continue that strength, which the voice actors carry off flawlessly as usual. Guest voices in the first four episodes include Jamie Lee Curtis, Bowen Yang and Stephen Tobolowsky, all of whom bring some extra flair to their roles. The animation, which has become increasingly sophisticated over the years, is immersive without losing the simple charm of the character design, and there are some impressively designed set pieces.</p><p>And yet it’s all disappointingly recycled and rote. Like Archer himself, going through the motions of his old life even though he’s not really capable of his former athleticism (he walks with a high-tech cane), the show tries to return to a glory that’s long since passed. Some fans may be happy to revisit the world that they grew to love in the show’s early seasons, but it’s not something that can easily be recreated. The fantasy settings were sometimes ridiculous, but at least they tried something new. “This all feels pretty coma-y,” Archer says in the fourth episode as the team embarks on its latest crazy mission. It’s a shame he’s not right about that.</p><p><em>Starring the voices of H. Jon Benjamin, Aisha Tyler, Chris Parnell, Judy Greer, Amber Nash, Lucky Yates and Jessica Walter, the 11th season of Archer premieres Sept. 16 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on FXX.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/this-archer-theory-explain-the-series-weirdest-elements/\">This Archer Theory May Explain the Series' WEIRDEST Elements</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 20:45:53 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-header.jpg","linkMd5":"84c626d6b5bdd130b5d34786acd73ddf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn80@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-594_d48d1a5cdaf5e70a.webp","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":960,"sourceBytes":120244,"destBytes":120244,"author":"Josh Bell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn80@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-31-594_d48d1a5cdaf5e70a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-pam.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn94@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-43-173_fc73329b4a291503.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/archer-season-11-release.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn64@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-38-244_53e59e59912fb757.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989070},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Naruto: The 15 Most Shocking Deaths In The Series, Ranked | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-worst-harshest-most-shocking-brutal-sudden-deaths-kills-ever/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/naruto.jpg\"/></figure><p>Masashi Kishimoto, the creator of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/naruto/\"><em>Naruto</em></a>, has never been shy of killing off characters in his series. In fact, where other mangaka shy away from killing off their characters, Kishimoto often does it because <em>Naruto</em> is much darker than some other stories out there.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"5 Designs That Improved From Naruto To Boruto (&#38; 5 That Got Worse)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boruto-designs-improved-worse-naruto/\">5 Designs That Improved From Naruto To Boruto (&#38; 5 That Got Worse)</a></span></p><p>Over time, we've had to deal with lots of deaths in <em>Naruto</em> with nearly all of them being painful, to say the least. Although there are more than just 10 shocking deaths in this series, we've tried to pick the 10 most startling ones that we've seen to date. Here are the 10 most shocking deaths that we've seen in <em>Naruto</em>.</p><p><strong><em>Updated on September 4th, 2020 by Josh Davison: </em></strong><em>Despite the series being over, Naruto continues to be one of the most popular and widely discussed anime in the world. Some of this is thanks to the continuation through <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/boruto/\">Boruto</a>, but Naruto keeps getting a bulk of the attention regardless of what's going on in Boruto right now. One of the things that made Naruto a compelling anime is the fact that characters could and, frequently, would die. Characters that were well-rounded and fully established would get wiped out in oftentimes grisly fashions. With that in mind, five more entries have been added to the list to spotlight more shocking deaths from Naruto.</em></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">15 </span>Shikaku Nara And Inoichi Yamanaka</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Naruto-Shikaku.jpg' /></figure><p>Shikaku and Inoichi were of the generation of shinobi that came before Naruto's, and they had become renowned for their teamwork as two-thirds of the Ino-Shika-Cho trio of that generation. However, their position in the series didn't make them bulletproof.</p><p>Their deaths still came as a bit of a shock. They were helping coordinate the Allied Shinobi Forces in the Fourth Great Ninja War until the Ten-Tailed Beast realized where they were communicating plans from. The Ten-Tails launched an attack at their headquarters, and Shikaku and Inoichi both knew they didn't have time to make a getaway. So, they sent out final orders, said farewell to their children, and accepted their fates.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">14 </span>Zabuza Momochi (Resurrected)</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Zabuza-Edo-Tensei-Cropped.png' /></figure><p>Zabuza Momochi was the first main antagonist of <em>Naruto </em>and died at the end of the \"Land of Waves\" arc. However, both Zabuza and his protege, Haku, were resurrected by Kabuto's Edo Tensei jutsu. Neither Zabuza nor Haku were in control of their actions at this point, and they made it known to their foes, Kakashi and Might Guy, that they were at peace and wanted to return.</p><p>This, along with Zabuza's genuine concern and respect for Kakashi, Naruto, and the rest of Team 7, is what made Zabuza's second death shocking. One would think that he would have a grudge against Team 7 over the circumstances of his own demise, but he instead showed concern for them and even happiness in learning that Naruto was living a good life.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">13 </span>Shishui Uchiha</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/shisui-death.jpg' /></figure><p>Shisui Uchiha died years before the events of <em>Naruto. </em>He was close friends with Itachi Uchiha, and he was one of the few Uchiha completely against the planned coup against Konoha. He had one of his Sharingan Eyes stolen by Danzo, who later pushed for Itachi to wipe out the Uchiha.</p><p>In the end, Shishui couldn't handle what was becoming of the Uchiha Clan. He gave his Mangekyo Sharingan to Itachi, and Shishui took his own life. In this case, it's more the manner of Shisui's death than the actual occurrence that made it so shocking. It was tragic and downright heartbreaking.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">12 </span>Kimmimaro Kaguya</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/kimimaro-cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Kimmimaro Kaguya was one of Orochimaru's most powerful followers at the time, and he was the head of the Sound Five. When Sasuke fled Konoha to learn from Orochimaru, Kimmimaro helped ensure that Sasuke would be able to make his journey without being taken back home. This lead to Kimmimaro facing down Rock Lee and Gaara of the Sand.</p><p>Kimmimaro's Kekkei Genkai made him an immensely powerful foe, and the audience learns of Kimmimaro's tragic backstory, including his fatal congenital disease. Despite that, it looked like he was going to kill Gaara and Rock Lee until that disease killed Kimmimaro right before he could land the killing blow.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">11 </span>Gaara Of The Sand</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Gaara-Kazekage-One-Tail-Jinchu--riki.jpg' /></figure><p>Gaara's death came at the beginning of <em>Naruto: Shippuden</em> after he was kidnapped by Deidara and Sasori of the Akatsuki. They extracted the One-Tailed Shukaku from Gaara, and the process killed him.</p><p>This was shocking, as so much had gone into showing Gaara's reform. Plus, he was the Kazekage of the Hidden Sand Village now, and he was a fan-favorite. Of course, the audience knows now that the death didn't last. Chiyo, another shinobi from the Sand Village, gave her life to heal Gaara and bring him back from the dead.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Kakashi Hatake</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kakashi-Hatake-and-his-father-from-Naruto-Shippuuden.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most popular characters in the entire <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-rock-lee-vs-jjba-characters/\"><em>Naruto</em></a> series, Kakashi Hatake was met with the cruel fate of death during the Pain arc. With Deva Path showing up in search of Naruto, it was up to Kakashi to stop him, and he nearly pulled it off. However, Kakashi fell short and ended up paying with his life.</p><p>Thankfully for the fans, he was reanimated towards the end of the arc when Nagato Uzumaki used the Rinne Rebirth technique, otherwise, he would've been a lot higher up the list.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Haku</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Naruto-Haku.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the first few characters to die in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-characters-potential-surpass-naruto-sasuke-who-can-never/\"><em>Naruto</em></a>, Haku fought against Team 7 during the battle of Tazuna's Bridge. While fighting against Naruto, he foresaw the danger that Kakashi posed to Zabuza, his benefactor.</p><p>Throwing his body in harm's way, Haku died a premature death despite being only a child, shocking most of the fans and giving them a taste of what <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-rock-lee-fan-art-limit/\"><em>Naruto</em></a> was all about at the same time. Although Haku was reanimated in the series, later on, he faced the same fate of getting pierced by Kakashi's Raikiri.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Konan</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Naruto-Konan.jpg' /></figure><p>After having left the Akatsuki for good, nobody expected Konan to appear in the story for quite some time. However, Obito saw to it that Konan was disposed of right away. The two engaged in a fight in which Konan emerged victorious and successfully managed to kill Obito, only for him to use Izanagi and take her by surprise.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Naruto: 5 Heroes Of The 4th Great Ninja War (&#38; 5 Villains)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-heroes-villains-4th-great-ninja/\">Naruto: 5 Heroes Of The 4th Great Ninja War (&#38; 5 Villains)</a></span></p><p>Not only did Obito surprise Konan but the entire fandom as well. Konan ended up dying in an excruciatingly painful manner while Obito proceeded to take Nagato's Rinnegan and use it for his own good.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Hiruzen Sarutobi</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hiruzen-Sarutobi.jpg' /></figure><p>The death of the Third Hokage of Konoha remains to be one of the most shocking ones we've seen in the series. This is largely because nobody expected the Chunin Exams to turn into a mess where Orochimaru fought against the Third. With a powerful barrier erected by the Sound Four, it was either do or die or Hiruzen Sarutobi.</p><p>He ended up dying, but he took away Orochimaru's arms with him in the process. The death of Hiruzen Sarutobi marked the end of an era for Konoha and left the village reeling as they lacked a proper leader until quite some time.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Asuma Sarutobi</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Naruto-Asuma.jpg' /></figure><p>One of Konohagakure's elite Jonin, Asuma Sarutobi met his demise during the Hidan and Kakuzu arc of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shonen-jump-anime-areas-wrong-better/\"><em>Naruto Shippuden</em></a>. With Team 10 stepping into action after a long time, hardly anyone could've seen Asuma's death coming. The entire fandom was taken by surprise when Hidan actually managed to kill him as not only was he the leader of Team 10 but also the son of the former Hokage.</p><p>Asuma's death was crucial to the development of his students, however. Shikamaru, Choji, and Ino pulled through and saw to it that their teacher was avenged by the end of the arc, thanks to help from Kakashi Hatake and Naruto Uzumaki.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Madara Uchiha</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Uchiha-Madara-from-Naruto-Shippuuden.jpg' /></figure><p>Madara Uchiha was one of the main antagonists of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-times-hated-kakashi-loved/\"><em>Naruto</em></a> who ended up dying in the Fourth Great Ninja War. Although being an antagonist means you'll die most of the time, Madara's death was shocking in every way.</p><p>Right when the Uchiha was at the peak of his powers, Zetsu struck and turned him into a vessel for Kaguya Otsutsuki. With Kaguya's defeat, Madara Uchiha was released from her grasp and he went on to die alongside the other reanimated shinobi from his era, such as his war buddy Hashirama Senju.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Obito Uchiha</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Naruto-Obito.jpg' /></figure><p>Just like Madara, Obito's death was rather strange. After having a change of heart, thanks to Naruto Uzumaki, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-martial-arts-fighting-styles-inspiration/\">Obito could fight right until the end</a> and help Kakashi build a new era after the war. Surprisingly, he wasn't given the opportunity as he ended up dying at the hands of Kaguya Otsutsuki towards the end of the Ninja War.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Naruto: 5 Reasons Jiraiya Should Have Been Hokage (&#38; 5 Why He Shouldn't Have Been)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-jiraiya-should-hokage-reasons/\">Naruto: 5 Reasons Jiraiya Should Have Been Hokage (&#38; 5 Why He Shouldn't Have Been)</a></span></p><p>To Obito, the act of shielding <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-obito-fan-art-amazing/\"><em>Naruto</em></a> with his body was like an act of redemption. However, as fans, we were left with a bitter taste in our mouths. Truly, Kishimoto left all of us shocked with the sudden death of Obito Uchiha.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Itachi Uchiha</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/itachi.jpg' /></figure><p>Yes, everyone knew right from the beginning that Itachi Uchiha had to die. He was the detestable elder brother of Sasuke who murdered their entire clan. With that being said, Itachi's death came as shock to the fans as Sasuke had well and truly lost the battle.</p><p>With the revelation of how Itachi actually intended for this to happen, his death got an even bigger meaning, and to date, it leaves the fans shaking when it is mentioned.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Neji Hyuga</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Neji.jpg' /></figure><p>Neji's death is unarguably one of the most shocking ones we've seen in the series to date. The Hyuga prodigy ended up dying in the Fourth Great Ninja War while trying to shield Hinata Hyuga from the Ten-Tails' attack.</p><p>Never in a million years did any fan see this coming, but at the end of the day, Neji lay dead in a pool of blood. Needless to say, this was probably the most forced death we've seen in the series as the reason behind it was to strengthen the bond of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-obito-monster-should-be-redeemed-hero-villain/\">Naruto</a> and Hinata.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Jiraiya</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/jiraiya.jpg' /></figure><p>As expected, <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/naruto-things-that-havent-aged-well/\">Jiraiya's death</a> is the most surprising death that we've seen in <em>Naruto</em>. Hints about his death were dropped right from when he left Konoha on a dangerous mission but nobody believed that Kishimoto would actually have the gall to kill off Jiraiya.</p><p>Well, as it turns out, he did. Jiraiya met his end at the hands of his student, Nagato Uzumaki. His death left visible scars on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-anime-characters-life-harder-easier/\">Naruto</a> Uzumaki. However, he learned from it and made sure to do what Jiraiya would've wanted him to do.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Naruto: 10 Chilling Pieces Of Danzo Fan Art You Have To See\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/naruto-danzo-best-fan-art/\">Naruto: 10 Chilling Pieces Of Danzo Fan Art You Have To See</a></span></p>\n                        \n 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Cuties Director Received Death Threats Over Netflix's Poster Release","link":"https://www.cbr.com/cuties-director-death-threats-netflix-poster-release/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CUTIES-TITLE.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"http://www.cbr.com/tag/netflix\">Netflix</a> released a controversial poster for the release of Maïmouna Doucouré's award-winning film, <em>Cuties</em>. That poster quickly became the subject of intense criticism for its <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-apologizes-poster-sexualizing-child-stars-movie-cuties/\">apparent sexualization of children</a>. However, the streaming giant was not the only target of angered audiences.</p><p>In an interview with <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/cuties-director-death-threats-netflix-poster-backlash-ted-sarandos-called-apologize-1234569783/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a>, Doucouré revealed that she had personally received a number of messages following the poster's release, which is how she discovered the controversy surrounding her film in America. \"Things happened fairly quickly because, after the delays, I was completely concentrating on the film's release in France,\" Doucouré explained. \"I discovered the poster as [sic] the same time as the American public.\" She then went on to state, \"I hadn't seen the poster until after I started getting all these reactions on social media, direct messages from people, attacks on me.\" She continued, \"I didn't understand what was going on. That was when I went and saw what the poster looked like.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-watch-free-site-bird-box-stranger-things/\">Netflix Launches 'Watch Free' Site With Bird Box, Episodes of Stranger Things and More</a></span></p><p>According to the filmmaker, she and her film were criticized by those who had not seen <em>Cuties</em>. \"I received numerous attacks on my character from people who had not seen the film, who thought I was actually making a film that was apologetic about hypersexualiation of children... I also received numerous death threats.\"</p><p>However, Doucouré went on to add that she received messages of support as well, especially after the initial wave of hostile messages subsided. She then expressed her own thoughts on the controversial poster, stating outright that it is not representative of the film she has made or its underlying message. She then revealed that Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos personally reached out to apologize for the marketing mistake.</p><p><em>Cuties</em> will premiere on the streaming service on Sept. 9.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/three-body-problem-game-of-thrones-creators-netflix-adaptation/\">The Three-Body Problem: Game of Thrones Creators Board Netflix Adaptation</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 19:39:40 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CUTIES-TITLE.jpg","linkMd5":"55bfd2f26df709fcb29319fabed754eb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn90@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-201_c9c7ae54c3c9d087.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":40086,"destBytes":40086,"author":"Narayan Liu","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/CUTIES-TITLE.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn90@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-30-201_c9c7ae54c3c9d087.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989073},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The Boys Season 2 Reveals Why Homelander Didn't Kill Billy Butcher","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-why-homelander-didnt-kill-billy-butcher/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/homelander-trailer-e1581535099154.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following article contains major spoilers for the first three episodes of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-boys-tv/\">The Boys</a> Season 2, available now on Amazon Prime Video.</strong></em></p><p>At the end of <em>The Boys </em>Season 1, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-season-1-billy-butcher-recap/\">Billy Butcher</a> took <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-vought-propaganda-ad-season-2/\">Vought International</a> Senior Vice President of Hero Management Madelyn Stillwell hostage so as to lure out and kill Homelander as revenge for the apparent death of his wife, Becca Butcher. However, prior to their confrontation, Homelander learned that Becca was not dead, and that she had given birth to his son. Enraged at having been lied to, Homelander burned out Stillwell's eyes, killing her. Billy then tried to blow the two up, but this didn't kill Homelander.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-jeffrey-dean-morgan-season-3-covid-19/\">The Boys: Jeffrey Dean Morgan's Season 3 Role May Not Happen Due to COVID-19</a></span></p><p>At the end of Season 1, Homelander brought Billy to Becca's house, revealing to him that she'd survived. Considering Homelander's penchant for violence, it initially seemed somewhat odd that he would let Billy go. However, the first three episodes of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/boys-season-2-certified-fresh-rotten-tomatoes/\"><em>The Boys </em>Season 2</a> explains why Homelander didn't kill Billy.</p><p>In <em>The Boys </em>Season 2's first three episodes, Homelander regularly visits Becca and Ryan, his son. This makes Becca incredibly uncomfortable, though, as Homelander wants to insert himself in his son's life and help the boy see himself as more than human. During a fight about the superhero's behavior, Homelander makes clear to Becca that he let Billy go because she made access to Ryan conditional on her husband's survival.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-why-homelander-threatened-stormfront/\">The Boys: The Reason Why Homelander Is Threatened by Stormfront's Arrival</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Becca-Butcher-1.png\"/></figure><p>The second episode of <em>The Boys </em>Season 2 also reveals what happened to Billy directly after the finale. Following the initial confrontation at Becca and Ryan's house at the end of Season 1, Homelander dropped Billy off outside of a Tony Cicero's, and Billy rushed inside to make notes about everything he could remember. While inside, a news cast revealed Billy was wanted in connection with the murder of Stillwell, forcing him to flee. However, he still intends to find and liberate Becca, using any means at his disposal to achieve his goal.</p><p>The explanation given in the show isn't necessarily complete, as Becca would have no way of actually knowing Billy survived. Plus, Homelander would pretty easily be able to just force his way into his son's life. However, Homelander is tremendously arrogant, which is at least partially why he let Billy go. The leader of the Seven certainly doesn't believe that a powerless man is at all capable of taking him down, and Billy's credibility is gone following claims that he killed Stillwell. As such, Homelander likely doesn't believe Billy is in any way a threat. Billy, though, is tenacious, and he's willing to do anything to get Becca back, so Homelander might have grossly underestimated his opponent this time around.</p><p><em>Amazon Studios' <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/the-boys-season-2-3-comic-stories/amp/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Boys</a> stars Karl Urban as Billy Butcher, Jack Quaid as Hughie, Laz Alonso as Mother's Milk, Tomer Kapon as Frenchie, Karen Fukuhara as the Female, Erin Moriarty as Annie January, Chace Crawford as the Deep, Antony Starr as Homelander, Aya Cash as Stormfront and Simon Pegg as Hughie's dad. New episodes of Season 2 release Fridays on Amazon Prime Video.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-billy-butcher-baby-laser-tag-ar-game/\">The Boys Lets You Channel Billy Butcher With Baby Laser Tag AR Game</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:45:46 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/homelander-trailer-e1581535099154.jpg","linkMd5":"3bf86ac152f873e45048807b606cf144","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn45@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-249_79a49df40fab80e7.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":41870,"destBytes":41870,"author":"Liam Nolan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/homelander-trailer-e1581535099154.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn45@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-249_79a49df40fab80e7.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Becca-Butcher-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn79@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-43-839_2913fa53bb793166.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989067},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Dragon Ball Super: Every Member Of The Frieza Force, By Order Of Rank","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-frieza-force-every-member-by-rank/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dbsff-fi.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Frieza’s legacy within </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is hard to ignore. Alluded to at the end of the Saiyan arc, Frieza very quickly became </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-z\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s most iconic villain once the Dragon Team landed on Namek. It took everything tha main cast had just to fight through Frieza’s army. By the time the final battle had begun, the main cast’s war of attrition turned into an endurance match unlike any other– one the heroes come dangerously close to losing more than once.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-vegeta-changed-between-saiyan-buu-arcs/\">Dragon Ball Z: 10 Ways Vegeta Changed Between The Saiyan &#38; Majin Buu Arcs</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With Frieza reintroduced into </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-super\">Dragon Ball Super</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, it comes as no surprise that he’s brought his personal army with him– or what few remnants there are. The Frieza Force is a shell of its former self in modern </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, but the end of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">DBS: Broly </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">suggests that Frieza’s second modern return will be far more substantial than </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Resurrection F </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">ultimately was. </span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Cheelai</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cheelai.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Introduced in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super: Broly</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> as part of the film’s core trio, Cheelai immediately sympathizes with Broly’s plight. Low on the Frieza Force hierarchy, Cheelai only joined the Force after stealing a Galactic Patrolman’s ship, instantly making it clear that she’s not a part of the army for any nefarious purposes. Besides robbery, of course, but that’s nothing compared to Frieza’s love of genocide.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After seeing that Broly has been manipulated and abused over the course of the film, Cheelai defects from the Frieza Force, steals the Dragon Balls out from underneath Frieza’s nose, and saves Broly from a Gogeta very much prepared to kill him. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Lemo</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/broly-and-cheelai.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Unlike Cheelai, Lemo has been a member of the Frieza Force since before Frieza’s defeat on Namek in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Z</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Lemo’s also seen active duty, seemingly only coincidentally missing a draft to Namek. All the same, Lemo isn’t all that strong and likely only ever saw combat in the lightest of scenarios. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/questions-dragon-ball-timeline-answered/\">10 Questions About The Dragon Ball Timeline, Answered</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As a result, Lemo isn’t as harderend or as cruel as the other members of the Frieza Force, even sympathizing with Broly alongside Cheelai. Lemo accompanies Cheelai in stealing the Dragon Balls at the end of the film, choosing to stay on Vampa with her and Broly when all is said &#38; done. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Tagoma</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/DBZ-tagoma-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tagoma is an interesting cast as </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s adaptation of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Resurrection F </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">handled the character fairly differently than in its source material. In the film, Tagoma is around on Zarbon’s level and is immediately killed by Frieza upon his revival. In the anime, however, Tagoma becomes Frieza’s personal sparring partner. Tagoma becomes stronger alongside Frieza before swapping bodies with Ginyu. From there, Tagoma-Ginyu is killed by Vegeta. It’s debatable which fate is ultimately worse for Tagoma. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Shisami</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/DBZ-Shisami-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Resurrection F</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s biggest problems is introducing a whole new Frieza Force to accompany the recently revived Frieza, but it’s handled very sloppily. Like Tagoma, Shisami doesn’t amount to much of anything in either medium. In the film, he stalemates Piccolo before being effortlessly defeated by Gohan. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-original-series-arcs-ranked-by-ending/\">Dragon Ball: Every Arc In The Original Series Ranked By Their Ending</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the anime, Shisami is shot in the back by Tagoma and killed without so much as a proper moment. Considering Frieza had Shisami fighting on the frontlines in the film, though, it’s safe to say he’s of a higher rank than Tagoma. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Sorbet</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Sorbet-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Sorbet is left in charge of the Planet Trade Organization following Frieza’s death, suggesting he must be fairly high up on the Frieza Force hierarchy to inherit the organization. More importantly, Sorbet has managed to keep the Frieza Force in check following their leader’s death– no easy feat without Frieza to unite them in fear. Sorbet plays an instrumental role in helping take down Goku at the end of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Resurrection F</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, but he’s killed unceremoniously like the rest of Frieza’s infantrymen. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Kikono</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kikono.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Kikono is an interesting character. Appearing in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Minus </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">to warn Frieza of the legend of the Super Saiyan God, Kikono returned in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super: Broly </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">and made his first animated appearance. Kikono may just be a scientist in Frieza’s army, but he commands a certain level of respect. As per background material, Kikono is also the scientist who converted the Tuffle’s technology for Frieza’s army. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Berryblue</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Berryblue-and-Frieza.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It’s unclear what role exactly Berryblue plays in the new Frieza Force, but it’s clear she has a very extensive history with Frieza. Not only does Frieza respect Berryblue enough to let her run off a story about his childhood, she seems to offer him a great deal of advice that he actually considers. It certainly helps matters that Berryblue was Frieza’s personal nanny growing up, suggesting that some of Frieza’s personality might have been picked up from Berryblue. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Frieza</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Dragon-Ball-Golden-Frieza.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Frieza’s time in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">has been an interesting one and the end of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Broly </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">implies that Frieza won’t be going anywhere anytime soon. While Frieza’s first revival during </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Resurrection F </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">proved unsuccessful in the long run, his return at the end of the Tournament of Power had led into the character taking the spotlight again.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Although Frieza hasn’t been seen in the Moro arc, he served as the antagonist for </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super: Broly</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. As seen during one of the last scenes in the film, Frieza is expanding his army rapidly fast and once again taking part in intergalactic warfare.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-every-time-saiyan-lost-tail/\">Dragon Ball: Every Time A Saiyan Lost Their Tail (In Chronological Order)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:30:47 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dbsff-fi.jpg","linkMd5":"5d6ed649e582887f71a619ec99bd8fd3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn61@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-201_dd4a42f8358fec6f.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":108914,"destBytes":108914,"author":"Renan Fontes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dbsff-fi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn61@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-29-201_dd4a42f8358fec6f.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/cheelai.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn29@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-44-281_ef5c8e8431f917de.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/broly-and-cheelai.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn45@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-39-152_62ed9d663791f3bf.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/DBZ-tagoma-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn78@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-34-368_86a9315b5d1c4597.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/DBZ-Shisami-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn90@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-43-202_09a49fdb0d1d59ab.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Sorbet-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn4@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-39-357_c7232aa9a55f8493.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kikono.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn48@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-38-165_fcf3fbf3f1ceec5a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Berryblue-and-Frieza.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn98@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-37-845_de23ab87f51480fc.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Dragon-Ball-Golden-Frieza.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_6/2020/09/05/06-56-41-108_f13d1b865cebfcf6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989074},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"5 Reasons Why Superman Returns Is The Definitive Modern Superman Film (& 5 Why It’s Man Of Steel)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/superman-returns-vs-man-of-steel-better-movie/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Brandon-Routh-Henry-Cavill-Superman.jpg\"/></figure><p>Christopher Reeve was the onscreen Superman for a generation. His portrayal of the Man of Steel made audiences believe a man could fly and laid the groundwork for comic book cinematic adaptations for decades to come.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-best-villains-have-never-been-movie-ranked/\">Superman: 10 Best Villains That Have Never Been In A Movie, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Since Reeve’s <em>Superman</em> series ended, there have been two onscreen attempts to revitalize the character for a new generation: 2006’s<em> Superman Returns</em> and 2013’s <em>Man of Steel</em>.
