14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Tenet's Theatrical Run Will Be Longer Than Modern Movies Typically Get","link":"https://www.cbr.com/tenets-theatrical-run-longer-than-modern-movies/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Tenet-movie-release-July.jpg\"/></figure><p>According to WarnerMedia Studios &#38; Network head Ann Sarnoff, <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/tenet/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Tenet</a></em> will have a longer theatrical run than traditional modern blockbusters-- the intent being to allow audiences to gradually grow accustomed to returning to cinemas following health and safety concerns caused by the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.</p><p>\"We're using the old marathon-versus-sprint approach. We're in it for the long game,\" Sarnoff told to <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/film/news/tenet-warner-bros-ann-sarnoff-hbo-max-1234758694/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety</a>. \"It's so unprecedented to launch it this way. We're feeling good and waiting for some numbers to start coming in.\" She continued, \"We love this movie. We really thought it deserved to be on the big screen... We're very grateful for the fact that we have movie theaters back now. We're getting so much press that it's another layer of publicity that we are grateful for. We are hearing very good indicators from our research.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-imax-featurette-behind-scenes/\">Tenet IMAX Featurette Takes You Behind the Scenes of the Christopher Nolan Blockbuster</a></span></p><p>As the time between a movie's theatrical debut and home video premiere has shrunk over the years, so too has the amount of time blockbusters stay on the big screen. Whereas last year's <em>Spider-Man: Far From Home</em> only played at the domestic box office for 16 weeks, <em>E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial</em> in 1982 played for 52 consecutive weeks at the domestic box office.</p><p><em>Tenet</em> will be hoping for the longevity of those older blockbusters as it begins its domestic theatrical run without theaters open in states like New York. Estimates place <em>Tenet</em>'s opening weekend theater count between 2,750 and 3,000 locations.</p><p>Written and directed by Christopher Nolan, <em>Tenet</em> stars John David Washington, Robert Pattinson, Elizabeth Debicki, Kenneth Branaugh, Dimple Kapadia, Martin Donovan, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Himesh Patel, Clémence Poésy, Denzil Smith and Michael Caine. The film is now playing in theaters in select cities.</p><p>KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tenet-amc-reopen-70-percent-theaters-christopher-nolan-blockbuster/\">Tenet: AMC to Reopen 70% of US Theaters for Christopher Nolan's Blockbuster</a></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 21:38:26 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Tenet-movie-release-July.jpg","linkMd5":"3a140479fdb698b617d1611442c11f75","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn60@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-709_55125f07dadd4717.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":57956,"destBytes":57956,"author":"Douglas Laman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Tenet-movie-release-July.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn60@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-30-709_55125f07dadd4717.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Wolverine: Dracula's Attack Shows Logan How BRUTAL He Is | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-draculas-killing-spree/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wolverine.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wolverine/\">Wolverine</a> #5 by Benjamin Percy, Viktor Bogdanovic, Matthew Wilson, and VC's Cory Petit, on sale now</em></strong></p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men/\">X-Men</a> have a lot of enemies across the world at the moment, the development and growth of Krakoa putting them at odds with countless other forces from around the world. But now, one genuinely global threat has turned their attention to the mutants and even found a way to utilize one of Krakoa's greatest defenders to their advantage.</p><p>Wolverine just found out how brutal Dracula's new plans allow the growing Vampire Nation to be -- with a senseless series of murders and spreading of the vampiric curse just occurred despite his best efforts.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-captain-america-ice-nightmare/\">Wolverine Just Lived Through Captain America's Worst Nightmare</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wolverine-Vampires-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Dracula has always quietly been one of the Marvel Universes' most dangerous threats. He's battled the likes of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-marvel-empyre-heroes-back/\">Avengers</a> and the X-Men to a standstill and has forced Doctor Strange to act out of desperation to keep him at bay. Since gaining control of Chernobyl by faking a vampiric civil war and rallying the world's strongest vampires to him, Dracula has successfully begun a new Vampire Nation - and has even gained the ability to move through sunlight. This is thanks to a certain amount of Wolverine's blood, procured when Logan was lured into one Dracula's hidden bases in Paris.</p><p>Dracula has been lying in wait ever since, but he and his forces took the opportunity of Wolverine being frozen to gain more access to his blood. Draining the frozen Logan of more of his blood, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-and-amazing-friends-fought-dracula/\">Dracula</a> is able to give it to two of his followers, allowing them to power \"Bloodclocks\" for themselves. While Wolverine's blood is within the device, his healing factor will give the vampires the ability to venture into the day as well. While Dracula returns to his Vampire Nation, his two followers soon set about spreading the vampiric curse further through North America.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-black-white-blood-all-star-talent-black-white-tales/\">Wolverine: Black, White &#38; Blood Enlists All-Star Talent For Untold, Black And White Tales</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wolverine-Vampires-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>This includes catching a number of humans and converting the into vampires. Loading the infected into a shipping truck, the vampires then casually drive the truck into Minneapolis -- and open the doors wide. This allows a whole slew of infected humans to quickly spread through the city and presumably cause terror and create more vampires. On top of increasing the number of vampires present in the world, this also sets up a potential American stronghold for the Vampire Nation. It's a very straight-forward and simple plan, with seemingly no other intent than to sew chaos and create more vampires for the heroes to deal with.  The vampires are even quick to admit to Wolverine when he catches them that they had no intention of keeping Wolverine permanently, as doing so would draw the attention of every vampire.</p><p>Instead, they just wanted the time to sew chaos and the advantage of longer hours afforded by the Bloodclocks. Even though the vampires are killed in action, they were still able to see free a veritable horde of new vampires to roam through the city streets and cause more death and destruction. It's a brutally efficient plan from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dracula-tomb-resurrection-quick-magazine/\">Dracula</a> and his followers to cause chaos and add to their ranks - and a surprisingly effective one by all appearances. They've already infected a number of people by the time Wolverine is able to escape his icy prison. It forces Wolverine's hand and releases more and more vampires into the world. The only downside is that Wolverine is now on the hunt for the vampiric nation -- and is intended to start his search by finding the treacherous Omega Red.</p><p>KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-new-respect-marvel-franklin-richards/\">Wolverine Finds New Respect For Marvel's Most Powerful Mutant</a></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 04:20:22 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wolverine.jpg","linkMd5":"a52a30e79b67fe497d6df71be3a2eed3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn88@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-30-792_65bb7dc5f82c7347.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":167316,"destBytes":167316,"author":"Brandon Zachary","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/wolverine.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn88@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-30-792_65bb7dc5f82c7347.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wolverine-Vampires-2.jpg":null,"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Wolverine-Vampires-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn92@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-39-394_ecfc561a64f562c6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989060},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"John Ridley Explains Why The Other History of the DC Universe Begins With Black Lightning","link":"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-why-other-history-dc-universe-begins-black-lightning/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/other-history-dc-universe-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-other-history-of-the-dc-universe/\">The Other History of the DC Universe</a> promises to shed light on untold moments featuring DC's heroes of color. The first issue will focus on Black Lightning, and writer John Ridley revealed his personal history with the character made Jefferson Pierce the perfect hero to kick off the first issue.</p><p>\"So for me personally, when I was a kid Black Lightning was the first character of color that I was not only aware of [having], but in the DC Universe, that had his own series,\" Ridley told <a href=\"https://www.polygon.com/comics/2020/9/3/21408118/dc-comics-alternate-history-other-black-lightning-john-ridley-interview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Polygon</a>. \"And to have a character that looked like me, to have a character who was a teacher, like the way that my mother was a teacher; to have a character that, in his personal life, was just a teacher trying to make a difference, a street level hero, who initially had a power belt and then had his own powers? It was just a really interesting experience for me to finally have a hero that had something different about him. That was actually, for me, <i>not</i> different.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/john-ridley-other-history-of-the-dc-universe-black-label-series-release-date/\">John Ridley's The Other History of the DC Universe Black Label Series Announces Release Date</a></span></p><p>Ridley also said that although Green Lantern John Stewart was the first African American DC superhero, his personal connection to Jefferson Pierce won out. \"So, for me when it came time to do <i>The Other History</i>; yeah, John Stewart predated Jefferson Pierce, but there were things about Jefferson Pierce that were powerful to me when I first read the comics,\" he added. \"There were things about him as a father; as a guy who was, in some ways, maybe a little bit more conservative as a Black man, in terms of some of his values — that made him really interesting. So he felt like the absolute right character with which to begin this story.\"</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Other-History-Var-Cvr-Mockup.jpg\"/></figure><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Other-History-Cvr-Mockup-R1.jpg\"/></figure><ul><li>written by JOHN RIDLEY</li><li>art by GIUSEPPE CAMUNCOLI and ANDREA CUCCHI</li><li>cover by JAMAL CAMPBELL</li><li>cover by GIUSEPPE CAMUNCOLI and MARCO MASTRAZZO</li><li>1:25 variant cover by JAMAL CAMPBELL</li><li>PRESTIGE PLUS FORMAT</li><li>RESOLICIT | ON SALE 11/24/20</li><li>$6.99 US | 48 PAGES | 1 OF 5 | FC</li><li>8.5\" x 10.875\" | BIMONTHLY | NO ADS</li><li>DC BLACK LABEL | AGES 17+</li><li>Academy Award-winning screenwriter John Ridley (12 Years a Slave, Let It Fall) examines the mythology of the DC Universe in this compelling new miniseries that reframes iconic moments of DC history and charts a previously unexplored sociopolitical thread as seen through the prism of DC Super Heroes who come from traditionally disenfranchised groups.</li><li>This unique new series presents its story as prose by Ridley married with beautifully realized illustrations by Giuseppe Camuncoli and Andrea Cucchi. Issue #1 follows the story of Jefferson Pierce, the man who will one day become Black Lightning, as he makes his way from being a young track star to a teacher and, ultimately, to his role as a hero. Future issues focus on characters such as Karen and Mal Duncan, Tatsu Yamashiro, and Renee Montoya.</li><li>Extensively researched and masterfully executed, The Other History of the DC Universe promises to be an experience unlike any other. You may think you know the history of the DC Universe…but the truth is far more complex. The Other History of the DC Universe isn’t about saving the world—it’s about having the strength to simply be who you are.</li></ul><p><em>The Other History of the DC Universe</em> will be published under DC's Black Label imprint, and features art by Giuseppe Camuncoli and Andrea Cucchi. Other characters explored in the book include Renee Montoya, Katana, Bumblebee and Mal Duncan.</p><p><em>The Other History of the DC Universe</em> #1 goes on sale Nov. 24 from DC.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/other-history-of-the-dc-universe-first-details/\">John Ridley's Other History of the DC Universe Reveals First Details</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 21:14:30 Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/other-history-dc-universe-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn14@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-29-618_89e1314c3ad9524e.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Other-History-Var-Cvr-Mockup.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn80@2020_2/2020/09/05/06-56-37-205_55c8e0a84d4c23b5.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Other-History-Cvr-Mockup-R1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn62@2020_5/2020/09/05/06-56-42-212_7db517ed1b53bff0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989069},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Ray Fisher Says DC Films President Asked Him to Recant Accusations Against Geoff Johns","link":"https://www.cbr.com/ray-fisher-dc-films-president-recant-accusations-geoff-johns/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Fisher-Cyborg-Justice-League-Featured.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/justice-league-film\">Zack Snyder's Justice League</a> star Ray Fisher stated that DC Films President Walter Hamada asked him to recant his accusations that former DC Chief Creative Officer Geoff Johns fostered a toxic and abusive work environment.</p><p>\"So you can better understand how deep this goes: After speaking out about Justice League, I received a phone call from the President of DC Films wherein he attempted to throw Joss Whedon and Jon Berg under the bus in hopes that I would relent on Geoff Johns,\" Fisher posted on Twitter. \"I will not. A&#62;E\"</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/ray8fisher/status/1301949796081696769?s=19\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>Thus far, none of Fisher's co-stars have stepped up to affirm or debunk his statements against Johns, Whedon or Berg. Fisher previously accused <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-ray-fisher-accuses-geoff-johns-of-threatening-career/\">Johns of threatening his career</a>, which led to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-ray-fisher-says-whedon-johns-under-invesitgation/\">WarnerMedia opening an investigation</a> into the claims.</p><p>The official synopsis for <em>Zack Snyder's Justice League</em> can be found below.</p><blockquote><p>In Justice League, fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman’s selfless act, Bruce Wayne enlists the help of his newfound ally, Diana Prince, to face an even greater enemy. Together, Batman and Wonder Woman work quickly to find and recruit a team of metahumans to stand against this newly awakened threat. But despite the formation of this unprecedented league of heroes—Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg and The Flash—it may already be too late to save the planet from an assault of catastrophic proportions.</p></blockquote><p><em>Justice League</em> stars Ben Affleck as Batman, Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman, Henry Cavill as Superman, Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jason Momoa as Aquaman, Ezra Miller as The Flash, Ray Fisher as Cyborg, Jeremy Irons as Alfred Pennyworth, Diane Lane as Martha Kent, Ciarán Hinds as Steppenwolf, Jesse Eisenberg as Lex Luthor and J.K. Simmons as Commissioner Gordon. <em>Zack Snyder's Justice League </em>will premiere exclusively on HBO Max in 2021.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 18:59:12 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Fisher-Cyborg-Justice-League-Featured.jpg","linkMd5":"860287466fc59ebf59f5edb00b889f08","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn68@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-30-728_aead75e8de1925d9.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":180466,"destBytes":140810,"author":"Tim Adams","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Fisher-Cyborg-Justice-League-Featured.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn68@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-30-728_aead75e8de1925d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989073},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The Reverse-Flash Reveals His Final Plan to Destroy Barry Allen","link":"https://www.cbr.com/reverse-flash-final-plan-barry-allen/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/The-Flash-Reverse-Flash-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-flash/\">The Flash</a> #760, by Joshua Williamson, Christian Duce, Scott Kolins, Luis Guerrero, Hi-Fi and Steve Wands, on sale now.</strong></em></p><p>There is no villain that has left a greater impact and steered the entire course of Barry Allen's life than Eobard Thawne, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/reverse-flash/\">Reverse Flash</a>. Growing up in the far future as an obsessive fan of the Flash, Thawne's mind snapped when he learned that he was destined to become his greatest nemesis. This culminated in the evil speedster traveling back in time to Barry's childhood, murdering his mother Nora Allen and framing his father Henry for the crime. With their feud having continued to escalate ever since, the Reverse Flash has finally realized his lifelong fantasy of becoming his childhood hero by <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-reverse-flash-greatest-dream/\">possessing Barry's body</a> while leaving his consciousness stranded inside of the Speed Force.</p><p>While masquerading as the Scarlet Speedster around Central City, with the general public none the wiser about the true identity of the man behind the mask, it becomes evident that Thawne's body swap is not permanent. As Max Mercury helps Barry acclimate to the pocket dimension and navigate his way out to regain control of the body, Thawne realizes his grip on his new form is slipping. Assembling the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/reverse-flash-legion-of-zoom-roster/\">Legion of Zoom</a> in Central City's cemetery, the Reverse Flash issues a particular macabre order to the villainous ensemble: Unearth the corpse of Nora Allen from her grave.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-johnny-quick-status/\">The Flash Confirms the Status of a Classic DC Speedster</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Reverse-Flash-Nora-Allen-Grave.jpg\"/></figure><p>Thawne reveals that when he traveled back in time to change history by murdering Nora, he had inadvertently left temporal residue on her body as he killed her. While Thawne's grasp on the relative present of the DC Universe, much less his control of Barry's body, already tenuous because of his multiple deaths causing temporal paradoxes, the residue remaining on Nora's corpse would help ground Thawne to this time period and Barry's body, effectively untethering Barry's consciousness and leaving him trapped in the Speed Force for good, with Thawne's possession of his greatest foe's body complete.</p><p>The one thing that the Reverse Flash didn't count on was that the Rogues have their own strict moral code, underscoring the old axiom that there is honor among thieves. While the villains were all too eager to follow through on their longstanding grudge against the Flash, the desecration of an apparent random woman's grave is a step too far for the group; Thawne had purposefully neglected to tell his associates the Flash's true identity and his connection to the grave they were tasked with digging up. Trickster was particularly affected by the morbid assignment, tipping off the rest of the Flash Family on the Reverse Flash's scheme, with Impulse and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-jay-garrick-return-reverse-flash/\">Jay Garrick leading the charge</a> to stop Thawne's plot from coming to fruition giving Barry the time he needed to regain control of his body.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/flash-impulse-greatest-failure/\">The Flash Twists the Knife in Impulse's Greatest Failure</a></span></p><p>The opening salvo of the Reverse Flash's plan had gone off without a hitch, with the Legion of Zoom systematically <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-flash-legion-zoom-first-attack/\">dismantling every aspect of Barry Allen's life</a> before ambushing him and aiding Eobard Thawne in seizing control of his body. However, in a twisted move harkening back to Thawne's most heinous crime of murdering Barry's mother, the Reverse Flash's plan quickly began to unravel as his associates became leery at the twisted lengths the villainous speedster would go to complete his revenge. Barry is back in the driver's seat of his own body while the Reverse Flash has been expelled back into his own. And as the battle lines are drawn, it's clear that this feud will be brought to its explosive conclusion here and now.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/flash-speed-metal-wally-west-wrap-up/\">The Flash: Speed Metal Will Wrap Up Wally West's Rebirth Story</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 17:20:37 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/The-Flash-Reverse-Flash-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"00a65823ab0eadb9deafb1b3da621e99","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn26@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-199_3f17cc63fb2d2cdb.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":145350,"destBytes":145350,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/The-Flash-Reverse-Flash-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn26@2020_1/2020/09/05/06-56-29-199_3f17cc63fb2d2cdb.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Reverse-Flash-Nora-Allen-Grave.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn94@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-40-108_52c78a18aeecc026.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989075},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Cosplayer Enji Night Talks Upcoming Game Slide Stars | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/cosplayer-enji-night-talks-slide-stars/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/enji-night-slidestars-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>With over 900,000 followers on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CAx6UgLlaAk/\">Instagram</a>, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/enji-night/\">Enji Night</a> is one of the biggest names in cosplay right now. As a cosplayer, Night has brought a lot of different characters to life, including Elastigirl, from <em>The Incredibles</em>; Jill Valentine, from <em>Resident Evil</em>; and Android 18, from <em>Dragon Ball Z</em>. It's no wonder, then, that Lion Castle Entertainment and Triangle Studios reached out to her for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/slide-stars/\">Slide Stars</a>. In <em>Slide Stars</em>, players choose from more than 20 internet celebrities and take them through some intense water slides in which they must dodge obstacles.</p><p>CBR talked with Enji Night via email about her history with video games, cosplay and her reaction and feelings about joining <em>Slide Stars</em>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/pokemon-go-mega-evolution-explained/\">Pokémon GO: Mega Evolution, Explained</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Slide-Stars-NSW-Box-1.png\"/></figure><p><strong>How did you initially get into cosplay?</strong></p><p><strong>Enji Night:</strong> Well ever since I was young I was a big fan of anime and video games, I always thought the characters looked so cool! Around that same time, I would attend conventions to be around dorks of similar interests, but to my surprise, there were tons of other people there in costume too! It wasn't until a couple cons later that I decided to try to cosplay too. Out of some miracle, my first time cosplaying, I also won the judges favorite award in their cosplay competition! I've been hooked ever since. My most favorite part is the creative process of designing and putting together the costumes. I even went to college to learn design and drafting to help with my cosplay career. You could say I majored in cosplay.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/EnjiNight.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong>For you, what was your entry point into gaming? What made you fall in love with it?</strong></p><p><strong>Night:</strong> I got into gaming a bit later in my days because my family didn't believe in technology growing up. I was forced to go into the woods and play with the plants and wild animals. So going from innocently playing with the wildlife in the woods to shooting the wildlife in video games from the comfort of my cozy room was such an immediate \"fall in love\" moment. [...] My first game was actually <em>Ragnarok Online</em>! It basically stole my life and became my addiction. So long social life, amiright boys? After that I moved onto the next life-stealer, which was <em>wow</em>, and have been pinging from game to game like a true addict.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-canceled-game-concept-art/\">Unreleased Batman Game Designs Introduce a Red-Eyed Dark Knight and a Killer King Shark</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Android18.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong>How did the opportunity to work on Slide Stars come about?</strong></p><p><strong>Night:</strong> They \"SLID\" into my DMs. ;) ;) ;)</p><p><strong>When you've spent so much of your time dressing up as characters, how does it feel to actually be in a video game as a character?</strong></p><p><strong>Night:</strong> First it was shocking, then it was unreal. I always was looking at characters from games to cosplay, never would I expect to be a character in one! And then you suddenly realize that now technically, other people can cosplay me! (Also I'm just happy I'm in a chill side scrolling game and not in a <em>Call of Duty</em> game, because I don't know how I'd feel seeing myself get shot over and over.)</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mtg-zendikar-rising-showcases-legendary-creatures/\">Magic: The Gathering - Zendikar Rising Showcases Exciting Legendary Creatures</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/BlackCat-calendar-kicsi.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong>What was your reaction the first time you saw your character?</strong></p><p><strong>Night:</strong> I've seen lots of fanart of myself and everything, but I've never had anyone actually take the time to 3D render me and reimagine me as a video game character. I mean, I've always tried to make myself as a <em>Sims</em> character, but my creations always look like monsters. Lion Castle Entertainment really outdid themself in the design department, because they made me look damn good.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Elastigirl1-kicsi.png\"/></figure><p><strong>What's been your experience with Slide Stars so far?</strong></p><p><strong>Night:</strong> So far, everyone has been very pleasant, very accommodating, and extremely nice to me. I wouldn't want to work with any other group of people and I can guarantee that Lion Castle Entertainment created a homerun with <em>Slide Stars</em>!. Oh and well they also sent me flowers to check in on me, because I had been accidentally ghosting them in my emails. (I’m sorry everyone, I'm alive and well, I swear!)</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xbox-series-x-tokyo-game-show-no-new-announcements/\">Xbox Says No Series X Announcements at Tokyo Game Show</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Jill2-kicsi.png\"/></figure><p><strong>Is there anything else you’d like to add or say about the game?</strong></p><p><strong>Night:</strong> Well of course, the game is building up to be a nice pastime couch sitter to play when you just want to chill and relax at home. You'll be able to play as 20+ social media stars (but you’d all better only play as ME muahahahah.) There's gonna be a ton of different insane and crazy rides and slides to play through. You all need to keep an eye out for it's release this holiday season on Xbox, PS4, Switch and PC!</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Gwen1-kicsi.png\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://slide-stars.com/\">Slide Stars</a> </em><em>will release later this year on PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch and Xbox One. </em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/madden-nfl-21-review-roundup/\">Madden NFL '21 Review Roundup</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 22:10:41 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Warner Bros. Alleges Ray Fisher Has Not Cooperated with Justice League Abuse Investigation","link":"https://www.cbr.com/warner-bros-ray-fisher-justice-league-response/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/ray-fisher-justice-league2.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>UPDATE: The original headline for this article was based on a misreading of Warner Bros.' statement, which can be read in its entirety below.</strong></em></p><p>In response to the claims that actor Ray Fisher has made about abusive behavior on the set of <a href=\"http://www.cbr.com/tag/justice-league-film\"><em>Justice League</em></a> from Joss Whedon, Jon Berg and Geoff Johns, Warner Bros. has issued a statement, alleging that Fisher has failed to cooperate with the investigation thus far.</p><p>Fisher, who played Victor Stone/Cyborg in <em>Justice League</em>, first <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-ray-fisher-joss-whedon-abused-cast-crew/\">tweeted his complaints</a> about Whedon in July. Whedon had taken over direction of the film when Zack Snyder had to leave due to a family tragedy.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ray-fisher-dc-films-president-recant-accusations-geoff-johns/\">Ray Fisher Says DC Films President Asked Him to Recant Accusations Against Geoff Johns</a></span></p><p>Fisher later accused Geoff Johns of threatening his career, and referred to both him and Jon Berg as Whedon's \"enablers\". In August, he revealed that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-ray-fisher-says-whedon-johns-under-invesitgation/\">his claims were being investigated</a> by WarnerMedia. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ray-fisher-dc-films-president-recant-accusations-geoff-johns/\">More recently</a>, Fisher claimed that DC Films President Walter Hamada attempted to \"throw\" Whedon and Berg \"under the bus\" in an effort to get Fisher to relent regarding his claims against Johns.</p><p>Warner Bros.' full statement follows.</p><blockquote><p>\"In July, Ray Fisher’s representatives asked DC Films President Walter Hamada to talk to Mr. Fisher about his concerns during the production of Justice League. The two had previously spoken when Mr. Hamada asked him to reprise his role as Cyborg in Warner Bros.' upcoming Flash movie, together with other members of the Justice League.</p><p>\"In their July conversation, Mr. Fisher recounted disagreements he’d had with the film’s creative team regarding his portrayal of Cyborg, and complained that his suggested script revisions were not adopted. Mr. Hamada explained that creative differences are a normal part of the production process, and that a film’s writer/director ultimately has to be in charge of these matters.</p><p>\"Notably, Mr. Hamada also told Mr. Fisher that he would elevate his concerns to WarnerMedia so they could conduct an investigation. At no time did Mr. Hamada ever 'throw anyone under the bus,' as Mr. Fisher has falsely claimed, or render any judgments about the Justice League production, in which Mr. Hamada had no involvement, since filming occurred before Mr. Hamada was elevated to his current position.</p><p>\"While Mr. Fisher never alleged any actionable misconduct against him, WarnerMedia nonetheless initiated an investigation into the concerns he’d raised about his character’s portrayal. Still not satisfied, Mr. Fisher insisted that WarnerMedia hire an independent third party investigator.</p><p>\"This investigator has attempted multiple times to meet with Mr. Fisher to discuss his concerns but, to date, Mr. Fisher has declined to speak to the investigator. Warner Bros. remains committed to accountability and to the well-being of every cast and crew member on each of its productions. It also remains committed to investigating any specific and credible allegation of misconduct, which thus far Mr. Fisher has failed to provide.\"</p></blockquote><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-hbo-max-debunks-september-2021-release-date/\">Justice League: HBO Max Debunks Rumored September 2021 Release Date</a></span></p><p>(via <a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/justice-league-ray-fisher-joss-whedon-abuse-allegations-warner-bros-investigation-1234571413/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 04:08:02 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/ray-fisher-justice-league2.jpg","linkMd5":"0147ffcd4f95d0bde6da2086cc9d4c8a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn97@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-666_2abb151a80480578.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":88608,"destBytes":88608,"author":"Mira Jacobs","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/ray-fisher-justice-league2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn97@2020_3/2020/09/05/06-56-31-666_2abb151a80480578.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989060},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"The Wolverine Is Now Available on Disney+ | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-wolverine-available-disney-plus/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/the-wolverine-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>One of 20th Century Fox's <em>X-Men</em> films has officially made its debut on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/disney-plus\">Disney+</a>. The 2013 <em>X-Men</em> spinoff, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-wolverine\">The Wolverine</a>, starring Hugh Jackman as the Adamantium-laced X-Man, is now streaming on the Disney platform.</p><p><em>The Wolverine</em> joins A<em>ncient China from Above (Season 1)</em>, <em>D2: The Mighty Ducks</em>, <em>D3: The Mighty Ducks</em>, <em>Never Been Kissed</em>, <em>Strange Magic</em>, <em>Trick or Treat</em> and the live-action <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mulan\">Mulan</a> as the newest additions to Disney+ on Sept. 4. <em>Mulan</em> will only be available to subscribers who upgrade to the Disney+ Premier Access package for the price of $29.99.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/everything-coming-to-disney-plus-september-2020/\">Everything Coming To Disney+ September 2020</a></span></p><p>Opinions on <em>The Wolverine</em> were mixed between fans and critics. The overall consensus was the film improved upon 2009's <em>X-Men Origins: Wolverine</em>, though <a href=\"https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_wolverine_2012\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Rotten Tomatoes</a> scores <em>The Wolverine</em> at 71% on the Tomatometer, with an Audience Score of 69%.</p><p>The synopsis for <em>The Wolverine</em> can be found below.</p><p><em>The Wolverine returns and faces his ultimate nemesis in an action packed life-or-death battle that takes him to modern day Japan. Vulnerable for the first time and pushed to his physical and emotional limits, Logan confronts not only lethal samurai steel but also his inner struggle against his own immortality; an epic fight that will leave him forever changed.</em></p><p>Directed by James Mangold, <em>The Wolverine</em> stars Hugh Jackman, Famke Janssen, Hiroyuki Sanada, Tao Okamoto, Rila Fukushima and Will Lee. The film is now streaming on Disney +.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wolverine-captain-america-ice-nightmare/\">Wolverine Just Lived Through Captain America's Worst Nightmare</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 04 Sep 2020 17:45:15 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/the-wolverine-header.jpg","linkMd5":"eafe51d687b757c4699f409175ea5880","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn68@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-31-566_685eacd5a061d861.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1000,"sourceBytes":217488,"destBytes":217488,"author":"Tim Adams","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/the-wolverine-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn68@2020_4/2020/09/05/06-56-31-566_685eacd5a061d861.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599288989076},{"createdTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","updatedTime":"2020-09-05 14:56:29","title":"Marvel: Can Thor Fly Without Mjolnir? (& 9 Other Questions Answered)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-can-thor-fly-without-mjolnir-9-other-questions-answered/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/rsz-thor-flyingv1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Marvel is one of the biggest franchises of all time. With tens of thousands published comics, millions of fans, and multiple movies and TV shows made, <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/marvel\">Marvel</a> is here to stay. Even when one doesn't read the comics, they still have a large selection of stories to choose from - novel adaptations, computer games, and, of course, films and movies, not just those from the MCU.</p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-gods-trivia-facts/\">10 Things Most Marvel Fans Don’t Know About The Gods</a></span></p><p>However, the abundance of the material available can also sometimes lead to confusion among the audience. There are so many questions people ask themselves about <a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/thor\">Thor</a> and while some of these questions might seem easy or even too simple, the answer usually isn't as obvious as it might look at first glance.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Where Does Thor Live?</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/thor-bifrost-asgard.jpg' /></figure><p>Unlike some of his fellow superheroes who mostly stick to New York, Thor is a well-traveled man. However, even though he spends a significant amount of time on Earth, fighting alongside the Avengers, Thor's first real home will always be Asgard.</p><p>Thanks to the Bifrost, it connected Thor with other realms and allowed him to roam around. And as seen in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-thor-right-wrong-marvel/\">MCU</a>, when Thor's not on Asgard, he stays in the Stark/Avengers Tower.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>What Is Thor A God Of?</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/thor-the-god-of-thunder.jpg' /></figure><p>Every Marvel fan will know that Thor is a God of Thunder which comes in handy when fighting his enemies. However, his role is more complicated than that. Generally speaking, Thor isn't just associated with thunder, he's a sky god.</p><p>He also closely connects to other aspects of nature, such as lightning, storms, and also sacred groves and trees and protecting humanity. That's what makes him such a good superhero.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Is Thor Stronger Than Hulk?</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/DISPLATE-Hulk-and-Thor.jpg' /></figure><p>Fans often like to wonder which one of their favorite superheroes is stronger and would win in a fight. That's also the case for Thor and Hulk. Everybody could saw how their match turned out in <em>Thor: Ragnarok </em>(2017), but who is actually stronger? Thor possesses godlike strength which means his strength level is beyond the charts. Hulk has superhuman strength but Thor's base strength is larger.</p><p>Stan Lee himself provided the answer to this question when he mentioned that even though Hulk is incredibly strong, he's still mortal, which gives Thor an advantage over him. Plus, Thor has better control over his mind when the enraged Hulk does which allows him to come up with a better strategy.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Can Thor Beat Superman?</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/06.-TEAM-Thor-Superman-vs-Thor-JLA-Avengers.jpg' /></figure><p>Another superhero match that the audience and readers like to wonder about is Thor vs. Superman. Both of these superheroes are incredibly strong. However, Thor once again has something that gives him an edge over the Man of Steel.</p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-thor-costumers-love-hate/\">Thor: 5 Costumes That We Love (&#38; 5 That We Hate)</a></span></p></p><p>While he usually doesn't use magic, he could choose to do so to exploit Superman's big weakness - his reliance on the solar energy of the Earth's Sun. If Thor manages to deprive Superman of the energy, he's in for a certain win.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Is Thor An Avenger?</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Avengers-1-cover-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Thor has fought alongside the Avengers many times before but he also stood against them more than once. His origin makes him somewhat different than most of his fellow superheroes - so much so that many people wonder whether Thor is an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/thor-avengers-marvel-comics-overrated-underrated-superhero-comparison/\">Avenger</a> at all. The answer is - yes.</p><p>Thor did join the Avengers, albeit he did so in a different way in the comics and in the movies. In the MCU, Thor joins forces with the Avengers after he realizes they're both on the same side and want to stop <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/loki-vs-thor-villains-win-lose-marvel/\">Loki</a>. In the original comics, Thor is one of the founding members of the superhero team alongside Iron Man, Hulk, Ant-Man (Hank Pym), and the Wasp. And who did they fight? Loki, once again.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>How Old Is Thor?</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Thor.jpg' /></figure><p>As it was already established, Thor is a God of Thunder which means he stands above mortal people. He's also one of the oldest Marvel superheroes.</p><p>The answer differs based on the source material. Thor himself provides a clear answer in <em>Avengers: Infinity War </em>when he states that he's 1500 years old. In the comics, he could very well be even a few centuries older, since the first reported sign of Thor in the mythology comes from the Roman Empire.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>How Tall Is Thor?</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Thor-1-1.jpg' /></figure><p>Thor is a physically imposing man whose mere presence can bring fear to the hearts of his enemies. It doesn't hurt that besides his considerable <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/comic-book-favorite-heroes-confusing-powers/\">powers</a>, he's tall as well. But how tall is Thor?</p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-thor-best-worst-versions/\">Thor: 5 Best Versions Of The God Of Thunder (&#38; The 5 Worst)</a></span></p></p><p>The Marvel Encyclopedia states that Thor's official height is 6ft 6inch or 198 cm which makes him taller than most humans. He's supposed to weigh 640 pounds. On the other hand, Chris Hemsworth, who plays Thor in the MCU, is 'only' 6ft 3inch tall.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Who Are Thor's Siblings?</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/thor-mjolnir-loki-captain-america.jpg' /></figure><p>Thor's complicated relationships with his siblings are a well-known fact. His brother Loki has spent a lot of time causing trouble for Thor. And there's also his powerful sister <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/thor-cate-blanchett-hela-comparison-comics/\">Hela</a> who appeared in <em>Thor: Ragnarok</em>.</p><p>However, Thor has a different set of siblings in mythology. For example, one of his brothers is Balder, who's a half-brother of Thor. Balder is then the god of light, joy, sun, and purity.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Who Else Can Lift Thor's Hammer?</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/captain-america-mjolnir-avengers-endgame.jpg' /></figure><p>Whoever is worthy, shall wield the power of Mjolnir. Or something along these lines, anyway. This means that Thor isn't the only one who can lift Mjolnir. The fans collectively cheered when Captain America was able to lift Thor's hammer in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/how-did-tony-stark-get-stones-questions-about-avengers-endgame-explained/\">Avengers: Endgame</a></em>. But he's not the only superhero who has ever achieved this, not by a long shot. In the comics, other people have lifted Thor's hammer.</p><p>The list includes Beta Ray Bill, Hulk, Magneto, and Loki. Even some DC superheroes got their chance to lift Mjolnir and prove their worth this way, most notably Superman and Wonder Woman.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Can Thor Fly Without Mjolnir?</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/thor-flying-display-1.jpg' /></figure><p>Finally, it's time to address the elephant in the room - or the Norse god in the air? The answer can be found in the comics, but once again, it's a bit more complicated. Thor has been shown flying without <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-thor-mjolnir-creative-uses/\">Mjolnir</a> in the comics but the creators aren't very consistent when it comes to his powers.</p><p>What's clear, on the other hand, is that Thor can jump and leap very well which can make him look like he's flying. Considering the inconsistencies, the most likely answer is - no, Thor shouldn't be able to fly without Mjolnir. That he does it sometimes anyway - well, that's a whole different story.</p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-thor-best-romantic-partners/\">Every Love Interest Of Thor, Ranked From Worst To Best</a></span></p></p>\n                        \n
